6:25.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM, Good in places (GoingStick 6.8) (Watering)

runners.name: First Folio
runners.comment: Yarmouth winner last autumn and might have needed reappearance; not ruled out
runners.spotlight: Not as good as he was but he still won at Yarmouth (6f, good to firm; eyeshields first time) last autumn; might have needed the run at Newmarket on reappearance; encounters optimum conditions here and not ruled out.

quotes.race: Pavers Foundation Catherine Memorial Sprint Handicap (Heritage Handicap)
quotes.quote: I'm thrilled, this has been the plan since First Folio won at Yarmouth very impressively, with Newmarket on the way. The faster ground definitely helped him out today and we made sure we got him out of the stalls. Credit to Dan, he gave him a very cool ride - James Ferguson, trainer.  This horse probably lacked a bit of experience in a big field last time and I wasn't disappointed with the way he went through the race - his finishing position didn't reflect how well he ran - Daniel Muscutt, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He is a lovely horse and something of a stable stalwart with three wins under his belt. Although he is consistent he is also still progressive and will run at Kempton on Wednesday. I think he can prove he is able to compete in big handicaps at the top level. I would love to have him teed up for a Wokingham or something of that ilk. He has a lot of faith and stiff 6f races suit him perfectly, but he stays 7f and later this year he could get possibly get even further. 29-03-23

runners.name: It Just Takes Time
runners.comment: Three wins last autumn; only tenth of 13 at Thirsk on return and may again be vulnerable
runners.spotlight: Revitalised when returned to 7f+ last autumn, winning three times including here; however, he was only tenth of 13 at Thirsk (16-1) on reappearance and may again be vulnerable off the same mark.

quotes.race: Virgin Bet Training Series Final Apprentice Handicap (Part Of The Racing Excellence Series) (Div II)
quotes.quote: It Just Takes Time made it look easy and relished the ground. It slowed the others down but he's a very simple ride. I popped him out and drop the hands and that's his style. He hits a flat spot but never gives up. He's very game - Olivia Tubb, jockey.

quotes.race: Joe Rowntree Memorial Handicap
quotes.quote: It Just Takes Time is still progressing now we have found out how we can keep him settled down. He did that well enough. That was the perfect distance and a sharp 7f suits him well - Jack Garritty, jockey.

runners.name: Silver Samurai
runners.owner: What A Time To Be Alive 1
runners.comment: Most recent win came here; shaped as if needing run on reappearance; should be spot-on now
runners.spotlight: Seven-time winner whose most recent success came over 7f here last June; gave the impression the run was needed when fifth of seven at Southwell five weeks ago; at least as effective at 6f and should be spot-on today, with cheekpieces fitted for just the second time.

quotes.race: JenningsBet Grey Horse Handicap
quotes.quote: The race worked out perfectly for Silver Samurai as I was able to smuggle him into the race and he has that one kick that proved decisive -  Andrea Atzeni, rider.

quotes.race: Coolmore Stud Handicap
quotes.quote: Silver Samurai has ability and has been unlucky. It's important to get the timing right with him. He has a strong finish, but sometimes the pace isn't quick enough for him. Nice six-furlong handicaps will be the plan and we'll enter in the Wokingham and see; he handled the track well there last week - Marco Botti, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He is a horse I have always liked and he has done well, winning four times. In fact his win last time out at Newbury maintained his record of winning each season he has raced. He ran well at Ascot earlier this month and seemed so well we felt he should go to Newbury for the Class 2 handicap earlier this month. We have learned that 6f is his trip as they got that stride faster over that trip and he loves to travel in his races. He showed a wonderful turn of foot to win off a mark of 88 and has gone up to 92 now, but I suspect I need a further 5lb if he is to make it into the Wokingham at Royal Ascot. We have a few options for him in the next week or two, notably at Haydock this weekend or Epsom the following week. If things worked out and he won and made it then Royal Ascot would be a great day out, but if not there will be more good days for him this year, particularly now we have finally worked out his trip. 25-05-22

runners.name: Dorney Lake
runners.comment: Cosy Yarmouth winner on stable debut; 6lb rise does not look insurmountable
runners.spotlight: All wins have come at 6f on sound surface; posted personal best on stable debut three weeks ago, quickening well to score in clearcut fashion at Yarmouth; may still be unexposed and 6lb rise does not look insurmountable.

runners.name: Almarada Prince
runners.comment: Wolverhampton scorer towards end of 2024; reappears for new trainer having been gelded
runners.spotlight: Won four times (5f/6f) for Craig Lidster, most recently at Wolverhampton towards the end of last year; has been gelded since last seen; not discounted with new trainer among the winners; worth a market check.

runners.name: Kodi Lion
runners.owner: Mrs J M Hadley & Mrs E Cash Racing
runners.comment: Pleasing start for new yard when sixth at Thirsk; drop back in trip is a plus; big chance
runners.spotlight: Progressive for Charlie Fellowes last year, winning twice, and made an encouraging reappearance when sixth of 13 at Thirsk (7f, good; raced freely, lost three places inside final 1f) two weeks ago; dropping back in distance looks a sensible move and he still has untapped potential; big chance.

stable_tour.quote: He's the most progressive horse in our yard. He won at Ascot and ran really well at two Racing League meetings recently. We'll aim for a nice handicap on a straight track over a mile and I'd be disappointed if he didn't win again. He's got a lot more left in front of him. 11-09-24

runners.name: Flying Fletcher
runners.comment: Latest AW run was much better than bare result but yet to show he's as effective on grass
runners.spotlight: In and out during recent AW campaign but latest ninth of 13 at Newcastle was much better than it looks on paper (repeatedly met trouble); dangerous if returning to best but yet to show he's as effective on grass.

runners.name: Count Dorsay
runners.comment: Hardy veteran; four wins last season; may be best watched after six months off
runners.spotlight: Hardy veteran who notched four wins last season, the last of them in clearcut style at Catterick (6f, soft; just as effective on good) in October; however, he's come on for his reappearance in the last few seasons and may be best watched after six months off.

quotes.race: EMS Copiers Supporting Kildare Chamber Maiden
quotes.quote: Count D'Orsay is very hard to place over five furlongs here. He goes to the July sales now and is probably off a very good mark looking at that - Charles O'Brien, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He loves soft ground and I'll definitely try him over an easy six furlongs this season; he runs through the line well over five. He ran really well over five and a half in the Portland last year and that will be a good race for him again. 02-05-22

runners.name: Smart Vision
runners.owner: J E Abbey And New Vision Bloodstock
runners.comment: Front-runner who goes well here; reappeared over inadequate 5f; leading contender
runners.spotlight: Front-runner who scored three times in 2024; all those wins came over 7f but he seems just as effective at 6f and he has a good record here; shaped well over an inadequate 5f at Beverley on reappearance and that run should have blown away the cobwebs; not fully exposed and should go well.

runners.name: Call To Action
runners.owner: D Scott, Resdev, Capla Dev & L Westwood
runners.comment: Lightly raced; ran as if amiss on handicap debut; off 11 months since; retains potential
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced 4yo; won maiden at Newcastle (5f, AW) in January 2024 when trained by Kevin Ryan and made satisfactory start for current stable when second in novice at Nottingham (6f, good) last spring; ran as if amiss on handicap debut next time but has had 11 months off and retains potential.

runners.name: Oriental Prince
runners.comment: 6-9 in hood; shaped well when fourth last time; big player returned to sprint distances
runners.spotlight: Has a record of 6-9 since wearing a hood; the wins have come on the AW but he showed he's just as effective on turf with creditable fourth of eight at Musselburgh two weeks ago; 7f might have stretched his stamina that day and he's a big player returned to sprint distances.

stable_tour.quote: He's a homebred and we're hoping maybe he'll do what Eternal Sunshine has done. He's matured a lot and I've given him time. He's had four runs and we'll probably give him a few runs on the all-weather, but I don't think we'll have a hard campaign with him. We'll see how he progresses but he should be a nice horse to follow next year. I hate to saddle him with it but he'd be my dark horse. 02-10-24

7:00.race_name: Play At The Races Stableduel Fillies' Handicap
7:00.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM, Good in places (GoingStick 6.8) (Watering)

runners.name: May Blossom
runners.breeder: J A Knox And Mrs M A Knox
runners.owner: Ursa Major Racing Ltd & Julie Camacho
runners.comment: Only 2lb higher than for Pontefract win last summer but three runs after were below par
runners.spotlight: Only 2lb higher than when scoring at Pontefract (6f, good to firm) last summer but three subsequent runs were well below par; has no great record after a break so probably best watched on reappearance.

stable_tour.quote: A good filly whio won well at Pontefract and she could go for the Marygate at York on Friday. 10-05-21

She ran a cracker when dropped down to 5f last time at Carlisle and ran on very strongly to finish third behind Angel Shared on what was her third run of the season. She doesn't have any forthcoming entries but I think she'll be winning before too long. 14-06-24

runners.name: Sea Emily Run
runners.comment: Fourth in 2yo Listed event; improvement required now handicapping but that's possible
runners.spotlight: Had four runs as a 2yo, all over 6f, winning Goodwood novice (good to soft) and running well when fourth in Newmarket Listed event (good); hardly looks thrown in for her handicap debut but she's low-mileage and probably capable of better.

runners.name: Raneenn
runners.comment: Down the field in two Listed races but now in handicap and returning to sprinting may help
runners.spotlight: Won twice in maiden/novice company (6f) in second half of 2024 before coming up short in York Listed event last October; still looked unexposed but she pulled hard and faded in another Listed race at Lingfield (7f) on return; requires a personal best but returning to sprinting may help.

runners.name: Mostar Dreams
runners.owner: J Fyffe, A Edmondson & L Mcgurty
runners.comment: Won at Carlisle last June and placed off higher marks afterwards; now returns for new yard
runners.spotlight: Kept busy last year when trained by Iain Jardine, winning at Carlisle (7f, soft) in June and placed off higher marks three times afterwards (all at 6f); still looks handily treated on her return from nearly seven months off, so it all depends on how she reacts to a change of stable.

stable_tour.quote: She was too backward to run at two and patience has paid off as she has run some nice races. She came there cruising last time and didn't go through with it but she was going through a growing spurt and we eased off her a bit. She's a big, strong filly who's getting heavier, which is a sign she's growing and thriving. She wants soft ground and I wouldn't rule out running her on the all-weather. 26-07-24

runners.name: Beronia
runners.comment: Ready win at Ayr last autumn; still has untapped potential and might be the answer
runners.spotlight: Shaped well several times before putting everything together to score at Ayr (7f, good; first-time tongue-strap) last autumn and she's probably best forgiven a below-par run on soft ground at the Arc meeting just two weeks later; still has untapped potential back in a handicap; might be the answer.

quotes.race: Livescore Bet Fillies' Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: Beronia definitely got stronger as she's gone on, her form is quite good from her earlier starts and I really liked her when I rode her in her first couple of races. She's benefited from 7f and being ridden slightly differently and she got the job done well. The tongue tie helped. She's definitely got a lot of ability - Billy Loughnane, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: She was a good winner at Ayr last year and then we tried to run her in a big pot at Longchamp and nothing went right. We put a line through it and she's back and in good form. I think a mile looks about right. 07-04-25

runners.name: Miss Collada
runners.comment: Had productive 2yo campaign, winning three times; more required to make successful return
runners.spotlight: Had a productive 2yo campaign, winning three times including at Kempton (7f nursery) in November; might have been over the top when last of nine there the following month but she'll need another chunk of improvement if she's to make a successful return.

runners.name: Galaxy Zoo
runners.comment: Lightly raced; came from rear to win at Wolverhampton on stable debut; unexposed
runners.spotlight: Thrice-raced 3yo; half-sister to several winners for Ralph Beckett and she made an immediate impact for the same yard (previously trained by Tom Ward) when coming from the rear to win maiden at Wolverhampton (5f) three weeks ago; should be at least as effective at 6f, so as long as she handles the new surface on turf debut she'll be a danger to all.

runners.name: Dark Rosa
runners.comment: Won 2yo maiden for George Boughey; bit disappointing next time and needs to hit a new high
runners.spotlight: Best effort for George Boughey as a 2yo when winning maiden at Pontefract (6f, good to soft) in the autumn; didn't repeat the form in nursery over the same C&D and she was subsequently sold for 40,000gns; needs to hit a new high on her first outing for Mark Rimell.

5:50.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM, Good in places (GoingStick 6.8) (Watering)

runners.name: Alfareqa
runners.comment: Expensive and very well bred; squeezed out start on debut; could improve significantly
runners.spotlight: The first foal of Cheveley Park Stakes winner Millisle and cost 1,600,000gns as a yearling; never a factor on debut at Kempton (7f; 7-2) in December after being squeezed out at the start, but she went off second favourite and could improve significantly with the run under her belt.

runners.name: Doctor Dauila
runners.comment: Soon behind at 50-1 on debut; looks more of a long-term prospect
runners.spotlight: Soon behind at 50-1 on debut; looks more of a long-term prospect.

runners.name: Invisible
runners.owner: H R D Mccalmont & H Lascelles
runners.comment: Second at Chelmsford six weeks ago when 100-1; further improvement on the cards
runners.spotlight: Met trouble on debut and stepped up markedly when second of ten at Chelmsford (7f) six weeks ago; was 100-1 that day but there seemed no fluke about it whatsoever; with further improvement on the cards she's a major player.

runners.name: Kinswoman
runners.comment: In frame in two 6f maidens; bred to stay this extra furlong; remains open to improvement
runners.spotlight: Half-sister to the Lockinge winner Audience; hasn't looked entirely straightforward so far but she has still made the frame in two 6f maidens at Wolverhampton; bred to stay this extra furlong; remains open to improvement.

runners.name: Kodi Banphrionsa
runners.comment: Beat only two rivals in total in 2yo events at Newmarket over six months apart
runners.spotlight: Beat only two rivals in total in 2yo events at Newmarket over six months apart; probably of more interest when tackling handicaps.

runners.name: Lambournghini
runners.comment: Never better than midfield at long odds at Lingfield and Wolverhampton; hard to recommend
runners.spotlight: Never better than midfield at long odds at Lingfield and Wolverhampton; difficult to recommend.

runners.name: Noche Clasica
runners.comment: Some promise on debut and should improve but pedigree suggests longer distances will suit
runners.spotlight: Faded after leading early on when sixth of eight at Newcastle (1m; 7-1) 16 days ago; should improve but her useful pedigree suggests she may be ideally suited by longer distances in due course.

runners.name: Queens Palace
runners.comment: Twice well held at Newcastle, 250-1 on second occasion; needs to up her game markedly
runners.spotlight: Well held in two events at Newcastle, 250-1 on second occasion; needs to up her game markedly.

runners.name: Queensmaite
runners.comment: Promising staying-on third at Southwell on debut; up 2f in distance today; should improve
runners.spotlight: From a family her trainer knows very well and she shaped with some promise when third of nine over 5f at Southwell (33-1; finished well from rear) 18 days ago; up 2f in distance today; should improve.

runners.name: Shes Got Spirit
runners.comment: Bred to be useful but showed little when last of eight on debut at Thirsk last summer
runners.spotlight: Bred to be useful but she showed little when last of eight on debut at Thirsk (5f; 7-1) last summer.

runners.name: Speaktotheguvnor
runners.comment: Well held on second start last year but had previously gone close; one of likelier options
runners.spotlight: Well held at Kempton on second start last year but she'd previously gone close on debut when third at Newbury (6f, good to firm) in August; retains potential and is one of the likelier options here.

runners.name: Thanks Angel
runners.comment: Shaped nicely over C&D on debut; next run possibly came too soon; high on the list
runners.spotlight: Shaped nicely over C&D on debut last September and her sole subsequent run possibly came too soon after that; has a useful pedigree and should progress this term; high on the list.

5:15.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM, Good in places (GoingStick 6.8) (Watering)

runners.name: Pearly Squirrel
runners.owner: Alfa Site Services Ltd & Graeme Curnow

prev_owners.owner: Alfa Site Services Ltd & Graeme Curnow
Alfa Site Services Ltd & Graeme Curnow

runners.comment: Improvement on final 2yo start; has since changed trainer; still has untapped potential
runners.spotlight: Well held first two starts last year (stiff task on second of them) but showed improvement when third of ten at Beverley (5f, good; wore tongue-strap) on final run, best work late on; subsequently left Craig Lidster (same owners); bred to stay this longer trip and still has untapped potential.

runners.name: Rogue Dynasty
runners.comment: 0-4 last term; improvement required on reappearance/handicap debut
runners.spotlight: 0-4 last term, best effort when fourth of ten at Southwell (6f, AW); improvement required on reappearance/handicap debut and has to prove she handles turf (well beaten sole previous go on grass).

stable_tour.quote: Owned by The Rogues Gallery, she's a filly we bought from the Doncaster Breeze-Up who ticks a lot of boxes. She's probably going to end up being a 7f filly, but will start over six soon. 30-05-24

runners.name: Tarlac
runners.owner: Ursa Major Racing Ltd And Partner
runners.comment: Unplaced all six starts but there have been positive signs; falling in the weights; chance
runners.spotlight: Unplaced all six starts so far but there have been some positive signs, and he came from a long way back when fourth of nine at Newcastle (7f) four weeks ago; falling in the weights and Paul Mulrennan keeps the ride; chance.

runners.name: Atomic Mass
runners.comment: Has claims on third in York nursery last summer but ran poorly both starts afterwards
runners.spotlight: Has claims on his third of 13 in a York nursery (6f, good to soft) last summer but he ran poorly both starts afterwards; worth a market check after nearly eight months off.

runners.name: Francis Drake
runners.comment: In frame four of five starts, all on AW; possibilities if handling the different surface
runners.spotlight: In frame on four of five outings, all on AW; beaten a short head at Lingfield (7f) in March and might have been unsuited by the drop to 6f next time; possibilities if handling the different surface on turf debut.

runners.name: Eighteen Fourteen
runners.comment: One of the few in this field with a win, but three runs since have been poor; new headgear
runners.spotlight: One of the few in this field with a win (6f, good to firm) to his name, but three runs since have been poor, including when well beaten at 66-1 on reappearance; needs to be revived by first-time headgear.

runners.name: Queen Of Good News
runners.comment: Has shown little since two seconds last term; needs blinkers to have a galvanising effect
runners.spotlight: Runner-up over 6f/7f at Yarmouth (good to firm) last summer but she has shown little since, last of ten on seasonal debut; requires the first-time blinkers to have a galvanising effect.

runners.name: Vesperado
runners.comment: Looked tricky at Beverley on return and now has something to prove in hood/cheekpieces
runners.spotlight: Hinted at ability in three novices last term but looked very tricky in handicap at Beverley on reappearance, tailed off after pulling hard and hanging left; perhaps he was unsuited by the right-hand bend but he now has something to prove in a hood and cheekpieces.

runners.name: Sherlock
runners.comment: Signed off 2024 with poor run and fared no better on reappearance; carries obvious risks
runners.spotlight: First two handicap runs were encouraging but he was well held on his final 2yo outing and fared little better at Wolverhampton three weeks ago; represents a stable in excellent form but carries obvious risks.

runners.name: Yehudi
runners.comment: Has taken a while to reach concert pitch but last two runs have been fine; possibilities
runners.spotlight: Has taken a while to reach concert pitch but ended 2024 with a creditable third and filled the same position at Wolverhampton (7f, AW; best work late on) on reappearance; still unexposed and seems to handle turf; one of the likelier ones.

runners.name: Bantz
runners.comment: Newcastle winner; longer trip a possible excuse last time; not ruled out if handling turf
runners.spotlight: Much more experienced than most of these; won at Newcastle (7f) in January and the longer trip might have been against him last time (both runs over 1m have been poor); not ruled out if proving as effective on turf (wasn't last season for a different stable).

stable_tour.quote: He won and was placed on the all-weather at Newcastle over the winter and will be campaigned on the turf now over 7f. He wants top of the ground but he'll get that at the moment, so we'll probably see him out very soon. 23-04-25

runners.name: Dovey Moon
runners.comment: Unplaced all five starts but more promising than that sounds; still open to improvement
runners.spotlight: Unplaced all five starts but that doesn't tell the full story; 5f was inadequate on his final 2yo run and he wasn't beaten far after meeting trouble when fifth at Wolverhampton on reappearance; turf is an unknown (green and well held only previous go) but he has more potential than most of these.

runners.name: Miss Cast
runners.comment: Drew a blank in five 2yo runs but there were signs of ability; watch the market on return
runners.spotlight: Drew a blank in five 2yo outings but there were signs of ability and she shaped as if this trip would suit when third in Thirsk novice (6f, good to soft) in July; may be an improved performer at three and market support would be significant.

runners.name: Miakoda
runners.comment: Made all over this trip at Newcastle and 1m was probably against him either side of that
runners.spotlight: Hasn't convinced with his stamina in two goes over 1m but in between he made all in clearcut style over this trip at Newcastle; only 5lb higher and his rider looks good value for his claim; should be in the thick of things.

4:40.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM, Good in places (GoingStick 6.8) (Watering)

prev_owners.owner: Exors Of The Late John Marriott
Mrs John Magnier & Michael Tabor & Derrick Smith

stable_tour.quote: He had his first run for us over hurdles at Musselburgh last week and did okay, finishing fourth. He'll go back on the Flat now and is probably very well handicapped. He's the type who'll be winning at the back end of January in a 0-65 over a mile at Wolverhampton. 05-12-24

runners.name: King Of Speed
runners.comment: Third on his return to turf at Bath last time and likely to give his running again.
runners.spotlight: Most recent win came in February at Wolverhampton off 3lb lower and he returned to turf with a creditable third at Bath 22 days ago, keeping on from off the pace; likely to give his running.

runners.name: Berkshire Phantom
runners.breeder: Mountain View Stud & J C B/Stock

prev_owners.owner: Berkshire Parts & Panels Ltd No1 Fanclub

runners.comment: Has been running respectably on the AW; disappointing favourite here yesterday
runners.spotlight: Shaped better than the bare result in cheekpieces at Southwell over 7f (denied a clear run) three starts back and ran to a similar level when back in blinkers at Wolverhampton next time; returns to 1m with no headgear for first time since 2023; last June's turf win came off 8lb higher; disappointing  favourite here on Friday.

runners.name: Braes Of Doune
runners.comment: Three-time winner who was in top form when last seen; claims if he's ready to go.
runners.spotlight: Three-time winner (7f-1m2f) who is 6lb higher than when successful at Musselburgh in August (completing a double); last seen posting a career best effort at Ayr in September; claims if he's ready to go after 218 days off and he was runner-up on reappearance last season.

runners.name: Born A Rebel
runners.comment: 5lb below her sole win but needs to return to form in first-time blinkers.
runners.spotlight: 1-14, with her sole win coming off 5lb higher at Yarmouth (1m) last April; after two runs this term, she needs to return to form in first-time blinkers; visored (below form) once.

runners.name: Artificer
runners.comment: Won at Chelmsford off 4lb lower when last seen; chance if translating that form to turf
runners.spotlight: Unexposed 4yo who was in good form at Chelmsford when last seen, beaten a neck before winning there in February off 4lb lower than today; well beaten on her only go on turf but that came on soft ground on her debut; strong chance if translating her AW form to turf.

runners.name: Embarked
runners.comment: All three wins have been on AW; below form the last twice; opposable.
runners.spotlight: Can front-run; record reads 3-50, with all three of those wins coming on AW; runner-up at Yarmouth over this trip early this month but he's been below that level in both starts since; looks opposable back on turf.

7:30.race_name: Download The At The Races App Handicap
7:30.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM, Good in places (GoingStick 6.8) (Watering)

runners.name: Our Absent Friends
runners.comment: Close fourth of 12 at Musselburgh last Saturday and should be in the thick of things again
runners.spotlight: Prominent racer who won twice over this trip last September; back to form when close fourth of 12 at Musselburgh last Saturday; should be in the thick of things again.

runners.name: Honour Your Dreams
runners.comment: Consistent sort; ran well after wind surgery when second at Chelmsford; leading contender
runners.spotlight: Consistent sort who won on his stable debut at Bath (5f, good) last autumn and ran well after wind surgery when second at Chelmsford (5f, AW) last Friday; leading contender once more.

runners.name: Ancient Times
runners.comment: Often makes the frame but on a long losing run; others appeal more for win purposes
runners.spotlight: Often makes the frame but his losing run stretches back to June 2022; 5f on a sound surface is ideal and he reappears after five months on a career-low mark, but others still make a bit more appeal for win purposes.

runners.name: Betweenthesticks
runners.owner: J A Swinburne & Mrs Ruth A Carr
runners.comment: Made all at Nottingham two weeks ago; this is a stronger race and he's 2lb higher
runners.spotlight: Two wins from seven starts for new yard, making all at Nottingham (5f, good) two weeks ago; no obvious reason why he should not be thereabouts again, although this is a stronger race and he's 2lb higher.

stable_tour.quote: He's a straightforward sprinter who nearly always goes over the minimum trip. He had a busy time last year, running 12 times between May and October and winning twice. He doesn't want extremes of going and I fully expect him to win again soon. 09-04-25

prev_owners.owner: Mps Racing, The Olliers, S Perkins

stable_tour.quote: He was last of six at Doncaster last week and wasn't like he usually is. He's very genuine and has been flying at home, so I hope that effort will prove to be a one-off. He's a really likeable horse and I think he'll have a great chance wherever he ends up next. 27-07-22

runners.name: Taygar
runners.comment: Led late on at Redcar last autumn; these conditions will put the emphasis more on speed
runners.spotlight: Sprang a 28-1 surprise at Redcar on final outing last year, getting up in the final strides, but that was over 6f on soft ground; only 3lb higher today but conditions will probably put the emphasis far more on speed, even if she's fit after six months off.

stable_tour.quote: I haven't done too much with my 2yos but this filly actually won first time out for us back in April. I don't usually have many youngsters out at that time of the year but she was showing a lot of speed and won well. Her next run at Pontefract was a different story as she was too keen and gave herself no chance, while at Redcar last time out she encountered good to firm ground for the first time and although she ran well, I felt she would appreciate a little more cut. We will look to upping her in trip to 6f next and find some slower ground. 26-07-23

runners.name: Toptime
runners.comment: Led until inside final 1f when sixth over C&D last time; likely to give another bold show
runners.spotlight: Has six wins to his name and shaped quite well when sixth of 17 over C&D on return to turf, leading until inside the final 1f; likely to give another bold show from the front.

runners.name: Glendown
runners.comment: Not the easiest to predict but close second last time; chance if on a going day
runners.spotlight: Not the easiest to predict but he's back to his last winning turf mark and he ran well after three months off when close second of six at Leicester (5f, good to firm) three weeks ago; chance if on a going day.

quotes.race: Brannans Have Done The 61 Handicap (Div II)
quotes.quote: Glendown has done it quite nicely, he travelled well and picked up and just did enough to win. He ran a great race at Chester and I don't know what went wrong last time [at Hamilton] - he just ran all right. He's come here and shown he's in good form - Duran Fentiman, rider

stable_tour.quote: He won't be running until the middle of the season. There's nothing wrong with him, he was just a bit late back from his owners. He won three times over six furlongs last season, but he also ran well over five and I don't know which is his best trip. 23-04-24

runners.name: Herakles
runners.comment: Below par since last summer's win but well handicapped and hood could have positive effect
runners.spotlight: Below par since winning at Ripon (5f, good) last summer but there have been some excuses, notably when repeatedly short of room on reappearance; others have more obvious claims but he's becoming well handicapped and the first-time hood could have a positive effect.

stable_tour.quote: He's been great. He had a wind op and then won at Newcastle in January. He's pretty solid and pretty consistent. His Ripon win last time was a career-best and I'm hoping he'll progress as he gets stronger. I'd be amazed if he lasted all summer as he had a winter campaign, but he'll have a break at some stage and that could well be the making of him. He's a big, tall horse and hopefully he'll grow into something better than he is at the moment. 28-06-24

runners.name: Gis A Sub
runners.comment: Went close on return at Wolverhampton (6f), shaping as if this trip would not be a problem
runners.spotlight: Like stablemate Herakles he failed to build on a summer win at Ripon last year, but he went close on his reappearance at Wolverhampton (6f), shaping as if this drop back in trip would not be a problem; respected.

quotes.race: Al Basti Equiworld Dubai Gimcrack Stakes (Group 2) (Colts & Geldings)
quotes.quote: Goodwood was a cock-up, and it was my fault, but Gis A Sub has run a great race today. He has a huge stride and I told Kevin to let him use it. He did everything right and showed he's a very good horse. We've already had a board meeting and decided to wait until October and the Criterium de Maisons-Laffitte, a race we've won before - Kevin Ryan, trainer.

quotes.race: British Stallion Studs EBF Spindrifter Conditions Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Gis A Sub is still a bit babyish and was half pulling up in front. He'll be a better horse when getting a lead in a better race. I think there's an awful lot to come from him and races like the Gimcrack would definitely be on the agenda - Kevin Ryan, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He was a very talented two-year-old who then found it hard when he was set some big tasks last year. He's grown and strengthened again over the winter and is back down to a very workable mark now. It would be good to see him in the big Saturday handicaps. 03-05-23

This fellow has plenty of ability as he showed last year when second in the Gimcrack Stakes, but unfortunately he tends to hold a lot back for himself. He has been a bit disappointing this season but has an entry in the Commonwealth Cup and I think we will fit him with cheekpieces to try to encourage him to put his best foot forward. 15-06-22

runners.name: Opal Storm
runners.comment: Met trouble in running when fifth at Pontefract last time; each-way possibilities at least
runners.spotlight: Both wins have come over a stiff 5f on good to firm; probably needed reappearance and met trouble in running when fifth of ten at Pontefract next time; should be spot-on now and has each-way possibilities, at least.

quotes.race: Rob Burrow Dare To Dream Handicap
quotes.quote: Opal Storm likes the place but she just needs a bit of luck in running - Brian Rothwell, trainer.

2:40.race_name: Try Unibet's New Same Race Multis Handicap
2:40.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to soft in places (GoingStick 6.4) (Rail Movements: 1.30 +43yds, 2.00 & 3.15 +45yds and 2.40, 4.55 & 5.25 +23yds)

runners.name: English Oak
runners.comment: Impressive at Royal Ascot last year; inconsistent since; could go well having been gelded
runners.spotlight: Bolted up over over C&D (soft) last May and did likewise in the Buckingham Palace Handicap at Royal Ascot (7f, good to firm) next time; inconsistent in Group and Listed races subsequently but makes his reappearance having been gelded and he's a major player if at the top of his game.

quotes.race: Buckingham Palace Stakes (Handicap)
quotes.quote: English Oak is clearly a classy sort, he travelled superbly through the race. We had a massive advantage on the stands' side, even after going a furlong or so we were a long way ahead of the others. He's very speedy. He's got a high cruising speed, he does feel pretty fast. When I let him go there he quickened up pretty smartly. It will be interesting to see what the guys want to do - James Doyle, rider.

quotes.race: British EBF Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: He's a slow-maturing horse who was like a rabbit in the headlights first time. English Oak has seen the trip out really well and is definitely one to keep on the right side - P J McDonald, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: Our confidence is a little knocked after two disappointing runs since Ascot but we still think there's more to come. We felt he had a legitimate excuse in the Lennox, when he lost a shoe, and I was very confident going into the Hungerford but left disappointed. I think tactically I made a hash of it as I was worried about the lack of pace. In hindsight making the running wasn't smart. He'll probably end up going for a Listed race over seven furlongs at Newbury on September 20 and he'll hopefully get a bit of cover this time. We'll also consider the Park Stakes. 11-09-24

He was a bit disappointing after putting up such a good performance when winning the Buckingham Palace at Royal Ascot, so we hope we can get him back on track this year. He's been gelded and I hope that will help him. He's a bit behind and is taking a long time to come in his coat, so we're not in a rush with him. He'll probably start back in a conditions or Listed race. I think he's best at that specialist trip of 7f but we'll see how we go. 16-04-25

runners.name: Ramazan
runners.comment: Needs to get back on track but down to a dangerous mark and is 2-3 here; not ruled out
runners.spotlight: 0-9 last year and it was an in-and-out campaign; soundly beaten on reappearance at Musselburgh two weeks ago but he may have needed the run; on a dangerous mark on last season's best efforts and is 2-3 here; not ruled out.

quotes.race: William Hill Great St Wilfrid Handicap
quotes.quote: I was cheering for them both because they both deserved it. Ramazan really deserves one as he just got beat at Ascot earlier in the season. Ramazan must be a tough horse, over six or seven furlongs he always runs his heart out and he's probably Listed class - Robin O'Ryan, trainer's assistant.

quotes.race: Price Promise At bet365 Handicap
quotes.quote: I thought Ramazan didn't stay the mile at Ascot, but he ran a big race there. That was seven today and he might go six in time as he's from a fast family. A bit of rain would help him and he's a good hardy horse - Richard Fahey, trainer.

quotes.race: bet365 Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: It was a great run. When Ramazan ran at Ascot he had a set of blinkers and I think he just did a shade too much but without those today off that kind of mark he's done it well. His work at home is very good so I can't see why he won't progress from that - Oisin Orr, rider.

runners.name: Cerulean Bay
runners.breeder: D Ryan, D S Ryan & R A Williams
runners.comment: Last July's C&D win was the first leg of a hat-trick; could have more to offer this term
runners.spotlight: Last July's C&D win (soft) was the first leg of a hat-trick (the other wins came on good ground); fair performance in big-field handicap at Leopardstown last September when last seen (found to be lame) and this 4yo could have more to offer this term; possible contender.

quotes.race: Best Price Guaranteed Daily At Vickers.Bet Handicap
quotes.quote: All credit to Cerulean Bay, he had it all to do from that draw,. We were drawn the widest and he's off 96 now, he's high enough but he's got the right attitude. If something comes to him, he keeps going and he likes it here. There's no stopping him at the minute, he's having a great season - Danny Tudhope, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

quotes.race: EBF Stallions Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Cerulean Bay was very good. This would be his minimum trip but he's a lovely horse for the future. It felt like a good race, so it's a nice performance to give away that weight - Danny Tudhope, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He had a very good season last year. On his last run in Ireland he pulled up lame, so we feel there's still room in his mark and he can go on again. Dropping him back to seven furlongs seems to have been the making of him. He's very tough round a bend, so we'll look at the good handicaps on those tracks. 14-04-25

runners.name: Rhoscolyn

prev_owners.owner: Julie Martin & David R Martin & Partner

runners.comment: On a competitive mark but last seven wins have come on slow ground at Goodwood or Epsom
runners.spotlight: 2yo C&D winner in 2020 and he's on a competitive mark on last year's best form; likely to improve for recent reappearance run (did so last year to finish close fourth in this race on soft going) but his last seven wins have come on slow ground at Goodwood or Epsom and he may be one for another day.

quotes.race: William Hill Handicap
quotes.quote: Rhoscolyn lost his mojo a bit, but he likes Goodwood and likes that ground - Dominic McFadden, part-owner.

quotes.race: World Pool Handicap
quotes.quote: I thought it went perfectly. We'd had a bit of a look at the race earlier and thought that you would want him a little bit handier round here normally, but there looked to be a good bit of pace on. I think it's really important that Rhoscolyn gets a well-run race and he got one today. David has always been adamant that you get him in a good rhythm and more often than not, that is sitting a little bit further back, because he is a bit too keen and strong in his races. But today, he has relaxed. He jumped better than he did at Beverley when the blindfold came off a bit late, but he's a lot better if the blindfold is off before the last horse goes in. And that was my fault for not reminding the jockey last time out, to be honest. It went to plan today and I couldn't be happier - Chris Dixon, of The Horse Watchers.

quotes.race: Bet At racingtv.com EBF Novice Stakes
quotes.quote: Rhoscolyn is very smart to do that from stall ten. He's got a good temperament, he's laid back and you would imagine there would be more to come from him next year - Paul Mulrennan, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He bounced back last year, having paid the price for a good first year with us. Soft ground and seven furlongs brings out the best in him, particularly at Goodwood. He won three races from August onwards, so again he'll be starting this year with his mark right up there. He'll start back in a conditions race at Thirsk on Saturday. 19-04-24

He's been a flagbearer for us over the last three years. We bought him for a cutdown 23,000gns during Covid and he's been a revelation. He's won big races at Epsom twice, has a great record at Goodwood and has been placed at Royal Ascot. He's a top-end handicapper. Nowadays, soft ground is imperative to him having a good chance. He hasn't been running so well on ground that's been too quick for him, but he's shown time and again he can come back and win another race. He goes to Goodwood on Wednesday, provided the ground is on the soft side. He won the race last year and he's still got all his ability. 26-09-24

runners.name: Yorkshire
runners.comment: Has to transfer AW improvement back to grass but this thriving 5yo is entitled to respect
runners.spotlight: Won at Thirsk (7f, good to firm) last May and close second over this C&D (good to soft) in September on last turf start; three 7f wins from his four AW starts since; needs to transfer that improvement back to grass but this thriving 5yo is entitled to respect.

stable_tour.quote: He's a lovely, big colt who did well last year to win a 6f novice at Redcar on his second run, having shown plenty when third on his debut at Haydock. The winter break did him the world of good and he came back looking superb. He defied his penalty first time out at Southwell in March and I thought he was a good thing to follow up back there this month, but he was collared on the line. Unfortunately, despite not winning he still went up 4lb to a rating of 87. He came out of that race well and we took him to York for his first run of the year on turf. It was a step up in class to a 0-105 handicap and, although he ran a fair race, he was no match for a ­­well-handicapped winner. He's definitely one to look forward to as the year progresses. 01-06-23

runners.name: Telemark
runners.comment: All races on slow ground and inconsistent last year, but still managed two wins
runners.spotlight: Inconsistent last year (tailed off when last seen) and he's done all his racing on slow ground; however, he's very talented on his day, as when winning at Thirsk last June and at Doncaster last September; not discounted.

quotes.race: Betfred City Of Doncaster Handicap
quotes.quote: I wasn't expecting ground like that and Telemark likes it. He's always been a horse with some talent but things haven't always dropped right for him and that ground enabled him to be seen at his best. He's done it well. The key to him is to get a little bit of cover, try to get him to switch off and then he can finish his race nicely. If you watch his last run at Goodwood he put up a pretty solid effort and this hasn't come as a big surprise - but a nice one - Simon Crisford, joint-trainer.

quotes.race: Sky Bet Build A Bet Handicap
quotes.quote: Telemark was quite fancied for the Horris Hill last year, but the heavy ground and a long season took it out of him. It's really nice to see him bounce back. He's likeable and has been doing everything right at home -  Jack Mitchell, jockey.

runners.name: Blue For You
runners.comment: His last three wins have come at York and he reappears minus the usual visor
runners.spotlight: Ran well at York on last season's return and won there in July; however, good runs were in the minority last term and his last three wins have come at York; makes reappearance minus usual visor; others preferred.

quotes.race: John Smith's Racing Handicap
quotes.quote: Blue For You seems to like this track. We've tried him at Ascot a few times and it's never worked, but he's bounced back from a terrible run down there. It's horses for courses. He normally shows his best here. We'll do the same thing and go to Goodwood and then come back for the mile race here at the Ebor meeting - David O'Meara, trainer.

quotes.race: John Smith's Racing Handicap
quotes.quote: He's a very good horse who travelled really nicely. Blue For You got the openings today and at Ascot last time he boiled over before he got to the start - we were happy to draw a line through that. He does like it here and he'll come back here next month. He might do Goodwood in between as well - David O'Meara, trainer.

quotes.race: Plusvital Handicap
quotes.quote: Ble For You got a very good ride. He just found that little bit more late on. He won at Galway last year and he might go back there for a handicap - Dermot Weld, trainer.

quotes.race: Claregalwayhotel.ie Irish EBF (C & G) Maiden (Plus 10 Race)
quotes.quote: We hoped he'd run well but obviously others appeared to be in better form coming into the race. He had to improve from his first run but we were optimistic he'd handle the ground. It did look unlikely in the dip and he is still a big raw horse. He toughed it out well and has shown a good attitude and hopefully he'll be up to Stakes level - Kris Weld, assistant to Dermot Weld, trainer

stable_tour.quote: He'll run this month in preparation for York in May, which is his track. He's also run well at Goodwood, but we now know he doesn't like Ascot. He looks well and should have more life in him. 14-04-25

runners.name: Skukuza
runners.comment: Fine 2nd at Royal Ascot last June; absent since but this unexposed 4yo retains potential
runners.spotlight: All six races on good/good to firm; off the mark at Newmarket (1m) last May on second handicap start before fine second in the Britannia Handicap at Royal Ascot (1m); absent since but this unexposed 4yo retains potential and could prove to be better than his current mark.

runners.name: Thunder Roar
runners.comment: First past the post in the Spring Mile last month (demoted); slow ground may be preferable
runners.spotlight: In fine form on soft/heavy ground last autumn (went very close over C&D) and he was first past the post in the competitive Spring Mile Handicap at Doncaster last month (1m, good to soft; demoted due to interference); can go well if conditions suit (unproven on good/faster).

stable_tour.quote: He's a very nice horse and the form of his Salisbury debut worked out very well - he was on the opposite side to the winner there and it would have been a close-run thing if they'd both been together. He's a big horse who's improved for being given a bit of time and turned inside out, he's grown and put on so much weight. We'll find a maiden then step him up and we think an awful lot of him. 10-05-22

runners.name: Divine Libra
runners.comment: Often ran well last season and returns with yard among the winners; might not be far away
runners.spotlight: Often ran well last season and he's just 1lb higher than when runner-up at Chester (7.5f, good) last August; returns with his trainer among the winners and he might not be far away.

stable_tour.quote: He did well from three to four and has been in good form this season, winning at Chester's May meeting and beaten no distance at Newmarket last time. He's got an entry in the Wokingham but the Buckingham Palace over seven furlongs looks tailor-made for him. He wouldn't want it too firm and if he could just get his toe in, that should be fine. 13-06-24

He's a lightly raced colt who won over 7f first time out at Catterick this season. It was a rare runner for me there but it was the right race for him and he won like a nice horse. I didn't want to go to a big track and pick up a lofty handicap mark and that suited perfectly. I've given him an entry for the Jersey Stakes on Saturday, but he had a dirty scope last week and I‘ll have to speak to his owners before we decide whether to go. 21-06-23

runners.name: Gorak
runners.owner: D Macauliffe, Anoj Don & First Tuesday
runners.comment: Beaten on his last 13 starts but this C&D winner is capable of a bold bid from stall one
runners.spotlight: Front-runner who has been beaten on his last 13 starts going back to May 2023 (when winning over C&D); however, he ran some good races last season (including on his reappearance) and is capable of a bold bid from stall one.

quotes.race: Music Live @ Doncaster Racecourse Handicap
quotes.quote: Gorak has the action to suggest the ground would suit him. He enjoyed the track and the ground and he's pretty progressive - Callum Shepherd, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He has been a star and it was great to see him get his head in front again at Doncaster in April when bolting up over 7f by five and a half lengths off a mark of 73. I know some people felt we have probably blown our handicap chances for a while, but the handicapper was fair in putting him up 5lb. Despite finishing second in his last two races, I feel he is still on an attractive mark. At Chester last time he just got caught for a turn of foot as they turned for home, but I was greatly encouraged by how he stayed on when they straightened up. He is consistent and, if the ground remains on the soft side, then he will be a fun little horse who can add more wins to our tally for the year. 28-05-23

runners.name: Myal
runners.comment: Lightly raced 4yo who is progressive and has won twice over C&D; firmly in calculations
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced 4yo who won four times last August-October, including twice over C&D (good to firm/heavy); reappeared with close third in the Spring Mile at Doncaster (1m, good to soft) four weeks ago and this drop back to 7f may well be the right move for the time being; firmly in calculations.

1:30.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to soft in places (GoingStick 6.4) (Rail Movements: 1.30 +43yds, 2.00 & 3.15 +45yds and 2.40, 4.55 & 5.25 +23yds)

runners.name: Rahiebb
runners.comment: Again has to concede weight to promising opposition but commands respect
runners.spotlight: Both runs at Newcastle; very green on debut but stayed on best to win going away over 1m and probably bumped into a smart prospect when a clear second back there under a penalty (1m2f); again has to concede weight to promising opposition but commands respect.

stable_tour.quote: He's a bit of a thug at home but his two runs have put some manners on him and he ran well both times. I think the handicapper reacted a bit heavily after his last run and we'll probably go for a novice off that rating. He could develop into a nice middle-distance/staying horse if he channels his energy in the right way. 11-04-25

runners.name: Antrim
runners.comment: 5-4 favourite at Yarmouth but lost all chance after losing lengths at the start
runners.spotlight: By Dubawi and out of a close relative to Enable; could never land a blow after losing lengths at the start at Yarmouth (1m2f, good; behind Minhad) but he was 5-4 favourite and looks sure to leave that form behind with some experience behind him.

runners.name: Caliban
runners.comment: 75,000gns yearling out of a Listed winner; makes debut with yard going great guns
runners.spotlight: 75,000gns yearling; second foal out of an 11.6f-1m6f winner (Listed; RPR 107) and half-sister to useful 7f-1m2f winner Voice Of A Leader; already gelded but makes debut with yard going great guns.

runners.name: Emerald Island
runners.comment: 110,000euros yearling with a good pedigree and the market should be revealing
runners.spotlight: 110,000euros yearling with a good pedigree and the market should be revealing.

runners.name: Minhad
runners.comment: Stayed on strongly for third at Yarmouth and he had Antrim behind
runners.spotlight: 50-1 at Yarmouth three weeks ago (1m2f, good) but saw his race out well to snatch third with Antrim behind; that was a nice start.

runners.name: Opportunity
runners.comment: Stayed on encouragingly for fourth on 2yo debut and he's in the Derby
runners.spotlight: Frankel colt who cost 475,000gns as a yearling; slow to break but produced plenty of good late work to finish fourth at Nottingham (extended 1m, soft; 7-2) and he's in the Derby; has to rate a very nice prospect.

runners.name: Renato
runners.owner: Jonny Allison & Beppa E Gigi S R L
runners.comment: Already shown good form and latest Southwell conqueror has some high-profile entries
runners.spotlight: Late foal by Sea The Stars; similar form in finishing second at Kempton (1m3f) and Southwell (1m4f), last time beaten by Nightime Dancer who has some high-profile entries; every chance.

2:00.race_name: Free Bet With Unibet Betbuilder Rebound Handicap (GBBPlus Race) (Div I)
2:00.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to soft in places (GoingStick 6.4) (Rail Movements: 1.30 +43yds, 2.00 & 3.15 +45yds and 2.40, 4.55 & 5.25 +23yds)

runners.name: Individualism
runners.comment: Off since tailed off last July; wind surgery in November; could still have potential
runners.spotlight: Half-brother to the very classy Subjectivist and Sir Ron Priestley, suggesting stamina tests; made all for the breakthrough in a five-runner handicap at Carlisle (1m3f, good) last July but tailed off when favourite at Ascot (1m4f, good to firm) 15 days later; not seen since and had wind surgery in November; could still have potential.

runners.name: Into Battle
runners.comment: Not seen since a lesser show on heavy ground in September; good shout on best form
runners.spotlight: Made all in novice at Epsom (good) last April and better form in some of his handicaps afterwards; not seen since a lesser show on heavy ground in September; stays 1m3f; good shout on best form.

quotes.race: Weatherbys Digital Solutions Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Into Battle is such a good-looking horse and his work has been decent, but I wasn't expecting that. I expect the handicapper will take a dim view, but I'm sure there's plenty more to come - Ed Walker, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He slightly disappointed us after the London Gold Cup last season but he's a massive horse and has done well through the winter. I hope he'll be progressive in handicaps from 1m to 1m2f this season. He looks to start the year on a fair mark. 16-04-25

runners.name: High Point
runners.comment: 3-6 on turf, the wins all in 1m2f handicaps for Eve Johnson Houghton; needs a market check
runners.spotlight: Down the field in two AW starts for new yard this year but he's 0-4 in that sphere compared to a healthy 3-6 on turf, the wins all in 1m2f handicaps for Eve Johnson Houghton; withdrawn when ground was officially good at Ripon recently; needs a market check.

quotes.race: British EBF Ruby Anniversary Nursery Handicap (Sire And Dam Restricted Race)
quotes.quote: High Point ran a nice race at Windsor last time and we were quite confident coming in as he is a galloping type. He could get a mile and three quarters next year - George Downing, rider.

runners.name: Pol Roger
runners.comment: Went off the boil last autumn and needs to improve his first-time-out record
runners.spotlight: His four wins have come in pairs, during August 2022 and May last year; went off the boil last autumn and needs to improve his first-time-out record but he has slipped somewhat in the weights and 5lb claimer is recruited.

stable_tour.quote: He went up 4lb to 74 after his last win at Ayr in May but then he's finished second in his last four races and has gone up another 7lb to 81. I'm thinking we need to change something and maybe try him over a bit further - he's been running over 1m2f - as he clearly looks to be in the handicapper's grip over that trip. 28-08-24

runners.name: Woodstock City

prev_owners.owner: Gl Racing, Ecurie Normandy Spirit & J-P-J Dubois
O Gonzalez Lozano, Ecurie Normandy Spirit & J-P-J Dubois

runners.comment: Only 1lb higher than at Ripon (1m2f good to firm) last August, his only British win
runners.spotlight: Only 1lb higher than when successful over 1m2f at Ripon (good to firm) last August, his only British win; ran respectably in December when last seen and worth a second look.

runners.name: Whathappensinvegas
runners.comment: 1m2f/1m3f wins on good ground last May/June and he's now back to his last winning mark
runners.spotlight: Had 1m2f/1m3f wins on good ground last May/June and he's now back to his last winning mark, having been more miss than hit afterwards; off since last September and needed his first run last term.

runners.name: Yokohama
runners.comment: Gelded before close second of 14 at Newbury (1m2f, good; 3lb higher today) two weeks ago
runners.spotlight: Hasn't won since his debut (AW in 2023); gelded in March and close second of 14 at Newbury (1m2f, good; 3lb higher today) two weeks ago was easily his best turf result, putting him back on the right tracks.

runners.name: Salamanca City
runners.comment: Made a respectable start to this season one month ago and has each-way claims
runners.spotlight: Won off 4lb lower at Leicester (1m2f, good to soft) last July, her sole win from 11 races; made a respectable start to this season one month ago and has each-way claims for her in-form stable.

runners.name: Perseus Way
runners.comment: Out of form over hurdles and last of nine on recent return to Flat (33-1)
runners.spotlight: Out of form over hurdles last year and this, with last of nine on recent return to Flat (33-1); down the weights but best watched at present.

quotes.race: Weatherbys Chatteris Fen Juvenile Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Perseus Way is a very nice horse and I'm pleased that he has done it well today. His jumping is getting better all the time, but it needs to. He is getting slicker and quicker and he is starting to enjoy his racing. It was a good run in defeat at Chepstow last time and I felt that Chepstow was probably soft enough for him. We rode him too far back that day and that is why we rode him handier today. I don't think he is good enough to run in the Triumph but I think he could have a strong chance in the handicap - Gary Moore, trainer.

quotes.race: Dreweatts Handicap
quotes.quote: Perseus Way has not run for months because we've been waiting for the ground. Jim said he'd get as far as you'd want. There is talk Gary Moore could have him for jumping at some stage. We were waiting to see what he'd do today because if he was well beaten, he might have gone to Gary's sooner! We just got away with the trip today as he's a grinder who will appreciate more give in the ground - Owen Burrows, trainer.

quotes.race: British Stallion Studs EBF Reference Point Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I was very pleased with Perseus Way. I hadn't sat on him at home and it was a proper slog on this ground, but he was quite fit and was able to keep going. He coped with conditions well. He's definitely a nice type for next year, he's big and raw and should furnish away over the winter - James Doyle, jockey.

runners.name: Elemental Eye
runners.comment: C&D second (good) last July reads well but out of form lately and he's now 0-16
runners.spotlight: C&D second (good) last July reads well given he's now 7lb lower, but out of form lately and the bottom line seems to be that he's 0-16.

prev_owners.owner: Nick Willis And Mike And Wendy Yardley

quotes.race: Charles Stewart & Co Steve Evans Memorial Handicap
quotes.quote: Distinction has done us proud. The stiff mile and soft ground were ideal. He's declared for Kempton tomorrow but that was just a back-up in case he couldn't run here - John Mackie, trainer.

5:25.race_name: Get Best Odds Guaranteed At Unibet Handicap
5:25.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to soft in places (GoingStick 6.4) (Rail Movements: 1.30 +43yds, 2.00 & 3.15 +45yds and 2.40, 4.55 & 5.25 +23yds)

runners.name: Tremolo
runners.comment: Appeals as the type to raise his game this season and today's longer trip should suit
runners.spotlight: Steady improvement last year culminated with victory in a slowly-run novice on the Southwell AW (7f); appeals as the type to raise his game this season and today's longer trip should suit.

runners.name: Sex On Fire
runners.comment: Dual AW winner; had 11 races and now tries headgear; looks high in the weights
runners.spotlight: Dual Southwell winner, a 5f maiden and 7f novice; looks high enough in the weights and it was a bunched finish when close up behind Well Enough and High On Hope back at Southwell last time (7f); had 11 races and now tries headgear.

runners.name: Imperial Trooper
runners.comment: Competitive last season until contesting two sales races; can win races as a 3yo
runners.spotlight: Six runs last season, the best when winning a Ffos Las novice (heavy) before going close in a 7f Sandown handicap on good (5lb lower); following defeats came in sales races; should make his mark in 3yo handicaps.

runners.name: Royal Alliance
runners.comment: Didn't pick up for pressure last time at Kempton and cheekpieces are now added
runners.spotlight: Newcastle novice winner over 7f on his second start; not far away in either of his handicaps (1m/1m3f), though didn't pick up for pressure last time at Kempton and cheekpieces are now added over this much sharper test.

runners.name: Yabher
runners.comment: Only 8th of 10 on hcap debut at the Craven meeting but didn't handle the track
runners.spotlight: 33-1 debut winner (1m, good; Arbitration fifth) and the ground was heavy here next time (fifth of six at odds of 4-9); didn't appear to handle Newmarket's undulations too well when only eighth of ten on handicap debut at the Craven meeting (1m, good); remains relatively unexposed.

runners.name: Well Enough
runners.comment: Prevailed narrowly in a messy race at Southwell but has only gone up 2lb
runners.spotlight: Ran awful after winning a 7f AW maiden but emerged from behind to edge home in a 7f handicap at Southwell (AW; High On Hope and Sex On Fire close up); that might be dodgy form but has only gone up 2lb; now with John Ryan.

runners.name: High On Hope
runners.comment: Two solid efforts this year, the latest in a maiden behind one less exposed
runners.spotlight: Got competitive a long way out on his penultimate run at Southwell (7f) and was nailed late by Well Enough who was ridden colder; again beaten in a Bath maiden next time (1m) but by one well bred and unexposed; in the mix.

runners.name: Urban Sky
runners.owner: Mr And Mrs J D Cotton
runners.comment: Struggled in stronger races after making a winning debut over 6f at Hamilton
runners.spotlight: Hamilton debut winner (6f, good) who was highly tried afterwards, in a Group 3 at York and valuable sales race at the Curragh (after being gelded); hard to gauge his level of ability and he's had a good while off.

runners.name: Arbitration
runners.comment: Only 7-2 for handicap debut at Musselburgh; didn't handle the bend and was fourth
runners.spotlight: Fifth in all his runs last season, at 6f, 7f and 1m (all on good ground); gelded ahead of handicap debut and finished fourth of eight having not handled the Musselburgh bend all that well (over 1m1f; 7-2); can improve on that form here.

runners.name: Boston Run
runners.comment: Not disgraced in any of his four races last season; gelded ahead of handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Not disgraced in any of his four races last season (7f-1m), all of them maidens or novices; promises to do better at three having been gelded and cheekpieces are on for handicap debut.

stable_tour.quote: He's been gelded, which I hope makes a difference, and has strengthened up over the winter. He handles cut in the ground but should handle better ground too, and he should win some races. 09-04-25

runners.name: Carron
runners.comment: Much improved to win at Wolverhampton; dangerously unexposed handicap debutant
runners.spotlight: 135,000gns breeze-up buy who appeared to get stuck in the mud in his only run at two; back from a break to win narrowly at Wolverhampton (7f; always prominent) and the clear second seems well regarded; dangerously unexposed handicap debutant.

4:55.race_name: Try Unibet New Smartview Racecards EBF Fillies' Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
4:55.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to soft in places (GoingStick 6.4) (Rail Movements: 1.30 +43yds, 2.00 & 3.15 +45yds and 2.40, 4.55 & 5.25 +23yds)

runners.name: Althawaqeb
runners.comment: 400,000gns yearling; bred to be smart and market can guide as to expectations on debut
runners.spotlight: 400,000gns yearling; first foal; dam 1m winner (RPR 98), half-sister to winners Sea La Rosa (1m6f Group 1) and Deauville Legend (1m4f Group 2); bred to be smart and market can guide as to expectations on debut.

runners.name: Betty Bassett
runners.comment: Never sighted with a chance at Kempton in November (1m) and likely one for another day
runners.spotlight: 115,000euros breeze-up 2yo; never sighted with a chance at Kempton in November (1m; 50-1) and likely one for another day.

runners.name: Bintalina
runners.comment: 500,000gns yearling; in top hands and could easily have a part to play on debut
runners.spotlight: 500,000gns yearling; seventh foal; sister to winners Noble Dynasty (7f/1m; Group 3; RPR 118) and Arabian Tribe (8.6f; 89) and half-sister to high-class 7f-1m4f performer Barney Roy; in top hands and could easily have a part to play on debut.

runners.name: Blue Wonder
runners.comment: Two AW runs; her form is right up there and she's entitled to improve some more
runners.spotlight: Plenty of promise this winter over 1m at Kempton, ridden from behind when runner-up on debut and then from the front when finishing closer on her second visit; her form is right up there and she's entitled to improve some more.

runners.name: Cajole
runners.comment: Slowly away but kept on at Newbury and improvement should be a formality
runners.spotlight: Dubawi filly from a stellar Cheveley Park family; went off 9-2 at Newbury a fortnight ago (7f, good) and saw her race out on the front foot after being slow to break; improvement should be a formality.

runners.name: Club Class
runners.comment: Pleasing debut but likely to need this run back and further in time
runners.spotlight: Frankel filly out of high-class 1m2f performer Speedy Boarding; always midfield over 1m at Kempton and likely to need this run back and further in time.

runners.name: Joyful Sound
runners.comment: Half-sister to 12 winners but it was a low-key start when fourth at Lingfield in December
runners.spotlight: Half-sister to 12 winners but it was a low-key start when a 10l fourth at Lingfield in December (1m; 18-1).

runners.name: Maeva
runners.comment: 14-1, she stayed on encouragingly once in the clear over 1m at Kempton in October
runners.spotlight: 14-1, she stayed on encouragingly once in the clear over 1m at Kempton in October; still trailed the winner by about 8l but that's something to build on; hood applied for comeback run.

runners.name: Nanino Niyati
runners.comment: Second foal out of a German 7f winner (Listed; RPR 95); probably one for later on
runners.spotlight: Second foal out of a German 7f winner (Listed; RPR 95); probably one for later on but she needs a market check.

runners.name: Previse
runners.comment: Very green when last at Southwell but needs to leave that run a long way behind
runners.spotlight: Inexperience was very evident when last to finish at Southwell (1m; 17-2) but needs to leave that run a long way behind.

runners.name: Silver Chamber
runners.comment: Encouraging fourth at Newmarket last season and just the type to improve with racing
runners.spotlight: Half-sister to classy dual-purpose performer Absurde; found 7f on the tight side at Newmarket in November (good to soft) but shaped perfectly well and is just the type to improve with her racing.

runners.name: Starlit Spice
runners.comment: Second to a useful filly at Leicester in September and the extra distance here can suit
runners.spotlight: Promising second to a short-priced favourite (well held in the Fred Darling) at Leicester in September and today's additional furlong should suit; has claims.

3:50.race_name: Read Richard Hannon Weekly Unibet Blog Handicap
3:50.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to soft in places (GoingStick 6.4) (Rail Movements: 1.30 +43yds, 2.00 & 3.15 +45yds and 2.40, 4.55 & 5.25 +23yds)

runners.name: Wichahpi
runners.comment: Two wins last year (when also running well on reappearance); could have a part to play
runners.spotlight: Last season concluded with a rare below-par run but she won twice earlier in the campaign (6f, soft/good) and also ran well on her 2024 reappearance; could have a part to play on this year's comeback.

quotes.race: Leicester Racecourse Ideal Self-Hire Wedding Venue Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: It was a good effort from Wichahpi. The cheekpieces have done her no harm since they were applied and the race went perfectly for her. She kept finding and was suited by the slow ground - Graham Lee, rider.

runners.name: Annie Edson Taylor
runners.comment: Won Bath maiden last September and new trainer's horses are running well; not ruled out
runners.spotlight: Won Bath maiden (5f, good) last September for Kevin Coleman on her fifth and latest start; sold for 14,000gns in October; her new trainer's horses are running well and she's not ruled out on handicap debut.

runners.name: Arnaz
runners.comment: Won on handicap debut last May and often ran well subsequently; yard in fine form
runners.spotlight: Won on handicap debut at Brighton (7f, good) last May and consistent subsequently (including over 6f) until below-par run on heavy ground in October; reappears with Lambourn trainer in fine form and he's respected.

runners.name: Muscika
runners.comment: 11yo who won on AW in January but his form has dipped the last twice
runners.spotlight: 11yo who has won over C&D and was on the scoresheet at Newcastle (6f, AW) in January; also ran well on his next three starts but his form has dipped the last twice and he needs to raise his game today.

quotes.race: Find More Big Deals At BetUK Handicap
quotes.quote: Muscika is a lovely old boy. The last day at Epsom went really well and today went the same, he jumped out and has a nice gate speed, which is good from a low draw here. We went a nice enough gallop but I didn't have to use too much petrol and he travelled into it well. He's really found his form again - Cieren Fallon, jockey, speaking on Sky Sports Racing.

quotes.race: Betfred Nifty 50 Handicap (Jockey Club Grassroots Sprint Series Qualifier)
quotes.quote: Muscika jumped well and I got a very, very soft lead, surprisingly. We dawdled in front and then kicked and just nicked the race. He's an old boy, he's in good form and he was unlucky to get touched off at Wolverhampton the last day. He's handled the track very well. He's well balanced and he travels, which is what you need. He was true and honest to the line and I couldn't pull him up towards the end. Jockeys dream for rides like that where you jump out, bowl along and nothing catches you. It was like a piece of work and we never saw another rival - Cieren Fallon, jockey.

quotes.race: Sky Bet Extended Dash Handicap
quotes.quote: We've always thought there was a good race in Muscika and he's proved it today. We might look at going back for the Great St Wilfrid after he finished fourth in it last year - Richard Walker, racing manager for owners Gallop Racing.

quotes.race: JW 4x4 Northallerton Handicap
quotes.quote: Muscika was dropped in last time and went a bit sour with it, so the boss said ride him handy. He travelled through the race great and quickened up before idling a bit when in front. He's a fine horse and hopefully there's more to come - Cam Hardie, jockey

quotes.race: Visit The Start Today Maiden Auction Stakes
quotes.quote: Muscika is a nice big horse, but he is still a bit raw and green. He ran on well in the closing stages when the penny dropped. He may stay further but he could get quicker with racing - David O'Meara, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: Won two nice races at York last year and seems to like the place. He's had some good runs this season and probably paid the price late on for going too fast at Ripon last time. He'll be kept going in the nice sprint handicaps, including at York. 10-05-21

runners.name: Ziggys Queen
runners.comment: 0-12 last year and well beaten on return, but was hampered; continues to drop down weights
runners.spotlight: 0-12 during last season's 3yo campaign and well beaten at Musselburgh on recent reappearance; however, she suffered significant early interference last time and continues to drop down the weights; not discounted.

quotes.race: British EBF 40th Anniversary Fillies' Conditions Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Ziggy's Queen is learning with racing. There wasn't really much pace in the race so I thought it would be ideal if I could jump and get an easy lead. She only had to really run (sprint) for two furlongs, so she'll probably come on for that again - Oisin Orr, jockey speaking to Racing TV.

runners.name: Parisiac
runners.comment: Below par earlier in the year but a break may have helped and he's on a handy mark
runners.spotlight: Below par on last three starts in January/February; however, perhaps a break will have helped and he's 1lb lower than when second of 24 in the Ayr Bronze Cup (6f, good) last September; not written off.

quotes.race: MansionBet Proud To Support British Racing EBF Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Parisiac was a bit keen early on but he finished the race really well. I gave him one backhander and he just went. I ride him everyday at home, he's a bit tricky but the boss gave me the opportunity to ride him and he showed his ability. He'll learn a lot from today - Gianluca Sanna, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He's another I bought at the sales and he looks as though he could be quite nicely handicapped if you delve into his form. He appears to like a bit of soft ground and I hope the change of scenery might rekindle some of what he once had. I'm not sure he was suited by Hamilton on his first run for us and we may try him on a flat track. I'm sure he'll win races for us. He looks quick but sees 6f out well. 26-07-24

runners.name: Roaring Ralph
runners.comment: Twice went close over 6f on AW earlier this year; could benefit from the drop back in trip
runners.spotlight: He's never won over a sprint trip but he twice went close over 6f on AW earlier this year and has shaped over 7f the last twice as though he may benefit from this drop back in distance; a possible.

runners.name: Back Before Dark
runners.breeder: Glebe Farm Stud & Peter & Ross Doyle
runners.comment: Well beaten more often than not in 2024; maybe first time up will be the time to catch her
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced 4yo who was well beaten more often than not last year but she showed spark on occasions and is on a competitive mark; perhaps first time up will be the time to catch her.

stable_tour.quote: She looked nice from the day she set foot in the stable and after some encouraging pieces of work I thought she'd win first time out. Unfortunately, I chose Catterick to start her off and the track didn't suit. She put that fourth place over 5f to good use, however, as she won at Carlisle next time having been stepped up to 6f. The handicapper has given her a mark after just two runs, but we can't use it until after a third run, which could change again. We have to find her somewhere with a penalty to carry next time and it's likely to be for fillies only. I like her a lot and she may run at Carlisle on Friday. She should make a lovely three-year-old. 30-08-23

runners.name: Asinara
runners.comment: Returns from an absence but this lightly raced 4yo retains potential for her powerful yard
runners.spotlight: Unplaced favourite at Lingfield last August and absent since; however, this lightly raced 4yo had been showing some good form previously, including a close third at Newmarket (6f, good) on her second handicap start; retains potential for powerful Lambourn stable and could have a big say on her return.

stable_tour.quote: She's in the 1,000 Guineas but disappointed us on her last start at Southwell. Her work had been really smart leading up to that, but she seems to have gone backward in her coat. It's been a bad spring with the weather, especially for fillies, so we're going to be patient. We like her a lot and she's shown plenty at home - we didn't put her in the Guineas for nothing. 17-04-24

runners.name: Roundhay Park

prev_owners.owner: Exors Of The Late Mr J D Gordon

runners.comment: 10yo who is well treated on last year's best form but was soundly beaten on reappearance
runners.spotlight: 10yo who is well treated on last year's best form and could improve for his reappearance seventh at Thirsk a fortnight ago; however, he was soundly beaten and his losing run goes back 15 races to August 2023.

quotes.race: William Hill Silver Trophy Handicap
quotes.quote: I was a bit shocked, but Roundhay Park does turn up every time and tries his heart out. It's lovely getting on such genuine horses. I was doing a rain dance last night as he does like it with a bit of soft in the ground. He's so genuine and kept on finding - Faye McManoman, jockey.

quotes.race: QTS Ayr Bronze Cup Handicap
quotes.quote: Roundhay Park was very relaxed today. He sometimes gets wound up but he came up yesterday and he's been very relaxed. He was given a great ride by Faye as there was no panic and no rush - Nigel Tinkler, trainer.

quotes.race: Racing UK Novice Auction Stakes (Div II)
quotes.quote: Roundhay Park was a bit buzzy so I'll give him a bit of a break now - Nigel Tinkler, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's a lovely horse and has been a great servant for the yard. He was second in the Shergar Cup Sprint Cup years back under Hayley Turner and was a top-class handicapper in his heyday. He finished last of 11 at York on Friday and hasn't shown it in his last two starts but the handicapper has just got him high enough. He's a little bit older now and we could do with a bit of help from the handicapper. 27-07-22

runners.name: Belsito
