runners.comment: Ended last season in good heart; wind op since; respected for in-form yard
runners.spotlight: Went close at Carlisle (6f, good) last June and won there (6f, soft) seven days later; went close at Redcar (6f, soft) in the autumn on his last two starts and he returns having had a wind op; respected for in-form yard.

runners.name: Sioux Warrior
runners.comment: Lightly raced 4yo who didn't show enough on his stable debut to have compelling claims
runners.spotlight: Went close in Leicester novice last July for Charlie Hills but down the field in August in first two handicaps and he didn't show enough on last month's stable and seasonal debut on AW to have compelling claims today.

runners.name: Bear Rock
runners.comment: Close fourth of 17 on handicap debut at Doncaster and she's open to further improvement
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in three AW novices in the winter (7f/6f) and again ran well when close fourth of 17 on turf/handicap debut at Doncaster (5f, good) four weeks ago; open to further improvement and she's one to consider.

runners.name: Vaunted
runners.comment: Three wins from final six starts last season; in the mix if reappearing in the same vein
runners.spotlight: Mare who was in rude health towards the end of last season, with three wins (5.7f/6f, including on good/good to soft) from her final six starts; in the mix if reappearing in the same vein.

quotes.race: New Atlas 'Oakwood Lodge' Handicap
quotes.quote: Vaunted tries her heart out. She didn't get a run last time, she wouldn't have won but she'd have been second - Nigel Tinkler, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: Won at Bath, so I'm really pleased and hopefully it's a sign we've a smashing bunch to look forward to. She came out of the race well. Whiles he is professional, she wasn't harried to be there and will progress. Early-season form is tricky to piece together, but she is a nice prospect. 22-04-21

They went a fair gallop when she won at Pontefract two starts ago and probably stopped in front of her. It might have made her look better than she was, but she's a lovely filly and proved that when only narrowly beaten at Newmarket on Saturday. I was very pleased with that. The track suited her on Saturday and, like many of mine, she's very genuine. We'll try to keep her in those fillies-only races over the summer. 27-07-22

runners.name: Call Time
runners.owner: The 19Th Hole Syndicate & J S Moore
runners.comment: Didn't really threaten on his final three starts last year; returns from a break
runners.spotlight: One win from his 13 starts, namely a Bath novice last October; on a competitive mark on his best handicap form but he didn't really threaten on his final three runs last year and needs a bigger performance on his comeback.

stable_tour.quote: He was second at Bath the other day. He could end up being a little bit ground dependent. You wouldn't probably run him on anything with firm in it but he'll be a horse who'll make a name for himself as the year goes on. There's plenty more to come from him on ground with a bit of juice in it over six or seven furlongs. 04-07-24

runners.name: Papa Cocktail
runners.comment: Won this in 2023; mixed form since last October, following a long absence
runners.spotlight: This race in 2023 was the middle leg of a hat-trick and he's well treated on that form; returned from absence last October and encouraging fourth at Southwell in December, but hasn't really shone on his four runs since.

stable_tour.quote: I think he is a very nice colt with a bright future. His work had been encouraging this spring and we started him off over 7f late last month at Yarmouth in what looked a particularly hot maiden, with several of the big yards represented and many trainers liking their charges. He ran a cracker to be third behind New Science, where he was rather green but ran on well. It was the perfect start to his career as he will have learned plenty and mentally handled things well. There are a few 7f maidens around Royal Ascot time later this month and we will pick our spot to make him a winner and take it from there. He runs in the colours of owner Khalifa Dasmal, who is a great man to train for. His patronage is largely thanks to my former guv'nor David Simcock giving him a nod in my direction. David has been a huge help to me in my career and I am very hopeful that I have a potentially nice horse here for Mr Dasmal. 10-06-21

runners.name: Safari Dream
runners.comment: On a long losing run but has run well in defeat the last twice and has each-way claims
runners.spotlight: 0-24 since completing nursery hat-trick on turf in September 2022; however, he's run well in defeat on AW the last twice; each-way claims.

stable_tour.quote: He was a good two-year-old but had a foot injury which knocked his confidence a little bit but he's become well handicapped. 11-07-24

4:25.race_name: Unibet More Extra Place Races Handicap
4:25.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to soft in places (GoingStick 6.4) (Rail Movements: 1.30 +43yds, 2.00 & 3.15 +45yds and 2.40, 4.55 & 5.25 +23yds)

runners.name: Maelstrom
runners.comment: Bred to be smart; impressive winner on handicap debut (6f) on Tuesday; under penalty
runners.spotlight: Bred to be smart and he improved greatly for the winter break and switch to handicaps when winning at Yarmouth (6f, good to firm) on Tuesday, running freely in front but soon having his rivals on the stretch; that wasn't a strong race and he's under a penalty today but more of an issue will be whether he still has his edge on this quick return.

runners.name: Lord Capulet
runners.comment: Front-runner at 7f and 6f, fading each time; handicap debut; easy lead unlikely
runners.spotlight: Front-runner on all three starts, at 7f and 6f, but he couldn't sustain the gallop when a beaten favourite over this trip on Newcastle AW in February; should find his feet in handicaps in due course but he'll be pushed to get an easy lead today.

runners.name: Amor Cordis
runners.comment: Well beaten on handicap debut as 2yo; better effort on comeback; return to 6f could suit
runners.spotlight: Creditable third of six at Chester (7f, good) last July behind two who are rated much higher now; lesser efforts ended his 2yo season, including on handicap debut, but he ran well for a long way on AW comeback at Wolverhampton (7f; cheekpieces added) and the return to 6f could suit.

runners.name: Laurens Dream
runners.comment: Busy 2yo; two AW wins at 7f and 6f in November; more exposed than many
runners.spotlight: Busy 2yo who won two Newcastle AW handicaps (7f and 6f) in November; fair return to action in March but the handicapper knows more about her than others.

runners.name: Jeany May
runners.comment: Quite impressive in Nottingham handicap on final 2yo start; well worth this first go at 6f
runners.spotlight: Has led but she came from off the pace when ultimately quite impressive in her fourth and final handicap start as 2yo, on soft at Nottingham; returned to action with a close fourth at Catterick and there could be more to come now tackling 6f.

runners.name: Gesundheit
runners.comment: Promising winner of handicap debut on AW (6f) as 2yo; up 6lb; more to come; new yard
runners.spotlight: Minor form when qualifying but he came home strongly to win in good style on handicap debut at Kempton (AW; 6f) in October, when beating a multiple subsequent winner; left Ed Walker for 30,000gns and gelded; today's run might be needed but he has potential despite the 6lb higher mark.

runners.name: Boyne Lady
runners.comment: Quite promising reappearance at Catterick (6f) on handicap debut; should improve
runners.spotlight: Has run well on first start of both campaigns and might have been up against it on comeback/handicap debut at Catterick (6f, good) recently when still quite a promising third of seven; open to improvement.

runners.name: Power Of Twins
runners.comment: Promise in sprint maidens last summer but never found her niche in handicaps; needs more
runners.spotlight: Showed promise in sprint maidens on turf last summer but she never found her niche in handicaps thereafter, over 7f, 5f and 6f; needs either improvement or a weights drop if she's to get off the mark.

runners.name: Fear And Fast
runners.comment: Best form over 5f; weights turnaround with Jeany May on 2yo form; trip query back at 6f
runners.spotlight: Best form over 5f, as when third to Jeany May at Nottingham (soft) in November but he's no good thing to turn things round with that one on the revised terms after a low-key start to 3yo career at Catterick, especially as he's yet to prove 6f suits.

runners.name: Vault Of Heaven
runners.comment: Met trouble in running when just failing on handicap debut (6f, AW); interesting prospect
runners.spotlight: Started off from a very low base but his final qualifying run was better and he only just failed to make a winning handicap debut on Newcastle AW (6f; well-backed favourite) in November, when hard to settle and hampered quite badly but came home strongly; up 3lb; interesting prospect.

runners.name: Bust A Moon
runners.comment: No progress as 2yo; lost out narrowly on return for new yard (AW, 6f); lesser run since
runners.spotlight: Mildly encouraging 2yo debut but that was as good as it got for previous yard; he lost out only narrowly on debut for new trainer at Chelmsford (6f) but soon cried enough back at 5f since; returns to 6f with something to prove back on turf.

runners.name: Solar Biricz
runners.comment: All races at 5f, winning Musselburgh handicap in August; fair return; cheekpieces fitted
runners.spotlight: All races over 5f and seemingly appreciated the sharp test when coming clear in a Musselburgh handicap (good) in August; ran as though he'd be better for the run on return at Catterick but the fitting of cheekpieces challenges that view and the extra furlong is another query.

runners.name: Summer Rain
runners.comment: Fared better on the third of three handicap runs but hard to call him well treated
runners.spotlight: First two handicap attempts were both very ordinary and although he fared better when third of eight at Wolverhampton (6f) he hardly rates as well treated at this stage.

runners.name: Rose Of New Jersey
runners.comment: Six handicap runs already, best effort over 6f in September but treading water since
runners.spotlight: Six handicap runs already, best effort when close second at Thirsk (6f, good to soft) in September; treading water since and the handicapper has been sluggish in reacting; needs cheekpieces to improve matters.

stable_tour.quote: I think she was a bit unlucky on her return at Newcastle at the end of March as she got a little bit squeezed out, so I'm hoping that with a run under her belt she'll be seen to better effect next time. She has entries at Haydock and Doncaster on Saturday. 23-04-25

3:15.race_name: Free Bet With Unibet Betbuilder Rebound Handicap (GBBPlus Race) (Div II)
3:15.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to soft in places (GoingStick 6.4) (Rail Movements: 1.30 +43yds, 2.00 & 3.15 +45yds and 2.40, 4.55 & 5.25 +23yds)

runners.name: Night Breeze
runners.comment: Won three in a row last summer; shorter trip on this return but he's not ruled out
runners.spotlight: Won three in a row last summer (11.4f/1m4f, good to soft-good to firm) and soft ground maybe didn't suit in September when last seen; the drop back in trip isn't an obvious plus on his return but he's not ruled out.

runners.name: Hamlets Night
runners.comment: Ex-French 4yo who could pose a bigger threat now back down in trip on second British start
runners.spotlight: Soundly beaten on his stable and seasonal debut at Brighton (1m4f) a fortnight ago but he may have needed that run and he had some useful form at up to 9.5f in France; wears a first-time tongue-tie and could be more competitive today now back down in trip; watch the betting.

runners.name: Azahara Palace
runners.comment: Won on last season's reappearance and ended campaign in good form; could play leading role
runners.spotlight: Won on reappearance at Leicester (1m, good to soft) last May and campaign concluded with two good placed efforts over 1m2f on soft; won on good to firm/good ground in 2023; could play a leading role on her return.

quotes.race: Download The Vickers.Bet App Fillies' Handicap
quotes.quote: We were disappointed when Azahara Palace got beat at Catterick, but I think the course caught her out. She's quite difficult to train, and was still learning here, but hopefully she'll keep progressing - Hughie Morrison, trainer, talking to Sky Sports Racing.

stable_tour.quote: She won at Leicester last week off 74 and it was particularly pleasing as she was bred by my brother and I trained both her dam and her dam's sire Sakhee's Secret, who won a July Cup. I'm looking at the Kensington Palace Stakes - the four-year-old fillies' race on the Wednesday at Royal Ascot - for her next run. In the Racing Calendar it said the race was restricted to 20 runners but I rang up the clerk at Ascot and learned it was a misprint and 30 get in. She's gone up 7lb, so she should bang there towards the bottom of the weights. 06-06-24

quotes.race: quinnbet.com "Confined" Handicap (For horses With No More Than One Win)
quotes.quote: I think we'll look for some softer ground for Afloat next time as it was good to soft when we declared but now it's good to firm. We had to run as she was 2lb well in - Rae Guest, trainer

runners.name: Dayzee
runners.comment: Dropping down the weights but her AW form last winter was mixed; has to turn things around
runners.spotlight: Made it 3-5 when winning at Salisbury (1m2f, good to firm) in June 2023; dropping down the weights but her AW form last winter was mixed and she needs to turn things around.

quotes.race: Floodlit Fridays At Dundalk Fillies' Maiden
quotes.quote: Dayzee has always showed us plenty at home. Jack just let her get into a rhythm and he said she was still a bit green. She will go a bit further - Mark Fahey, trainer.

runners.name: Live Aid
runners.comment: Won 1m AW maiden last month and bred to be suited by the step up in trip on handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Kept on for second in Newcastle maiden (1m, AW) in February on second stable start then went one better in Southwell maiden (1m, AW); this former bumper performer is bred to be suited by the step up in trip on handicap debut and could have a big say.

runners.name: Roland Garros
runners.comment: Yet to build upon initial promise but he's bred to be better than his opening mark
runners.spotlight: Has run just twice since finishing fourth on debut at Wolverhampton (9.4f, AW) last April and he's yet to build on that initial promise; however, he's in top hands and is bred to be better than his opening mark.

runners.name: Giselles Defence
runners.comment: Three wins last May-July but out of form towards the end of last year; returns from break
runners.spotlight: Three wins last May-July (1m2f, soft-good) and he's dropped back down the weights; it's possible he'll have benefited from a break but he needs to perform much better than was the case towards the end of last year.

runners.name: Golspie
runners.comment: On long losing run but runner-up the last twice on AW and could be thereabouts
runners.spotlight: 0-16 since winning on debut at Newbury in April 2023; however, he was runner-up at Wolverhampton (9.4f, AW) last month on his last two starts and could be thereabouts.

stable_tour.quote: This colt made a winning start to his career when taking a mile maiden at Newbury, when I thought he had a good chance. Last time out I sent him to Newmarket for his handicap debut but the ground was too fast. When he won it was soft and we have learned that he must have plenty of give underfoot to be his best. I think he is on a nice mark (81) when the ground is right. 11-07-23

2:05.race_name: Carling King Richard III Cup Handicap
2:05.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places (GoingStick 6.7) (Watering) (Rail Movements: 2.35 & 3.10 +15yds)

runners.name: Commanche Falls
runners.owner: Doug Graham, Ian Davison, Alan Drysdale
runners.comment: High-class in his heyday; on downgrade last year but a fire still burned; may need this
runners.spotlight: Two-time Stewards' Cup winner; no win since 2023 where he won a Group 3 and twice in Listed company; did run some fair races in defeat last year though and he's not handicapped out of things on even his 2024 best; he has needed the run on his reappearance in recent times though.

quotes.race: BetGoodwin Garrowby Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Commanche Falls has been better than ever. He did well to win at Newbury because the ground was against him and Ireland last time came too soon, but the horse that beat him [Moss Tucker] just won the big sprint [Flying Five]. He probably ran better than we thought there. He's in a few races, including at the Curragh again, but the ground is important to him. He won't run a lot more this season as he's done so well - Michael Dods, trainer.

quotes.race: bet365 Hackwood Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: Between the three and the two-furlong marker I felt like I was getting a bit stuck in the ground really. Commanche Falls does race behind the bridle but normally you can keep your momentum going, whereas today I just felt like I wasn't getting any momentum. There wasn't much room and I just had to switch him to get him to think again and, once he did that, he really put his head down and I thought he did it nicely in the end - Conor Beasley, jockey.

quotes.race: Jebel Ali Racecourse & Stables Dash Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: I was very confident. On his last run Commanche Falls was third behind some smart fillies at York, though this ground would be plenty quick enough for him. If he's off the bridle at halfway, you know he's going to come home strong. Once he met the rising ground and I gave him a dig he went about his job really well - Connor Beasley, jockey.

quotes.race: Virgin Bet Ayr Gold Cup Handicap (Heritage Handicap)
quotes.quote: Commanche Falls has run a blinder but Connor (Beasley) said they didn't carry him far enough, he's travelling so much better in his races. But it was a super run with the weight and I'm delighted with him, he'll probably go in a Listed race now - Michael Dods, trainer.

quotes.race: Coral Stewards' Cup (Heritage Handicap)
quotes.quote: I was a little behind the bridle but I needed to keep tabs on the front ones. The race fell apart in front of me but when I felt Hollie coming to me I felt Commanche Falls go again and really stick his head down. I sat on him on Wednesday and I was very happy with him coming into this and I think he's the sort of horse who just comes to light at this time of year and it's a great training performance to bring him back to win this again - Connor Beasley, jockey.

quotes.race: Unibet Stewards' Cup (Heritage Handicap)
quotes.quote: Commanche Falls is just a horse who has got better and better with each run. Every time he comes to a gig he keeps putting up his best performance ever. The ground was a question mark today but I knew once I got him rolling, he'd pull out all the stops - Connor Beasley, jockey.

quotes.race: Close Brothers Asset Management Handicap
quotes.quote: We always thought Commanche Falls wanted a bit further but he's done it again over this trip. He has a good mind and got the job done - Connor Beasley, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He's been a great servant. The big handicaps suit him because he needs a proper gallop in a race and needs to be off the bridle. He won a Group 3 at Newbury and two Listed races last season but they weren't exactly great races for the level and so he got away with the step up from handicaps. This year, though, they've been tough races. We had him entered in the Stewards' Cup but the problem was that when the weights came out he was on a mark of 110. However, by the time of the race he had dropped to 107 and we felt there was no point running him off a mark 3lb higher than his actual rating, so that's why we missed the race.  He ran on Saturday at York, finishing a great third behind Elmonjed. I've entered him in the Beverley Bullet on Saturday but I'm not sure whether he'll run yet. There are other races coming up at York and there's the Ayr Gold Cup. 28-08-24

runners.name: Strike Red
runners.comment: Won a big-field sprint at York last October (6f, soft); needs to leave reappearance behind
runners.spotlight: Usually manages to bag at least one nice prize a year and in 2024 it was a valuable York sprint in October (6f, soft; strong form); low-key return to action at Southwell three weeks ago and may need a bit more weight off his back.

quotes.race: Coral Sprint Trophy Handicap (Heritage Handicap)
quotes.quote: Strike Red had a bad injury last year that you wouldn't really see on Flat horses and more on jumpers. He's been better than ever this year and this worked out easily enough. I always told Richard [Fahey, trainer] he feels like a Group horse and he's a top-end handicapper. There's plenty still to look forward to - Billy Garritty, jockey.

quotes.race: Paddy Power Scurry Handicap (Premier Handicap)
quotes.quote: Strike Red has been a good horse for me. He keeps winning these big handicaps so I'm absolutely delighted. I didn't think Ripon really suited him the last day.  When he gets there he doesn't do a lot. He pricks his earls a little bit - Billy Garritty, rider

runners.name: Sergeant Wilko
runners.comment: Progressive 3yo, including a C&D win; still low mileage but slower ground seems ideal
runners.spotlight: Four wins as a 3yo, including C&D and a big sprint handicap at Newmarket's July meeting; creditable effort behind Strike Red at York when last seen in October; gelded since; may well improve again this year but ground softer than good does seem to be the key to him.

stable_tour.quote: I thought the race at Newcastle last month would just take the freshness out of him, but he won very nicely and we're very hopeful he'll keep progressing at 6f this season. His owners like to be represented at the big festivals and I think he's the right kind of horse for that. 04-04-24

runners.name: Germanic
runners.comment: Unexposed 4yo; sold for 140,000gns since latest start; something to prove on good/faster
runners.spotlight: Only raced six times for William Haggas, mainly at 7f (won an AW novice) but showing speed in the York handicap won by Strike Red on his first 6f run; sold for 140,000gns soon after; interesting recruit for his new yard but something to prove on good/faster.

runners.name: Fivethousandtoone
runners.comment: Flopped at Newcastle eight days ago but in a messy race; lower mark on turf; visor back on
runners.spotlight: Disappointed at Newcastle on Good Friday but that was a race in which little got into it from off the pace and he shouldn't be judged too harshly on it; infrequent turf winner but he's on a lowly mark in this sphere and 6f on good ground no problem; visor goes on for the first time since joining Tim Easterby; not ruled out.

quotes.race: BetUK All-Weather Sprint Handicap
quotes.quote: Today it all came together and hopefully it will be the beginning of a decent season for Fivethousandtoone. He was good last time and better today - Oisin Murphy, jockey.

quotes.race: William Hill Best Odds Guaranteed Handicap
quotes.quote: Fivethousandtoone has run well without winning. The race worked out well for him today, waiting with him and coming late. That's his level - William Buick, rider.

stable_tour.quote: He was a very smart juvenile, winning over 6f before finishing second in the Mill Reef Stakes and mid-division over 7f in the Dewhurst Stakes. He had a setback earlier this year but that has been resolved and he is now back in fast work. The plan is to go straight to Royal Ascot for the Commonwealth Cup. He is a very smart horse who looks very together this year and is one I am excited about getting back on the track. 19-05-21

runners.name: Completely Random
runners.comment: Impressive surge to the front at Southwell (5f) latest; up 6lb but looks progressive
runners.spotlight: Ran well on good to firm at Newmarket last May; gained his first handicap win when surging to the front in the final furlong in a 5f handicap at Southwell three weeks ago; 6lb rise against stronger opposition asks a stiffer question but it is highly likely he has more to offer.

runners.name: Billyjoh
runners.breeder: Cleartherm Glass Sealed Units & J Holt
runners.comment: Had some high-class handicap form last year; sharper for reappearance; not ruled out
runners.spotlight: Had some smart handicap form last year, placed at Royal Ascot and twice at Glorious Goodwood (including third in the Stewards' Cup); 3lb lower today and he should be sharper with his Doncaster reappearance behind him; best form on good to firm.

quotes.race: Your First Destination Baggage Factory Lakeside Maiden Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I was so green in the first half of the race but once he kind of got himself straightened up in the last furlong and a half, he really put his head down and showed a good attitude. Billyjoh loved the ground, he never missed a foot on it. I don't think he's beaten a bad field there and being so green, I think you have to kind of upgrade that as well - Frederick Larson, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Akkadian Thunder
runners.comment: Low mileage for his age and still has an air of unfinished business; 6f on good ground a ?
runners.spotlight: All 12 runs over further, winning over 1m as a 3yo and two 7f handicaps for this yard last season; ended 2024 with some promising runs but he does have to prove himself over 6f and he might need slower ground at this distance.

stable_tour.quote: A good horse last year, he'll start off in the Victoria Cup. I thought he wanted only fast ground and then he ran a stormer on soft when second at Ascot in September. He's got plenty of ability and a lot of speed, and straight tracks suit him well. 14-04-25

runners.name: Trilby
runners.comment: Travels strongly; continued progress at Beverley ten days ago; up in class; softer ideal
runners.spotlight: Made fine progress last year while leaving the impression there was still a fair bit more in the tank; endured a miserable run through on his Doncaster return but had no problem justifying favouritism in a 5f Beverley handicap ten days ago; 4lb rise less of a concern than quicker ground and deeper opposition; likely he's up to this level but would be more appealing on slower than good.

quotes.race: Beverley Beaker Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: Trilby shows nothing at home. He's so laid-back for a sprinter. He's a pleasure to deal with and, because he's so easy and rideable, he just saves himself, which is great. He's been a great horse for us so far, so anything else he achieves is a bonus. He likes Haydock, and we all like a day out at York, so fingers crossed we'll keep tipping away with him. It will be fun to see what the season brings - Sam England, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: Sam: He's been a cracking buy for 2,000gns. He's best on a stiff sprint track.  Jonathan: He was a little disappointing last time in an amateur riders' race on the all-weather, but I think he's probably better on turf. He was unlucky not towin at Pontefract previously, he got there and pricked his ears in front and got caught. 08-02-24

runners.name: Havana Pusey
runners.breeder: C R Marks & R J Gallagher
runners.comment: Two good efforts in defeat this year & another big run expected despite the rise in class
runners.spotlight: Conditions should suit and she has run with great credit in two runs this season, narrowly failing in a big field at Doncaster on her return and then doing best of those held up at Newbury two weeks ago; apprentice takes off a handy 3lb and she's a strong candidate.

runners.name: Rousing Encore
runners.comment: Sharper for Newbury return; this mark looks within range on 2024 best; each-way shout
runners.spotlight: Did well for Ruth Carr in the second half of 2024 and still has some handicapping scope; closely matched with Havana Pusey on their Newbury meeting but that opponent had the benefit of a recent run; each-way shout.

stable_tour.quote: He's a consistent sort who came here from Richard Fahey's last summer. With a rating of 84, he'll be chasing some valuable pots and is entered for a Newbury handicap on Friday, which will be his first race of the year. Newbury is a long way to go for us, so I hope the journey is worthwhile. 09-04-25

1:35.race_name: Juddmonte British EBF Restricted Maiden Stakes (Bands B, C And D) (Qual') (GBB/IRE Incentive Race)
1:35.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places (GoingStick 6.7) (Watering) (Rail Movements: 2.35 & 3.10 +15yds)

runners.name: Chief Red Wing
runners.comment: Green and well beaten on recent Newbury debut; only 6-1 there and should do better in time
runners.spotlight: Prominent in the market ahead of his Newbury debut (5f, good) a fortnight ago but having been held up early, he was under pressure before halfway and looked green, allowed to coast home in the final furlong; should be capable of better but still not easily recommended.

runners.name: Coppull
runners.comment: Half-brother to a 7f AW winner out of a winning sprinter; stable 1-2 with 2yos in 2025
runners.spotlight: March foal; second foal; half-brother to 7f AW 2yo winner Worthington Lake (RPR 77); dam 5f/6f winner (78); stable's first 2yo runner of the year won at Newbury and the second was sent off favourite at Newmarket (disappointed); interesting to see if there's money about for him.

runners.name: Farough
runners.comment: £42,000 yearling; half-brother to a minor AW winner; betting should be a good guide
runners.spotlight: February foal; £42,000 yearling; third foal; half-brother to 6f AW 2yo winner Maui Breeze (RPR 76); dam runner-up 5f/6f (87); first 2yo runner of the year for Roger Varian (19% with 2yos in the last five seasons); betting usually a good guide as to expectation levels for newcomers from the yard.

runners.name: Italica
runners.comment: £45,000 half-brother to 5f winner Inspired Knowhow (RPR 72); yard 0-3 with 2yos this year
runners.spotlight: March foal; £45,000 yearling; fourth foal; half-brother to 5f winner Inspired Knowhow (RPR 72); dam US 1m turf winner (including 2yo stakes); some appeal on paper but others bring more pressing claims.

runners.name: Logi Bear
runners.owner: Ian Wight, Tony Lyons And Ptnr
runners.comment: Half-brother to two winners out of useful 2yo winner; strong yard; conceding age to rivals
runners.spotlight: May foal; fourth foal; half-brother to winners War Bride (6f; RPR 88) and Heathcliff's Girl (Greek 5f-6.5f); dam 5f/6f 2yo winner (94); powerful stable have already sent out two winning newcomers this season and he's an appealing type on paper, for all he's not yet reached his second birthday.

runners.name: Mighty Vega
runners.owner: D Macauliffe, A Don & Lds Bloodstock

runners.name: Affection
runners.comment: Dam a 7f AW winner from a good family;  yard have enjoyed 2yo success in the past
runners.spotlight: February foal; third foal; dam 7f AW winner (RPR 85), half-sister to winners Loving Dream (French 1m6f Group 1) and Legend Of Time (US 1m1f Grade 2) amongst others; first 2yo runner of the season for a stable that have enjoyed successs in this sphere.

runners.name: Call Me By My Name
runners.comment: 3,000gns yearling; dam a minor winner (including at two); betting can guide
runners.spotlight: March foal; 3,000gns yearling; first foal of a 6f winner (including 2yo; RPR 70); first 2yo runner of the year for the stable; betting can guide.

runners.name: Coyy
runners.comment: Promising fourth on Newbury debut two weeks ago, short of room close home; can do better
runners.spotlight: Promising fourth at Newbury on his debut 15 days ago, keeping on steadily before meeting a bit of traffic close home; stable won the race 12 months ago (with a newcomer) and he's more appealing than many.

runners.name: Lamnol
runners.comment: £17,000 yearling; dam from a good family; not obviously precocious but yard in form
runners.spotlight: February foal; £17,000 yearling; first foal of a maiden from a good family; not obviously precocious on pedigree but he was an early foal and the stable's horses are in good form; worth a market check.

runners.name: Rising Empire
runners.comment: 17,000gns yearling; 1st foal of 5f 2yo winner (RPR 82); stable in good form; check betting
runners.spotlight: February foal; 8,000gns foal, 17,000gns yearling; first foal of a 5f 2yo winner (RPR 82); stable going great guns and another for whom market support would look significant; first runner for sire Bangkok.

runners.name: Cotai Belle
runners.comment: £25,000 half-sister to two winners; others look more speedily bred
runners.spotlight: March foal; £25,000 yearling; fourth foal; half-sister to winners Christian David (7f AW 2yo/1m turf; RPR 93) and Liberty Of Devil (Hungarian 1m3f); dam 1m1f winner (65); others look more speedily bred.

runners.name: Mehmas Air Force
runners.comment: 32,000gns yearling; dam a 1m4f winner; stable's 2yos to have run have been quiet
runners.spotlight: April foal; 32,000gns yearling; second foal of a 1m4f winner (RPR 80); stable's first two 2yo runners of the year were well beaten.

runners.name: Hanney Girl
runners.comment: Some appeal on paper but stable's newcomers are usually better for a run
runners.spotlight: March foal; 9,000gns foal; second foal; closely related to French 4.5f/6f 2yo winner Awj (RPR 85); dam 6f AW 2yo winner (66); stable's newcomers usually better for a run.

4:20.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places (GoingStick 6.7) (Watering) (Rail Movements: 2.35 & 3.10 +15yds)

runners.name: Albert Cee
runners.comment: Has looked good for a couple of wins, including C&D; low-key return; slower ground ideal
runners.spotlight: Impressive over C&D in September 2023 when trained by Peter Chapple-Hyam; also looked good when making a winning debut for James Owen at Chepstow last June (6f, good to soft); low-key return to action/stable debut at Doncaster four weeks ago; may need slower ground to defy this mark.

runners.name: Ziggys Condor
runners.comment: Running well on AW since visored but unlikely to get an easy lead in today's field
runners.spotlight: The addition of a visor saw him win at Southwell (6f) in February, his first win since his 2yo debut; only fourth off this mark at Wolverhampton next time and an easy lead would seem unlikely.

runners.name: Invincible Speed
runners.comment: Flew home to win comfortably at Lingfield (6f, AW) latest; 5lb rise fair; surface query
runners.spotlight: Raced exclusively on AW since his racecourse debut; sprung a 40-1 surprise at Lingfield (6f) 25 days ago, finishing with a real flourish down the outside to win comfortably; 5lb rise fair enough and this should be run to suit; chance if he can deliver such a potent finish on grass.

runners.name: Twilight Romance
runners.comment: Deteriorating ground/change of tactics offer excuses for latest run; not ruled out
runners.spotlight: Hadn't been enjoying the rub of the green on AW and a change of tactics was employed at Newmarket 11 days ago (hood left off); unable to sustain the strong pace on that occasion but this is weaker and he has the assistance of Oisin Murphy in the saddle for the first time; faster ground in his favour too so there are grounds for optimism.

quotes.race: Reg Griffin Appreciation ebfstallions.com Maiden Stakes (GBB/IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: The Haydock race Twilight Romance ran in worked out well. He looked a little bit green there and still looked as though he would improve further today. We'll probably work back from the 300,000GBP sales race here in August - Sean Quinn, assistant trainer.

stable_tour.quote: I like him. He ran very well in a good race at Haydock first time out last year, then won impressively at York. He was third favourite for the sales race at the Ebor meeting but got very upset in the preliminaries and had run his race before the stalls opened. We decided to geld him and put him away and I wouldn't be surprised if he built on that York win this year. He's one for the good three-year-old sprint handicaps. 20-03-24

runners.name: Dashing Dick
runners.comment: Feasible mark on 2024 best but his record fresh doesn't suggest this will be his day
runners.spotlight: Prominent racer who made all for an easy win at Newmarket last July (6f, good to firm); runner-up off similar marks to this on a couple of occasions afterwards; 175-day absence looks the main concern today.

runners.name: Sondad
runners.comment: Southwell win last summer worked out well; sharper for recent 7f return; unexposed
runners.spotlight: Won a Ripon novice (6f, good to soft) and a small-field Southwell handicap last summer (strong form); well held on his recent return at Musselburgh (7f, good) but still low mileage and could have a bigger effort lurking.

runners.name: Justcallmepete
runners.comment: Starts out for new yard on a dangerous mark; good apprentice booked; one to consider
runners.spotlight: 1lb lower than when making breakthrough on turf at Newbury last September (6f, soft); good second at Southwell in December (7f) but well held on next three starts; left James Evans and now makes debut for Tony Carroll (same owners) in a change of headgear and with a good apprentice booked.

runners.name: Mart
runners.comment: Quiet on AW in late 2024 but returns to turf off a reduced mark; capable on a good day
runners.spotlight: Not at his best on AW on last four starts but a consequence of that is that he returns to turf off a 4lb lower mark than when winning at Brighton in September; capable on a good day.

quotes.race: Get Raceday Ready Handicap
quotes.quote: The last three times Mart has been here, he's had such a bad draw, so today I said to Dylan [Cunha, trainer]: "I'm drawn out in the car park again, I'm just going to have to make the most of him" and I did well enough to get where I wanted. I thought I was beaten turning in but then he hit his last gear and motored home to win quite nicely - Rhys Clutterbuck, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Havana Rum
runners.comment: Reappearance effort easy to forgive but, even so, he'll need a big step forward
runners.spotlight: Drawn wide when never in the hunt over 5f at Beverley on his return to action ten days ago; 2lb lower and back at his preferred trip this time; drying ground not sure to be in his favour though.

runners.name: Momaer
runners.comment: C&D winner; 7lb lower than for her Newmarket win in November 2023; retains ability; chance
runners.spotlight: Retains ability after a spell on the sidelines and she's now 7lb lower than when beating a big field at Newmarket in November 2023; the ground was heavy there but it was good to firm when she won over C&D in July 2023; absent for 12 weeks but still quite interesting.

quotes.race: Betfred Nifty 50 Handicap
quotes.quote: Momaer ran well at Windsor last time out on soft ground and she seems to love the ground like this. Josie (Gordon) knew what she was doing so I just left it to her. The mare had her ground and she just kept filling her up. When they went past the two pole I was quite happy with how she was going. This mare has held her form well all year - Mark Loughnane, trainer.

runners.name: Bay Breeze
runners.comment: On a good mark and he should come on for his recent return; each-way shout
runners.spotlight: Likely he'll be sharper with his recent return to action at Thirsk behind him; only 1lb higher than for a Nottingham win (6f, soft) last October and no problem with faster ground; ran well in a maiden on only previous visit to Leicester.

stable_tour.quote: He trotted up at Ripon, then ran a good race at Doncaster, where the ground was too firm for him. Gelding has helped him and he's stronger now. 02-05-22

2:35.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places (GoingStick 6.7) (Watering) (Rail Movements: 2.35 & 3.10 +15yds)

runners.name: Colinski
runners.comment: Shaped okay on recent Redcar debut but was a long way behind runner-up Asmen Warrior
runners.spotlight: Should improve on his recent Redcar experience (1m2f, good; 6-1) but he was a long way behind runner-up Asmen Warrior.

runners.name: Majestic Leo
runners.comment: Again missed the kick but finished well for 3rd at Lingfield; that form franked this week
runners.spotlight: Completely blew the start when tailed off on Newbury debut (1m) and wasn't the best away second time out at Lingfield (1m2f AW), though he stayed on well to finish under 4l off Sea Scout who won a Listed race at Epsom this week; a gelding operation could be the making of him; respected.

runners.name: Naval Command
runners.breeder: Miss K Rausing & Lope De Vega Syndicate
runners.comment: Just an ordinary debut at Kempton but he's up in trip and can do better at three
runners.spotlight: 360,000gns yearling and a half-brother to St Leger winner Eldar Eldarov; posted an ordinary RPR when a one-paced fourth at Kempton in October but now goes beyond 1m and should make a better 3yo.

runners.name: Revelio
runners.comment: First foal out of a 7f 2yo/1m Listed winner and runner-up in 1,000 Guineas
runners.spotlight: First foal out of a 7f 2yo/1m Listed winner and runner-up in 1,000 Guineas; needs a close look in the market.

runners.name: Sail On Jimmy Boy
runners.comment: First foal; dam tailed off in a bumper; wouldn't be the obvious answer
runners.spotlight: First foal; dam tailed off in a bumper and half-sister to winners Grand Canyon (1m1f/1m2f Flat and 2m hurdle) and Alquimia (7f/1m); wouldn't be the obvious answer to a race of this nature; stablemate Serenity Blue is far more appealing on paper.

runners.name: Serenity Blue
runners.comment: 360,000gns yearling who never raced for Sir Michael Stoute; nicely bred
runners.spotlight: 360,000gns yearling who never raced for Sir Michael Stoute; nicely bred, being a brother to four winners including smart 7f-1m4f performer King Of Conquest; dam a 1m2f Listed winner; makes sense to check the market.

runners.name: Tarriance
runners.comment: Half-brother to 1m/8.5f winner Western Reserve (RPR 113); one of two Juddmonte newcomers
runners.spotlight: Seventh foal; half-brother to 1m/8.5f winner Western Reserve (RPR 113); dam 6f 2yo/7f Group 3 winner (114), half-sister to 1m2f Group 1 winner Promising Lead; the market should be informative with owners Juddmonte doubly represented.

runners.name: Urban Warrior
runners.comment: Tip-top pedigree but already gelded and William Buick rides his stablemate
runners.spotlight: Eighth foal; closely related to winners Sayyida (Group-placed 1m4f; RPR 104) and Commanding Prince (7f/1m; 90) and half-brother to Derby winner Masar; top pedigree but already gelded and William Buick rides his stablemate.

3:45.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places (GoingStick 6.7) (Watering) (Rail Movements: 2.35 & 3.10 +15yds)

runners.name: Knights Gold
runners.comment: Races freely but has progressed since handicapping; respected up 4lb for his Kempton win.
runners.spotlight: Caught the eye when fifth at Kempton in March before winning there (again 7f) 11 days ago, despite racing freely again; progressive since handicapping and, having been raised 4lb, he's respected back on turf granted that he doesn't pull his chance away.

runners.name: Cardinal Point
runners.owner: Middleham Park Racing Cxxi And Partner
runners.comment: Failed to progress from her debut; midfield on yard debut; improvement needed.
runners.spotlight: Beaten at 1-3 in a match race at Southwell in September and finished well held on his other start (again 1m) for Charlie Appleby; well beaten under 7lb claimer when midfield at Kempton (7f) on her yard debut (bought for 4,000gns); improvement needed on handicap debut.

runners.name: Juba
runners.comment: Failed to beat a rival home on handicap debut; back on turf with blinkers added.
runners.spotlight: Best effort when 3l sixth of nine on soft ground at Newbury (6f) in September; didn't beat a rival on handicap debut at Southwell (7f) 18 days ago, albeit racing freely out wide; switched back to turf with blinkers applied.

runners.name: Ornately
runners.comment: Has been off since winning on handicap debut in February; could have more to offer.
runners.spotlight: Showed improved form when winning on handicap debut at Wolverhampton  (7f, AW) in February on her second start for this yard; up 4lb and off since, but she's well bred (out of a Group 1 winner) and could have more to offer now back on turf for first time since soft-ground debut.

quotes.race: BetMGM: It's Showtime Handicap (Div II)
quotes.quote: We were quite clear we wanted to get cover on Ornately and it worked out quite nicely. She settled well and David Evans's horse [Piranha Rama] dragged us all the way to the furlong pole. She's done it well - Daniel Muscutt, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Standput
runners.comment: 1lb above January's Wolverhampton win but needs to bounce back from two poor efforts.
runners.spotlight: Won at Wolverhampton (7f) off 1lb lower in January and posted another good effort when fourth at Southwell next time; disappointing in her two starts since and needs to bounce back on her first attempt on turf since debut.

runners.name: Blewburton
runners.comment: Sole win came here on debut; 6l behind Knights Gold at Kempton last time.
runners.spotlight: Sole win came on debut last April here over 5f on soft ground; didn't make an impact in Dubai this winter and 6l fifth (behind Knights Gold) in first-time cheekpieces at Kempton 11 days ago; bit to find on that form and needs the return to this venue to make a difference.

quotes.race: British Stallion Studs EBF Restricted Maiden Stakes (Bands B, C And D) (GBB/IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: It's hard to know what he has beaten but Blewburton is a nice horse. He wants six furlongs but they went hard and it suited him. It can be tricky with a penalty and we may look at the Woodcote at Epsom - Eve Johnson Houghton, trainer.

runners.name: Tolerance
runners.comment: Failed to build last time on his encouraging Newcastle run; more needed back on turf.
runners.spotlight: Shaped encouragingly when fourth at Newcastle last month (6f; first start after a wind operation and with tongue tied) but took a step backward from that when upped to this trip at Wolverhampton; needs more on turf debut.

runners.name: Penelope Valentine
runners.comment: Never involved at Wolverhampton last time after being raised 8lb for her Kempton win.
runners.spotlight: Second or third in her first three handicaps before winning well at Kempton (7f); never got involved at Wolverhampton after being raised 8lb; improvement came when switched to AW so the return to turf asks questions; more needed.

runners.name: Rokuni
runners.comment: Won a maiden at Brighton last year; yet to make an impact for this stable; visor removed.
runners.spotlight: 1-12; won a maiden at Brighton when trained by Eve Johnson Houghton; yet to make an impact for this yard despite a sliding mark; returns to 7f with the visor, which has been worn the last twice, now removed.

runners.name: Sofian
runners.owner: Sas Logistics Contracts Ltd Nikki Evans
runners.comment: Fair fifth in a 1m Bath maiden last time; more needed back in a handicap.
runners.spotlight: Best effort from five races when fourth of ten on soft ground at Ffos Las (7.3f) in August; fair fifth in a maiden at Bath on first start after a gelding operation; drops back to 7f with more needed back in handicap company.

runners.name: Mamma Maria
runners.comment: Beaten favourite in two handicaps last year; more needed on reappearance.
runners.spotlight: 0-5; showed promise in novice/maiden events but a beaten favourite in her two starts in handicap company; returns to turf with more needed on her first outing since November.

runners.name: Hush Puppy
runners.comment: Showed promise in two starts last year; may do better in handicaps; turf debut.
runners.spotlight: Showed promise in her two starts (1m/7f) last year, favourite at Lingfield on debut; well beaten on her return at Southwell last month but he may do better now switching to handicaps; turf debut.

3:10.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places (GoingStick 6.7) (Watering) (Rail Movements: 2.35 & 3.10 +15yds)

runners.name: Myna
runners.breeder: Mrs S M Rogers & Sir Thomas Pilkington
runners.comment: 0-10 but very close to breaking duck on reappearance (1m2f) last May; squeak for new yard
runners.spotlight: 0-10 for Marcus Tregoning but he lost out only narrowly on reappearance at Newbury (1m2f, good) last May and ran another good race there in July; had a low-key end to 2024 but has a squeak back from break for new yard following 3,200gns sale in January.

runners.name: Sceptic
runners.comment: Took advantage of major weights drop when AW winner in March; not so good next time
runners.spotlight: Had plunged in the weights after a terrible 2024 for Ian Williams and Patrick Morris and he took full advantage at Wolverhampton (extended 1m1f) in March, landing a touch on second run back with this yard; not in the same form there since and hard to know whether refitted cheekpieces will be any help (they weren't in three previous tries).

runners.name: Green Power
runners.comment: Five most recent wins on AW; rarely runs on grass now and well held at Nottingham recently
runners.spotlight: Five most recent wins on AW and he doesn't run much on turf these days, the losing run going back nearly six years; has plenty to find after a weak effort back on grass at Nottingham this month.

quotes.race: Chelsea Barracks Handicap
quotes.quote: That was a good performance by Green Power. We wanted to try him over five furlongs, so we decided to run him here and see how he got on. We have the Shergar Cup in mind for him next and he won at that meeting last year - John Gallagher, trainer.

quotes.race: Dubai Duty Free Shergar Cup Sprint (Handicap)
quotes.quote: I've been trying to find a nice 6f race for Green Power. He had a good start to the season, but we'd been struggling to find a race for him on some nice ground, without it being rock hard. I think we found it today. I'll have a think and have a chat with the owners about plans, but he's progressive. He'll act on a lot easier ground as well. There's more to come from him - John Gallacher, trainer.

quotes.race: Bettinggods.com Quentin Franks Racing EBF Novice Stakes
quotes.quote: It was quick when Green Power made his debut but he's a big horse and I think he'll be better on soft. He'll make a cracking three-year-old sprinter, but I think there's more to come from him at two - John Gallagher, trainer.

runners.name: Little Tiger
runners.comment: Won twice at 1m2f in second half of 2024; below best final 2 starts; possible reviver
runners.spotlight: Found his feet for refitting of blinkers and return to 1m2f in the second half of 2024, winning over C&D (good) and, after a break, at Brighton (good to soft); never on his game for either of his subsequent starts but it could be a different story back here for yard that won this in 2021.

quotes.race: Mercer Handicap
quotes.quote: Everything went quite smoothly with Little Tiger.  I tried to go forward, but there was a bit of pace on, and as he's been running over further he couldn't go with them.  He came off the bridle a long way out, and I saw the best of him once hitting the rising ground - Edward Greatrex, rider, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.name: Guendolen
runners.comment: 0-6 but was a persistent third on second handicap run (extended 1m1f; AW); can improve
runners.spotlight: 0-6; just a modest handicap debut at Sandown in September but she had shown promise in maiden company previously and was a persistent third at Wolverhampton (extended 1m1f) in October; this stiffer test can suit and Oisin Murphy (2-9 for trainer) is booked; hood refitted.

runners.name: Muhib
runners.comment: Quite seriously hampered two starts ago (1m2f) but less to like about subsequent defeat
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced maiden who ran a couple of fair races on AW when first handicapping, then quite seriously hampered at Doncaster (1m2f, good to soft) in March; however, has more to prove on a subsequent defeat at Nottingham.

runners.name: Magna Vega
runners.comment: Close up on yard debut (1m); no great promise in two 1m2f runs in July; off since October
runners.spotlight: Started well for this yard when close up at Windsor (1m, good) last May but he didn't look a natural for this trip twice in July and his season ended with a heavy defeat; others higher up the list.

stable_tour.quote: The handsome colt is from a lovely Ballylinch Stud family and has really pleased me in all I have asked of him. He has done some solid work and I hope to have him ready to run in the next two to three weeks. He looks alright and should be winning races this season. I think he has a future. 06-07-23

runners.name: Douglas Dc
runners.comment: 0-17 on the Flat but 7lb lower than latest turf run, when third here (1m4f) last July
runners.spotlight: Hurdle winner in Ireland during 2022 who has been running well on the AW of late and although 0-17 on the Flat he's 7lb lower than his latest turf run, when third on this course (1m4f) last July; thereabouts again.

stable_tour.quote: Never got into the race last time at Downpatrick, but is quite a versatile sort and should pay his way this season. He'll mix and match between hurdles and fences. 24-10-23

He was second at Leicester last week on the Flat behind Thrilling Dream. He's never won on the Flat but has been placed many times. He has won over jumps in the past for Gordon Elliott in Ireland and will probably go jumping again soon over 2m. He was placed twice in the winter over hurdles at Sandown and was fourth in a handicap hurdle at Ascot at 125-1 behind Titan Discovery. 07-08-24

runners.name: Star Of Jupiter
runners.comment: Won AW classified (1m1f) in February; well held in handicaps; now hooded; turf debut
runners.spotlight: Off the mark in a Wolverhampton classified event (about 1m1f; first-time blinkers) but he's been soundly beaten in handicaps since and an about turn needed for the fitting of a hood on turf debut.

runners.name: Temur Khan
runners.comment: Seriously out of form since the latest of eight wins, on AW (1m4f) last July
runners.spotlight: Has been seriously out of form since the latest of eight wins, in a 1m4f classified on Lingfield AW last July, and has nowhere to go from a handicapping perspective; best watched.

quotes.race: Sky Sports Racing Sky 415 Apprentice Handicap (Hands And Heels Race) (Racing Excellence Series)
quotes.quote: The plan was just patience. Temur Khan went through the race nicely and picked up well - Molly Gunn, jockey, speaking on Sky Sports Racing.

stable_tour.quote: He'll go to Brighton and is entered in the 1m4f classified stakes on Thursday. He won there last October and also at the early August meeting there in 2021 and twice in 2022. He won the other day at Lingfield, so he'll arrive there in good form. He goes on any ground and should run very well. 07-08-24

4:50.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places (GoingStick 6.7) (Watering) (Rail Movements: 2.35 & 3.10 +15yds)

runners.name: Newyorkstateofmind
runners.comment: Multiple winner who is down in the weights; not fired in two runs this year though
runners.spotlight: Multiple winner who has dropped to a handy mark; neither run this year suggests he's primed to capitalise though.

quotes.race: Read Katie Walsh On Betway Insider Handicap
quotes.quote: Newyorkstateofmind picked up for me in the straight, he's very honest and genuine. The gap opened up for us. He's been in great form lately - Ray Dawson.

stable_tour.quote: Three wins from 13 races last year was a nice return for this fellow, two on the all-weather and one on grass. Six of his nine wins have been on the all-weather and when it comes to the turf, he has to have theound fast. He was a bit disappointing when he returned to Wolverhampton from his winter break, but it is onwards and upwards. There's a race at Thirsk on Saturday that looks right for him. 09-04-25

runners.name: Ideal Guest
runners.comment: 5 wins for former yard; often overdone it up front for new stable which also runs Raft Up
runners.spotlight: Five turf wins for George Margarson; has often overdone it up front for new connections and now drops in trip with a hood fitted; stable look to have more obvious claims with Raft Up.

runners.name: King Of The Jungle
runners.comment: Running well in defeat on AW since late December; best turf form on softer than good
runners.spotlight: Several good runs in defeat on AW since late December; effective on turf but suspicion he would be better suited by slower ground.

runners.name: Raft Up
runners.comment: In good form since hooded, winning twice on AW and close 2nd over C&D latest; solid claims
runners.spotlight: Having dropped a long way in the weights he was revived by the application of a hood in February, winning a 6f 0-50 classified event at Newcastle in good style; followed up in a handicap back there one week later and he was a close second over C&D on this month's return turf; 1lb rise shouldn't prevent another big run.

runners.name: Waistcoat
runners.comment: 0-8 and beaten favourite in two of three runs for new yard; drops to 6f for the first time
runners.spotlight: Hasn't matched last year's best in three runs for Dylan Cunha in 2025 (beaten favourite in two of the runs); drops to 6f for the first time with Sean Levey an interesting booking.

runners.name: Grand Citadel
runners.comment: 0-10 in Ireland but her best form makes her of major interest on her stable debut
runners.spotlight: 0-10 in Ireland but she did best of those drawn low when second of 18 at Navan last July (6f, good to firm; strong form for the grade); creditable 1m run at Killarney two days later; absent for 285 days but she makes her stable/British debut in a less competitive race than she's used to; yard does well here and she's of some interest.

prev_owners.owner: Mrs J E Mulhern & David S McGuinness

runners.name: Pembrokeshire

prev_owners.owner: P C J Dalby & R D Schuster

runners.comment: Yet to shine for this yard but returning to turf looks favourable and he's on a handy mark
runners.spotlight: Free-going sort who hasn't been at his best for his new stable on AW this year; now 10lb lower than for his Ayr win last summer (7f, good), however, and no surprise were the return to turf to have a positive effect.

quotes.race: Racing TV Handicap
quotes.quote: Pembrokeshire completely boiled over in the paddock last time and ran his race before he even got down to start. Dom [Hislop] has done a good job leading him up, he's kept a lid on him and got him down to the start in one piece. He had a good gallop to aim at, he was able to get into a rhythm and I thought he stayed the seven [furlongs] quite well - Iain Jardine, trainer.

runners.name: Shark Two One

prev_owners.owner: New Vision Bloodstock And Miss J R Macey

runners.comment: Course winner; best of prominent racers when 3rd of 17 at Thirsk latest; each-way shout
runners.spotlight: Gained his last win at this track (7f, good to soft) back in October 2023; operating off a reduced mark now and did best of the prominent racers when third of 17 at Thirsk two weeks ago (6f, good); would seem more likely to give his running than many.

quotes.race: Tattersalls Ireland Super Auction Sale Stakes (Plus 10 Race)
quotes.quote: Shark Two One is a lovely little horse. I probably got there soon enough but he quickened up well and was maybe getting a bit lonely going to the line - Colin Keane, rider

runners.name: The Cola Kid
runners.comment: Struggled for form on AW this year; on a dangerous mark if the return to turf perks him up
runners.spotlight: Well short of his best this year but he's dropped 8lb and is potentially well treated if the return to turf perks him up.

quotes.race: Summer Racing At Naas Apprentice Handicap
quotes.quote: We thought he would need the run. He was a bit sick after the run the last day (tenth at Fairyhouse at the end of May) and I'd say he's probably better fresh. He stayed at it well. There is a race for him at Fairyhouse next Sunday, a six furlong 0-70 handicap. He's a good fun horse, very honest and stays going. Every time he ran up to now there was a problem with the draw but today everything worked to plan - Michael Brown, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: Formerly with Michael Browne, he is another who joined us in September. It took us a while to get his head in front, but he did win at Newcastle (6f) in March and has run very well in defeat in each of his last two runs. I have given him a little break since then, but he is still on a competitive mark. 04-05-22

runners.name: Gypsy Nation
runners.comment: 19-race maiden; the odd good run this winter but last time wasn't one of them
runners.spotlight: 19-race maiden; the odd fair run in low-grade AW events this year but last time wasn't one of them; tailed off in both turf starts but they were over 1m and 1m2f.

runners.name: Magic Fluke
runners.comment: Third in a 0-50 classified at Southwell in January but he's regressive and can be opposed
runners.spotlight: Placed in a 0-50 classified at Southwell in January but he's a regressive 4yo with plenty to prove.

runners.name: Tilsworth Silver
runners.comment: Poor form from 5f to 7f and can't be recommended at present
runners.spotlight: Poor form from 5f to 7f and can't be recommended at present.

5:35.race_name: M.C.H. Hutchinson Memorial Trophy Handicap (GBBPlus Race)
5:35.stalls: Straight & 2m - Stands' side; 1m4f - Centre; Remainder - Inside

runners.name: Touch The Moon
runners.comment: Spell in Bahrain featured two wins; returns to home soil off a tough mark
runners.spotlight: Spell in Bahrain featured two wins but ended with below-par effort; returns to home soil off a tough mark, 9lb higher than last British run.

runners.name: Cabrera
runners.owner: Hot To Trot Racing 1 And Mrs David Egan
runners.comment: Steadily progressive in the main last year; may still have more to offer
runners.spotlight: Consistent and steadily progressive last year until below par in cheekpieces final outing; headgear now removed; may still have more to offer.

quotes.race: Darley EBF Fillies' Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I thought why not have a go, it's worth £40,000 and these races are very hard to win in the spring time and trying to win one now is probably a little bit easier. And they're very important for all owners and trainers. The track at Carlisle didn't suit Cabrera last time. If we'd had something to aim at a bit longer here she might have been a bit more impressive - Ed Bethell, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: She's been placed several times and finally got her head in front in a valuable novice at Doncaster last week. We'll see what the handicapper does with her this week before deciding where to go next. 02-08-24

runners.name: Sam Hawkens
runners.comment: Low-mileage 4yo; may be capable of progress on third run for new stable
runners.spotlight: 1m4f winner for previous yard; still has low mileage; gelded since last run; may be capable of progress on this third run for new stable.

stable_tour.quote: We were very pleased with his run at Newbury the other day. I wish I had the guts to tell Sean to make the running as he would have gone very close. As he steps up to a mile and a half, maybe even a mile and six furlongs, you'll see the best of him. He's a very likeable horse. 29-04-24

runners.name: Percy Shelley

prev_owners.owner: John Johnstone, Capt Adrian Pratt & Lord Clinton

runners.comment: 0-12 in Britain but market support should be noted on debut for new yard
runners.spotlight: Three wins in France; 0-12 for David O'Meara but market support should be heeded on debut for new yard; sold 25,000gns since last run.

runners.name: Knightswood
runners.comment: Record of 112 over C&D; second off 4lb higher in this race last year; solid
runners.spotlight: Record of 112 over C&D, most recently second off 4lb higher in this race last year; filled same position at Thirsk on reappearance; solid.

runners.name: Dancingwithmyself
runners.comment: Record of 2-2 at Ripon; still unexposed over middle distances; interesting
runners.spotlight: Has a record of 2-2 at Ripon (1m2f/1m4f) and is still unexposed over middle distances, so looks interesting back here on reappearance.

runners.name: Flickering Halo
runners.comment: Chance depends on how well he responds to physical tweak (gelded)
runners.spotlight: More exposed than some of the other 4yos in this field; chance depends on how well he responds to physical tweak (gelded since last run).

6:05.stalls: Straight & 2m - Stands' side; 1m4f - Centre; Remainder - Inside

runners.name: Tees Spirit
runners.owner: Ingleby Bloodstock Ltd & The Ivy League
runners.comment: Hit hard for a conditions race win last September; well beaten on return; vulnerable
runners.spotlight: High in the weights after a productive 2024 campaign, having been hit hard for a conditions race win at Beverley (5f, good) in September; has a tough task with Venture Capital on their run at Doncaster earlier that month and was well beaten at Southwell nine weeks ago; looks vulnerable.

quotes.race: Eddie And Violet Smith Conditions Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It wasn't my plan to come here, but when I saw the entries I said to the lads we're going to have to throw him in as it was only going to be four runners. Fair play to Ali Rawlinson [rider of King Of Stars], he and Mia had a talk as we all know how King Of Stars runs. I said to Mia see how you jump, see how Ali jumps and go from there, as there was no point in the two of them taking each other on because it's a long way home with a bit of give in the ground. Mia gave him a good ride. She's doing really well and she's at the right stable with Eve [Johnson Houghton], and she used her head there. Tees Spirit came into the race in good form and he's been a star this year. Emaraaty Ana had the form in the book, so it was a great performance and I'm chuffed to bits for Mia and the horse - Adrian Nicholls, trainer, speaking to Racing TV.

quotes.race: Abergwaun Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Tees Spirit came here instead of the Beverley Bullet. I was delighted that the ground was so quick and he just seems to be getting quicker. He loves rattling off fast ground over 5f. He's in the Abbaye and he will probably run - Adrian Nicholls, trainer.

quotes.race: Racing League On Sky Sports Racing Handicap
quotes.quote: We haven't done anything different with Tees Spirit but his confidence is sky high and he's on a roll. We only have 20 horses and it's great for us to have one as good as this. He hasn't stopped improving yet and he might be good enough to be aimed at Listed and Group races eventually. He's shown he likes this course, so the Portland Handicap is certainly a consideration for his next race - Adrian Nicholls, trainer.

quotes.race: Watch On Racing TV Handicap
quotes.quote: Tees Spirit was doing everything right at home and had been working nicely. He put the race to bed fairly quickly - Barry McHugh, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He's done brilliantly for us. Winning the Dash at Epsom a couple of years ago was massive for me and then he backed it up in a Listed race at Tipperary. He hit all the heights and had such a good year back then, but what goes up must come down. He had his wind done and it took him a while to come back but Mia's claim really helped with that. He's come back this year in great form, winning first time at Newmarket, after which he was stepped up in class. He came back to form at Sandown the other day and you don't get rated 97 for nothing. There's a 5f handicap on the first day of Glorious Goodwood and a similar race at Haydock on the Sunday of that week and he'll go to one of those depending on the ground. It's good to have a horse to take you to the big gigs. 26-07-24

runners.name: Pilgrim
runners.comment: Royal Ascot win last summer makes him of interest; excuses since; still quite low mileage
runners.spotlight: Bolted up at Musselburgh last June (5f, good to soft) before making light of an 11lb rise at Royal Ascot, beating 27 rivals in the Palace Of Holyrood House (5f, good to firm); drawn poorly at the Ebor meeting and both subsequent defeats can be forgiven too; mark not impossible if returning to his best but he didn't live up to market billing on his return last April.

quotes.race: Palace Of Holyrood House Stakes (Handicap)
quotes.quote: Pilgrim has done it well there. I thought he might have knackered his handicap mark at Musselburgh. We always thought that he was a really nice horse, not just a good two-year-old, and he's shown there today he's good. It's a great place to come and have a winner so it's very nice. This lad has a lot of speed. He travelled very well and he won quite comfortably. He done it easy - Joe Fanning, rider.

runners.name: Vintage Clarets
runners.comment: Not featured in two runs this month; could do with some more weight off his back
runners.spotlight: Came good last autumn on slow ground, winning 5f handicaps at Chester and Catterick; yet to shine this season though and could do with some more weight off his back.

quotes.race: William Hill Catterick Dash Handicap
quotes.quote: It was a bit easier this year [than last year]. Vintage Clarets' last couple of runs were good, he enjoys that ground, he broke well and I was able to get the run of the race - Osin Orr, rider.

quotes.race: William Hill Catterick Dash Handicap
quotes.quote: We got there plenty soon enough and in the last-furlong Vintage Clarets was only just doing enough but I did think we got nailed on the line.  He's a legend of a horse and he's been very consistent all year. It's great to get a win on him - Oisin Orr, jockey.

runners.name: Venture Capital
runners.comment: Still has potential at 5f and he should be sharper for his recent return; interesting
runners.spotlight: Form took off in the autumn when returned to 5f and faced with soft ground, winning at Doncaster (officially good but changed to soft after the race) before solid runs at Ascot and Doncaster; looked as though the run was needed on his Pontefract reappearance and he remains capable of rating a fair bit higher.

quotes.race: JKR Industrial Cleaning Ltd Handicap
quotes.quote: Venture Capital showed a lot of speed last time at Thirsk and immediately after the race my old man felt that sprinting could be his gig and he's shown that there. It was only his first try over six furlongs so I'd like to think there's a lot more to come from him. There's some nice sprints in the summer and he's shown he handles the ground there. We'll see what the handicapper does but he could progress now at that trip. The time was good there and in these big sprint handicaps you need a horse that stays the trip well so that's a big positive. We'll see what comes up but I'm sure by the end of the year there will be bigger and better things on the horizon - Adam Ryan, trainer's son and assistant.

stable_tour.quote: He's very genuine and we've been very lucky with the sire's progeny. He's a homebred and the owner's first winner and I can see them having some good fun with him on turf. He'll get a mile no problem and we'll look for a nice handicap and work from there. 04-04-24

runners.name: Manila Scouse
runners.comment: Sharper for return and likely he'll bag the stand rail; yard won this in 2022 and 2023
runners.spotlight: Useful on his day, winning twice last season (6f, good; 5f, good to soft); finished behind Venture Capital at Pontefract on his reappearance (raced wide) 18 days ago and like that rival he should be sharper for the run; likely to bag the stand rail from stall 6 and Amie Waugh takes off a useful 3lb; of interest for a yard that won this in 2022 and 2023.

quotes.race: tote On The Go At tote.co.uk Racing League 18 Handicap (Trainers Reg' To Racing League)
quotes.quote: Manila Scouse probably just likes the rain and the uphill finish, because he stays six [furlongs] so he travels really strong as well and gets through the line strong - David Allan, jockey, speaking on Sky Sports Racing.

quotes.race: Sky Bet Sunday Series Apprentice Handicap
quotes.quote: Manila Scouse ran a blinder last week and the drop back to five really suited him. He stays it really well, especially in that ground. He's very game and stuck on well in the last furlong - Oliver Stammers, jockey.

quotes.race: British Stallion Studs EBF Novice Stakes (GBB Race) (Div I)
quotes.quote: Manila Scouse loved this ground and the tongue-tie helped as well - Paul Mulrennan, rider.

stable_tour.quote: He had time off as a three-year-old, we couldn't train him, but he came back really well last season. He wants five furlongs with some cut. He was entered at Newmarket, but the ground was advertised as fast so I didn't declare him, although it actually would have been all right. 23-04-24

runners.name: Ventura Express
runners.comment: Met trouble at Pontefract last time; not ruled out off the same mark
runners.spotlight: Met trouble at Pontefract last time when still in contention; stable still not quite firing on all cylinders but enough of them are running well to make him of interest.

quotes.race: Join Racing TV Now Handicap
quotes.quote: Ventura Express jumped a little bit slow but he soon travelled well through the race and he picked up and won nicely. I thought he would run well but I didn't quite expect that. He's been gelded which makes a massive difference because I don't think there's much else different than what Richard Fahey does, they're a lot better than us! - Paul Midgley, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's been fantastic for us and absolutely adores Pontefract. The course is everything he needs as it's a stiff 5f and he's always at his best there. He's really solid and seldom runs a bad race because he's so honest and genuine, and he probably overachieves a little bit. Last time at Thirsk I don't think they went that hard early, whikind of played against him. But he'll probably go to Beverley or Pontefract again next time. Handicap wise, he'd be at the top of where he needs to be but last season we had to step him up a grade and he still ran well. He wears his heart on his sleeve. 28-06-24

runners.name: Mondammej
runners.comment: Four AW wins this winter but could prove vulnerable from just out of the weights
runners.spotlight: Four AW wins over the winter but off lower marks than today's; unplaced in two visits to Ripon; vulnerable from just out of the weights.

quotes.race: Weekly £5 Free Bet With BetUK Handicap
quotes.quote: You can just see that Mondammej has absolutely thrived since he's had it (wind operation). He's very well behaved now, he's getting manageable. He probably travelled far too well today over the six furlongs and the line came just in time - Cam Hardie, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

quotes.race: £30 In Free Bets With BetUK Handicap
quotes.quote: Thankfully Mondammej was well behaved today with all the hiccups in the stalls. He had a nice gallop to aim at and he came alive around halfway. He loves it here and it was just a case of waiting for the gaps to open and pushing the button on him - Cam Hardie, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

quotes.race: Heed Your Hunch At Betway Handicap
quotes.quote: Mondammej deserved to win another one as he's gone close in a few big sprints. The ground was too sticky at Doncaster as he's a top of the ground horse. There's the six-furlong Coral Sprint at York in three weeks' time if the ground is right - Antony Brittain, trainer.

quotes.race: Riu Hotels And Resorts Handicap
quotes.quote: The first time we ran Mondammej he was probably a little but green but still travelled well and got the job done smartly. We ran him a couple times after and he just started getting a bit hot-headed so we had to try a few different things. He absolutely ran away with me one day at Newcastle. He's a bit of a ticking time bomb and was being a handful in the stalls but today he was absolutely pitch perfect, he settled lovely through the races and we think a lot of him. He was climbing a bit on the grass, it's a new experience for him but he'll improve for that and I'm glad we're getting his head in the right place. You'd like to see him take on some of these big handicaps. I know he had a low weight today but he's done it easily enough. He has the potential it's just keeping a lid on him - Cam Hardie, jockey.

5:05.stalls: Straight & 2m - Stands' side; 1m4f - Centre; Remainder - Inside

runners.name: Mr Hampstead
runners.comment: Six-race maiden who has been highly tried; may progress now handicapping over 2m
runners.spotlight: Six-race maiden; twice highly tried (including in the Derby) last June then fared better back at novice level on final outing (1m6f); gelded since; may progress now handicapping over 2m.

stable_tour.quote: A lovely horse who is going to excel over a trip. They didn't go all that fast on his comeback at Newbury last week and he hit a bit of a flat spot when they started to quicken, but he hit the line strongly and I think he'll have learned plenty and will come on a ton for that run. He'll run over a mile and a half next time and I'm confident he'll end up a good horse over a trip. 25-04-24

runners.name: Forza Orta
runners.comment: Won at York Ebor festival in 2023; below that form since
runners.spotlight: Defied a 6lb higher mark at the York Ebor festival (2m) in 2023; has failed to repeat that form since and folded tamely on reappearance; drops back further in grade.

quotes.race: Sky Bet Stayers Handicap (Heritage Handicap)
quotes.quote: That was a good performance. Forza Orta had looked a bit one-paced over shorter distances so we decided to try something different. He got the trip well, we always thought he would eventually, and that opens an awful lot of avenues to us - Kevin Ryan, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: We're aiming him at the Chester Cup but he'll probably need to win before then to get in. He travels strongly in his races, stays well and it would be lovely to get him into a race like that. We can look at all those staying races this season. 04-04-24

He is a very consistent gelding having finished in the first three in nine of his ten starts. Hamilton clearly suits him with both of his successes to date at the Scottish track, including last month over 1m5f. Last time out at Haydock he travelled like the winner but when he was let down on the quick ground it was too fast for him. He has an entry in the Duke of Edinburgh at Royal Ascot, although he may not get in off his mark. Should that be the case we will find him another race soon and I feel he is definitely going the right way. 15-06-22

runners.name: Artisan Dancer
runners.breeder: S C E A Ecurie Haras Du Cadran Et Al
runners.comment: Close second in AW event on reappearance; 0-9 on turf
runners.spotlight: Five-time AW winner off lower marks; close second at Kempton (2m) on seasonal debut; may remain competitive but is no certainty to go one better, being 0-9 on turf.

runners.name: Zimmerman
runners.comment: Respectable fourth of six in this race 12 months ago
runners.spotlight: Respectable fourth of six (off 1lb higher) in this race on reappearance 12 months ago but didn't peak until York success in July; perhaps one to look out for later in the campaign.

quotes.race: John Smith's Stayers' Handicap
