quotes.quote: I wasn't worried about losing it in the stewards' room as the second bumped him too. I thought he'd go well but I don't know what happened at Newcastle. Zimmerman loves soft ground and stays two miles, so we'll find something for him if it stays wet - Tim Easterby, trainer.

quotes.race: Sky Bet Sunday Series Stayers Handicap
quotes.quote: Zimmerman did very well, he loves this ground and was very hardy at the finish there. He switched off and I was happy with his position - James Sullivan, rider.

quotes.race: Pertemps Newton Handicap
quotes.quote: Zimmerman ran well on his last two runs as well and is an improving horse. He should handle a step up in trip again and is a nice staying prospect - James Sullivan, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He ran well all last year and is another who's in the Chester Cup, and he'll be entered for the Northumberland Plate too. He's an improving staying horse and he runs at Ripon first. 23-04-24

runners.name: Surrey Belle
runners.comment: Two hurdles wins for current yard; three-time Flat scorer; may have more to offer
runners.spotlight: Progressive over hurdles for current yard until a disappointing effort (in hat-trick attempt) last time; three-time Flat winner and may still have more to offer in general; enters calculations.

quotes.race: High Gosforth Park Golf Club Mares' Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Surrey Belle is a good filly, she's got a great cruising speed and loads of scope. When I bought her I had fences in mind.   She'll probably end up a 130-rated filly over hurdles and she'll be a really exciting novice chaser for next season.   We'll keep an eye on the weather at Cheltenham, when you go up into that type of class give in the ground would help her a lot, but she's also in the Herring Queen Series final at Kelso, that's a £100,000 race and gives me a bit more time after today so that's probably where she'll go next - Adrian Keatley, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: She's a big, galloping filly by Golden Horn. She  won at Wolverhampton in November and then was third first time out back there. I suppose we were slightly disappointed but she ran a bit fresh. We've always thought she was better than she'd shown. She ran well on Sunday when third at Nottingham - sadly the jockey on a late Sunday afternoon, after an excellent debrief, got distracted and failed to weigh in. 06-06-24

runners.name: Little Peter
runners.comment: Hasn't lived up to market expectations in last two Flat runs
runners.spotlight: Bumper/Flat winner who made the frame over hurdles last time; hasn't lived up to market expectations in last two attempts under this code but can't be written off yet.

runners.name: Diamand De Vindecy

prev_owners.owner: Nicolas Longere & Ecurie Haras Des Beaux

runners.comment: Close second in this contest last year; emphatic win at Pontefract on reappearance
runners.spotlight: Close second in this contest last year and looks in the right form to go one better, having registered an emphatic success at Pontefract (2m2f) on reappearance; respected.

6:35.race_name: Watch Sky Sports Racing In HD Handicap
6:35.stalls: Straight & 2m - Stands' side; 1m4f - Centre; Remainder - Inside

runners.name: Urban Sprawl

prev_owners.owner: Sheikh Hamdan bin Mohammed Al Maktoum

runners.comment: Followed his AW win with a creditable fourth at Newmarket returned to turf; solid
runners.spotlight: Generally in good form on AW this year and followed his Lingfield win with a creditable fourth at Newmarket (Class 2) returned to turf; solid claims back down in grade.

quotes.race: Victoria Racing Club Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: I had no idea whether I'd won or not, but Urban Sprawl is game and he's in good form. He was really gunning for the line and he was able to stick his head down where it matters. He's tough - David Probert, rider.

quotes.race: Twickenham Nursery Handicap (Jockey Club Grassroots Nursery Qualifier)
quotes.quote: Urban Sprawl probably won't go to Carlisle on Thursday. I don't know what Darley will want to do with him. He's quite exposed for one of theirs and is what he is, but is very genuine and Andrea said he could go a bit further, which could be key in getting more out of him. I don't think ground matters to him - Mark Johnston, trainer.

runners.name: Pisanello

prev_owners.owner: Haras D'Etreham, Riviera Equine Sarl & Ecurie De Montlahuc

runners.comment: Has defied higher marks; ran encouragingly (close third) over C&D on seasonal debut
runners.spotlight: Sometimes slowly away but is well capable of being involved; defied higher marks in 2023 and 2024; ran encouragingly (close third) over C&D on seasonal debut; shortlisted.

stable_tour.quote: He won at Beverley on his comeback and then ran a nice race in the Thirsk Hunt Cup. A nice, big horse with some reasonable form in France, he could have a good enough summer and might run at York this week. 09-05-22

runners.name: Good Morning Alex
runners.comment: Could prove resurgent with Redcar reappearance under his belt
runners.spotlight: Productive spell featured six wins, the most recent last June; not in same form since but could prove resurgent with Redcar reappearance under his belt.

quotes.race: Weatherbys Global Stallions Handicap
quotes.quote: We were up 11lb in a better grade on totally different ground so we went with an open mind again and Good Morning Alex has done it well. He's been a real surprise package from going to the all-weather in December thinking it was a last-chance saloon. He's just grown up and matured. In fairness, he was a late foal but he's improved out of all recognition. Connor [Beasley, jockey] said he wouldn't want the ground any faster than it was today so I think a lot will depend on the weather as to where we go. This was very much the target - Nicola Barron, joint-trainer.

runners.name: Drink Dry
runners.comment: Gained sole win in 8.5f maiden; gelded since last run; debut for new yard
runners.spotlight: Ex-Botti runner who registered sole success in 8.5f maiden at Beverley (good to firm); gelded since last run; market may prove best guide on stable/seasonal debut; still with same owner.

runners.name: Garden Oasis
runners.comment: Six-time C&D scorer; ran respectably here on reappearance; frame possibilities
runners.spotlight: Veteran who is a six-time C&D scorer, including twice in 2024; ran respectably here on reappearance and ties in with Pisanello on that effort; again has frame possibilities.

quotes.race: Bishopton Equine Handicap
quotes.quote: Garden Oasis was quickly away and I needed that as I knew there was going to be more pace in the race and, obviously drawn one, I could hold the rail if I was quick out so it was ideal, but I did have to go a little bit quicker than I wanted to into the bend. I got a bit of a breather round it but he does stay a bit further so you can stretch them and make sure they don't come past you at any speed. He's as game as they come and loves it around here - David Allan, jockey, speaking on Sky Sports Racing.

quotes.race: Sky Sports Racing Virgin 519 Handicap
quotes.quote: Garden Oasis is still full of enthusiasm. You've got to run the speed off them as he's getting older and he's not got the turn of foot he used to have but he digs in really well for you - David Allan, jockey, speaking on Sky Sports Racing.

quotes.race: Visit attheraces.com Handicap
quotes.quote: Garden Oasis absolutely thrives around this place, and the most important thing was just to jump from the gates fast. He was soon on the front end and dug in well - David Allen, rider

quotes.race: Visit attheraces.com Handicap
quotes.quote: I'd love a yard full of horses like Garden Oasis, he's wonderful. He's very uncomplicated, the more you complicate it the worse he runs. He's tough, he likes it here and he goes on pretty much any ground - Tim Easterby, trainer.

quotes.race: Visit attheraces.com Handicap
quotes.quote: Every time Garden Oasis ran last season he came back not right. He was actually in the sales but we decided not to sell him. It took a long time to get him right in the winter but he's been sound and okay recently and ran a good race at Haydock but just didn't get home. David won it in the first furlong - Tim Easterby, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He ran a bit disappointingly at Ripon, where he just didn't fire for some reason, but he's come out of that well. A mile is his trip, on good ground. 02-05-22

runners.name: Mudamer
runners.comment: Only 1-14 for current stable; lacked consistency last season
runners.spotlight: Only 1-14 for current stable, the win at Beverley in 2023; some encouraging runs last season but lacked consistency; not the percentage call.

quotes.race: Jill Willows Handicap
quotes.quote: I thought Mudamer would have won before now - he's very talented. I think the cheekpieces have helped him a lot because he hit the front at York and then just shut down. It's just made him focus. He's made hard work of it on what he does at home. I have a horse, Scottish Summit, rated 91 and this fella will kick him into touch without even coming off the bridle - Geoff Harker, trainer.

runners.name: Stockpyle
runners.comment: Encouraging form for new yard features a close second at Doncaster (7f); possibilities
runners.spotlight: Encouraging form for new yard features a close second at Doncaster (7f, good); far from disgraced at Musselburgh last time considering the race didn't pan out favourably; possibilities.

quotes.race: Plan A Consulting Handicap (Chepstow Mile Series Qualifier)
quotes.quote: We were going to sell Stockpyle at the July sales, but PJ [McDonald, jockey] said something was troubling him. We took him to the vets and checked him, where we found a huge growth under his epiglottis. It was like having a cork in a bottle and he couldn't breathe, but now his confidence is being rewarded. He's been running some lovely races and has been unlucky not to win more. He's from a very good family and there's more excitement to come - William Muir, joint-trainer.

stable_tour.quote: Another of La Pyle's progeny who is a half-brother to Pyledriver, he did his owners proud this summer by winning twice in four days at Chepstow and Wolverhampton, both over 7f. I love him and having had a tiny injury as a juvenile - a split pastern that healed beautifully - he has made steady progress. He was last of six at Chepstow on Monday but must have the ground just right and when things go his way he looks pretty impressive. Clearly 7f is his trip and there are more wins to come this year. 01-09-22

runners.name: Havana Prince
runners.comment: Latest performance took his Redcar record to 2-2; form figures over C&D read 114
runners.spotlight: Latest performance took his Redcar record to 2-2; has form figures of 114 over this C&D; now upped further in grade off a tougher mark but seems likely to perform well.

quotes.race: Watch Racing TV In Stunning HD Handicap
quotes.quote: Havana Prince is a grand little horse. He may not be the classiest, but he makes up for that by being tough and genuine. That was as quick ground as he wants and you won't be seeing him again until there's a bit of rain. He loves Redcar and Ripon, so we'll wait for the rain and won't have to go out of Yorkshire to find more winning opportunities - Tony Coyle, joint-trainer.

quotes.race: Amy Washbourne Bloom Digitally Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: I would have been unlucky as I got hampered out of the gate and Havana Prince had to work hard to get into a good position. I thought we got racing plenty early and I needed the line in the last fifty yards - David Nolan, jockey, speaking on Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Spioradalta
runners.comment: Ran promisingly at Pontefract on reappearance; finished third in this race last year
runners.spotlight: Losing run is mounting up but he has dropped in the weights and ran promisingly (close fourth) at Pontefract on seasonal debut; finished third in this race last year; not ruled out.

runners.name: Poets Dawn
runners.breeder: Mrs J K Powell & Catridge Farm Stud
runners.comment: Multiple winner down the years but was soundly beaten on reappearance
runners.spotlight: Multiple winner down the years but was soundly beaten on reappearance and thus appears to have a weaker chance than fellow 10yo Garden Oasis.

quotes.race: Join Racing TV Now Handicap
quotes.quote: It felt like the leader was getting away but Poet's Dawn has a big heart and he dug deep. He's a grand horse to have in the yard, he goes on any ground and very versatile - David Allan, jockey.

quotes.race: Ice Co Supporting Macmillan Handicap
quotes.quote: Poet's Dawn slipped coming out the stalls at Beverley last time and couldn't get in the race. He loves a bit of cut in the ground and David said he seemed to go better left-handed than right - Tim Easterby, trainer.

quotes.race: Racing UK In Glorious HD Novice Auction Stakes
quotes.quote: The race that Poet's Dawn ran in at Redcar last time worked out quite well with several winners coming out of it, and this didn't look a particularly good race - Tim Easterby, trainer.

runners.name: Enthused
runners.comment: Last seven wins over hurdles; recent AW form is unconvincing
runners.spotlight: Last seven wins over hurdles; recent AW form is unconvincing; on a handy mark returned to turf but seems far from certain to take advantage.

quotes.race: Friends & Family Remembering Norman Sharpe Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: I thought the ground would be on the soft side for Enthused as he likes it rattling but fair play to him and he only ran on the Flat a week ago. Alex Chadwick, jockey, talking to Sky Sports Racing.

quotes.race: Welcome Back To Ludlow Conditional Jockeys' Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: It's amazing, you can't top it. I had Enthused in my hands the whole way and his jumping is perfect. He doesn't get much height but he's very quick and he took me to the front and off we went - Jamie Gambin, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

quotes.race: Visit racingtv.com Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Enthused ran well at Fakenham but got trapped on the inside when they had taken the last hurdle out and he was unlucky. He was given a great ride from Alex Chadwick and will run next at Fakenham's final meeting of the year next month - James Owen, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's owned by good friends of mine, the butcher Michael Clarke and the farmer George Wright, and he's a lovely little horse who cost me£5,500 this time last year. He's run 17 times since then, won five times and earned just under£45,000. He's ultra-consistent but very ground-dependent; he needs top of the ground. We probably shouldn't have run him at Cheltenham last time when the rain came. He had a history of breaking blood vessels but I hope we've sorted that out we turn the horses out a lot and he's gained confidence. He's having a break and will be back in the spring. Two miles is his trip. 06-12-23

runners.name: Volenti
runners.comment: Four wins on AW since last autumn; 20lb higher than last turf appearance
runners.spotlight: Four wins on Newcastle AW since last autumn; something to prove back in this sphere, being 20lb higher than last turf appearance.

4:35.race_name: Download The Raceday Ready App Restricted Maiden Fillies' Stakes (Bands B, C And D) (GBB Race)
4:35.stalls: Straight & 2m - Stands' side; 1m4f - Centre; Remainder - Inside

runners.name: Duchess Tattoo
runners.comment: Has to concede plenty of weight to younger rivals on this belated debut
runners.spotlight: Second foal; dam AW bumper winner both starts, half-sister to Group-placed 6f 2yo winner Miss Elizabeth; has to concede plenty of weight to younger rivals on this belated debut.

runners.name: Arkinthestars
runners.comment: Not progressing but repeat of her Beverley second should see her in the mix
runners.spotlight: Now 0-5 and doesn't look progressive, despite finishing a clear second at Beverley (extended 1m) ten days ago; still, unlikely to be far away with something similar.

runners.name: Praying For Time
runners.owner: Tactful Finance, S Roden & T Solway
runners.comment: Had two runs in these colours for the Gosdens and neither was overly encouraging
runners.spotlight: Had two runs in these colours for the Gosdens and neither was overly encouraging, especially the second (1m4f); was also easy to back on both occasions; best watched on stable debut.

runners.name: Rommie The Miracle
runners.comment: Showed a bit more second time out at Lingfield (1m4f) but was still beaten about 12l
runners.spotlight: Showed a bit more second time out at Lingfield (1m4f) but was still beaten about 12l and produced a modest RPR.

runners.name: Coedana
runners.owner: Julie And David R Martin And Dan Hall
runners.comment: 40,000euros yearling; wouldn't need to be any great shakes to make an impact here
runners.spotlight: 40,000euros yearling; seventh foal; half-sister to winners Imperial Command (7f/1m; RPR 94), Dianthus (7f; 91), Rum Going On (7f; 65) and Aunty Audrey (1m-13.7f Flat; 2m hurdle); dam placed 1m6f (59), out of 1m4f Listed winner; wouldn't need to be any great shakes to make an impact here.

runners.name: Empress Of All
runners.comment: Half-sister to Teona who was a top-class 1m2f-1m4f performer for the same connections
runners.spotlight: Seventh foal; half-sister to Teona who was a top-class 1m2f-1m4f performer for the same connections; hood fitted from the outset but she's kicking off in a winnable maiden.

runners.name: Percys Daydream
runners.comment: Ran to a modest level when fourth over 8.6f at Wolverhampton in September
runners.spotlight: Ran to a modest level when fourth over 8.6f at Wolverhampton in September; best watched for now.

runners.name: Phyllis Burton
runners.comment: Conceding experience to Sixteen One when not far behind that rival at Lingfield (1m)
runners.spotlight: Conceding experience to Sixteen One when not far behind that rival at Lingfield (1m); can improve over this longer trip that she's bred for.

runners.name: Sixteen One
runners.comment: Had no excuses from the front at Bath last week (1m, good to soft) and that made it 0-7
runners.spotlight: Had no excuses from the front at Bath last week (1m, good to soft) and that made it 0-7; should have some say but hard to trust now.

7:05.race_name: Evening Racing On Friday 9th May Handicap
7:05.stalls: Straight & 2m - Stands' side; 1m4f - Centre; Remainder - Inside

runners.name: Invitorio
runners.owner: Grange Park Racing Xviii & Ofo Partners
runners.comment: Creditable fourth in Pontefract handicap on reappearance; still open to further progress
runners.spotlight: Off the mark in Redcar novice event on final 2yo start; ran creditably (2l fourth) in Pontefract handicap on reappearance, again over 6f; still open to further progress; respected.

runners.name: Ziggys Ariel
runners.owner: Middleham Park X, Simon Wood & A Haynes

prev_owners.owner: Middleham Park Racing X And A Haynes

runners.comment: Successful off this mark on AW as a 2yo; fighting chance returned to turf
runners.spotlight: Recorded 6f wins in turf maiden and AW handicap (off this mark) last term; creditable fourth in higher grade at Wolverhampton most recently; fighting chance back in this sphere.

runners.name: Beaujolais Nouveau
runners.comment: Ended her 2yo season with a Beverley win and may be capable of further improvement
runners.spotlight: Ended her 2yo season with a success in Beverley maiden (5f, good; fifth start) and may be capable of further improvement; likely to be effective at 6f this year; one to consider.

runners.name: Rogue Bullet
runners.comment: Needs further progress to follow up Brighton novice win but that's not impossible
runners.spotlight: All out to win Brighton novice event (6f) on reappearance, opening his account at the ninth attempt; needs further progress to follow up but that's not an impossibility.

runners.name: Macedonian
runners.breeder: Mrs S M Rogers & Sir Thomas Pilkington
runners.comment: AW success in most recent 6f attempt; promising second in sole turf start; interesting
runners.spotlight: Scored at Kempton (AW; handicap debut) in most recent 6f attempt and may have more to offer back over this trip; promising second in sole turf start (debut); interesting.

runners.name: Chuti Manika
runners.comment: Juvenile campaign featured a turf win and three third-place finishes on AW
runners.spotlight: Juvenile campaign featured a 7f maiden success on turf and three third-place finishes in 6f handicaps on AW; each-way possibilities, provided he returns in similar form.

quotes.race: Bradford Club Optimists' Corner Restricted Maiden Stakes (For horses In Bands C And D) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Chuti Manika's first run, he got a bit lonely out in front and got caught close home. He was very professional through the race today - Charlie Johnston, trainer, speaking on Racing TV.

runners.name: Sundiata Keita
runners.comment: Open to improvement now handicapping and back up in distance
runners.spotlight: Has shown clear promise in his two 6f attempts on AW; gelded since a lesser effort over 5f last time; open to improvement now handicapping and back up in distance.

runners.name: East Tyrone
runners.comment: Has failed to repeat the form of York win; had wind surgery since last run
runners.spotlight: Made a winning handicap debut in York event (6f, good to soft) last July but failed to repeat the form subsequently; chance hinges on physical tweak (had wind surgery over the winter).

quotes.race: John Smith's Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: East Tyrone ran a great race on debut. Beverley was a run too quick after that but he's shown what he's capable of. We've always liked him. There's more to come and he'll improve with racing - Adam Ryan, assistant trainer.

runners.name: Toota
runners.comment: Showed improvement last July but absent since; market instructive
runners.spotlight: Showed improvement for a hood and switch to handicap level last July, finishing third twice, but has been absent since; the betting may prove best guide to expectations.

4:00.race_name: British Stallion Studs EBF Novice Stakes (GBB/IRE Incentive Race)
4:00.stalls: Straight & 2m - Stands' side; 1m4f - Centre; Remainder - Inside

runners.name: Clear Force
runners.comment: Started favourite at Musselburgh where he beat all bar a sharp sort who made all
runners.spotlight: Supremacy colt who is in excellent hands; started favourite at Musselburgh and duly showed promise, beating all bar a sharp sort who made all; respected with progress on the cards.

runners.name: Malinga The Slinga
runners.comment: Slowly away and always detached at Beverley on Thursday
runners.spotlight: Brings the worst form, having been slowly away and always detached at Beverley on Thursday; best watched.

runners.name: Valor Spirit
runners.comment: Showed ability at Leicester and the form has received a couple of boosts since
runners.spotlight: Ardad colt who showed ability with his third-place finish at Leicester and the form has received a couple of boosts since; open to improvement and has possibilities.

runners.name: Dakota Dawn
runners.comment: £52,000 yearling; by Sioux Nation; market instructive
runners.spotlight: £52,000 yearling; by Sioux Nation and the first foal of a twice-raced (RPR 44) half-sister to US 1m Grade 2 winner Up In Time; market instructive.

runners.name: Secret Hideaway
runners.comment: From a precocious female line, with dam and granddam 2yo winners; likely type
runners.spotlight: Starspangledbanner half-sister to 7f winner Elsals (RPR 87); dam Listed-placed 5f 2yo winner (90), out of 7f 2yo Group 3 scorer; likely type judged on that female line.

5:45.race_name: Dine In The Horizons Restaurant 'Confined' Apprentice Handicap (Not Won A Race Since 2024 Flat Turf)

runners.name: Yeoman
runners.comment: Fourth of 21 at Doncaster latest and has possibilities if he gets a good pace back in trip
runners.spotlight: Most of his runs have been on AW and all three wins have been gained here (8.6f); last success was in September 2023 but that was off 8lb higher and he ran well to finish fourth of 21 at Doncaster (1m, good) last month; now drops back in trip in new headgear and he has possibilities if he gets a good pace to aim at.

runners.name: Touchwood
runners.comment: On dangerous mark but he's not easy to predict and was out the back at Thirsk latest
runners.spotlight: Four-time winner (6f-7.6f), split between turf and Polytrack; on dangerous mark but he's been hard to predict since his last success (June 2024) and he was out the back at Thirsk two weeks ago; others preferred.

stable_tour.quote: With his ability to act on the all-weather andass, he is an asset to the yard, his best distance being 7f. He will now go to Thirsk on Saturday for a 7f, 0-85 handicap. 09-04-25

runners.name: Swiss Ace

prev_owners.owner: The Bottom Liners & Mrs R Carr
Derrick Smith & Mrs John Magnier & Michael Tabor

runners.comment: Eyecatching third at Southwell (6f) last Sunday and has claims if he can back that up
runners.spotlight: On lengthy losing run and has had a few false dawns since November but he caught the eye with his late headway when third at Southwell (Tapeta; blinkers reapplied) last Sunday; that was an eyecatching effort over 6f and has claims if he can back that up.

stable_tour.quote: We all know what aeat sire Kingman is but not everyone remembers Swiss Lake, who was a two-time Listed winner. Despite hereeding, Swiss Ace still has a lot to prove being without a win since December 2023. Finished mid-division at Redcar on Monday and should progress. 09-04-25

runners.name: Zu Run
runners.comment: Last win was over C&D and was a good third at Chelmsford last week; in the mix
runners.spotlight: Mixed results since his C&D win in October but he's had a couple of close calls here since then and was a creditable third at Chelmsford last Friday; has good draw back at this track and he could have a big role to play.

quotes.race: Ire-Incentive, It Pays To Buy Irish Novice Stakes (GBB Race) (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: It all happened a bit too quickly for Zu Run on his debut at Salisbury over the six furlongs. He missed the break and got unbalanced at times but I felt that he hit the line well enough for an extra furlong to help him and that's exactly what happened here. He showed a good attitude to the line and it's nice that he's taken a good step forward from that first experience - David Probert, jockey.

runners.name: Sibyl Charm
runners.comment: Had wind surgery before close second at Southwell last Sunday; respected back up in trip
runners.spotlight: Won two in a row at Newcastle (6f/7f) last spring; 0-13 since but she's dropped down the weights and was a close second at Southwell (6f) last Sunday, on her first run after wind surgery; ties in closely with Swiss Ace on that form and she's respected back in trip.

stable_tour.quote: She did really well for us on the all-weather, then had a break and ran all right at Ayr and Carlisle since she came back. She wants top of the ground and I hope we're in for a dry spell as she has a couple of good options at York. 26-07-24

runners.name: Rhythmic Acclaim
runners.comment: In-form 5yo but she's 0-11 on AW and her turf wins have been at 6f; others look stronger
runners.spotlight: Runner-up at Yarmouth before her respectable fourth at Chelmsford (7f, AW) last Friday; was just behind Zu Run last time but she's now 0-11 on AW and her three turf wins have been over 6f; others are more persuasive.

runners.name: Eden Storm
runners.comment: In fair form but he's 0-9 for current yard and doesn't look the percentage call
runners.spotlight: Two C&D wins for previous yard; currently in a consistent vein of form but is 0-9 for this stable and doesn't look the percentage call in this competitive race.

runners.name: Francisco
runners.breeder: Alvediston Stud & Mrs R M Wardall
runners.comment: Low-mileage 4yo but slow starts have been an issue and was always in rear last time
runners.spotlight: 4yo who has finished placed in two of his four handicaps but slow starts have been an issue and he was always in rear at Chelmsford (7f, AW) last month; that took his record to 0-7 and others are more convincing.

runners.name: Autumn Festival
runners.comment: On much lower mark on AW and was placed on recent Kempton reappearance; not ruled out
runners.spotlight: All eight wins have been on turf but he returned from a break with front-running third at Kempton (1m, Polytrack) 11 days ago; that was a good effort off his much lower AW mark and he's not ruled out back in trip.

stable_tour.quote: He won seven races for us last year, so it's hard to think he's well handicapped. He'll improve for his comeback and will run himself back into form. He likes to lead. 04-05-23

8:45.race_name: Book Hotel And Conferencing At Wolverhampton Handicap

runners.name: Aphrodites Rock
runners.comment: Makes handicap debut after seven months off; half-sister to two AW winners; cheekpieces on
runners.spotlight: Didn't beat many in three turf novices last year, although was beaten only 2l when fourth of five at Haydock (1m, soft) on the final occasion; makes her handicap debut in first-time cheekpieces after seven months off but she's a half-sister to two AW winners; worth a second look.

runners.name: Riyadh Gem
runners.comment: Landed a Southwell nursery in November; may be more to come from him upped in trip
runners.spotlight: Hinted at ability in three AW novices over 7f last October and improved when just getting up to make a successful nursery debut at Southwell (1m, Tapeta) in November; off since and now 4lb higher, but he is stoutly bred on the dam's side so there may be more to come from him upped again in trip.

runners.name: Zizi
runners.comment: Course winner (8.6f), but failed to beat a rival on her reappearance/handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Won an uncompetitive maiden here (8.6f) last September, but failed to beat a rival on her reappearance/handicap debut at Southwell (7f, Tapeta) this month; improvement clearly needed.

runners.name: Phrygia
runners.comment: Ought to stay the longer trip on handicap debut; worth considering back at this venue
runners.spotlight: Showed some promise in her first two starts over 7f here in January, but well held at Chelmsford (7f, Polytrack) the following month; hood removed for handicap debut and she ought to stay the longer trip; worth considering back at this venue.

runners.name: Must Believe
runners.comment: Placed in three of his four starts on Polytrack, but he needs a bit more; visor on
runners.spotlight: Placed in three of his four starts on Polytrack and ran better than his finishing position would suggest at Chelmsford (1m2f) last time, but he needs a bit more if he is to get off the mark; visor given a go (has worn cheekpieces).

runners.name: Crackalackin
runners.comment: Has run well over C&D and worth a second look back at this trip; cheekpieces on
runners.spotlight: Fourth in his first three starts during the winter, including over C&D; didn't get home when fifth of seven on handicap debut at Southwell (1m4f, Tapeta; first start since being gelded) this month, but worth a second look back in trip with cheekpieces given a go.

runners.name: Rorys Gold
runners.comment: Second in a Lingfield maiden last time; market useful on handicap debut; off three months
runners.spotlight: Has shown ability, not least when second of nine in a Lingfield maiden (1m, Polytrack) in January; up in trip on handicap debut after three months off, having been gelded in the meantime; market may be useful.

runners.name: Zabeel Rain
runners.comment: Has regressed since her promising debut at Kempton in December; visor on
runners.spotlight: Bred to be useful but has regressed since her promising debut when third of eight at Kempton (1m, Polytrack) in December; finished last of seven (behind Crackalackin) on handicap debut at Southwell (1m4f, Tapeta) this month; needs the switch to a visor to bring about a resurgence.

runners.name: Threatening
runners.comment: Made a winning handicap debut over 7f at Southwell; strong claims under a penalty.
runners.spotlight: Progressed to win on handicap debut at Southwell (7f, Tapeta) six days ago following three months off, despite looking green; this extra distance holds no concerns and cheekpieces are applied; carries a 6lb penalty but looks the type to continue his progress.

runners.name: Unforgetable Belle
runners.comment: 6lb higher than when winning on handicap debut over 7f in October; makes her AW debut.
runners.spotlight: Made a winning handicap debut on heavy ground at Leicester (7f) off 6lb lower in October; makes her AW debut on this first outing since and will need to settle now upped to 8.5f (raced freely on a couple of occasions last year) but she's lightly raced and demands respect.

runners.name: Crest Of Light
runners.comment: Posted a solid effort when third at Southwell last time; cheekpieces now applied.
runners.spotlight: Better switched to handicaps, winning at Southwell (1m) in February off 3lb lower; didn't help his chance by hanging left over that same C&D 53 days ago but still posted a solid effort to finished third (runner-up won twice since); cheekpieces now and there could be better to come from him.

runners.name: Blue Seeker
runners.comment: 3lb higher than his 7f win here in December; third on his last two starts; trip to prove.
runners.spotlight: Sole win came here on handicap debut over 7f off 3lb lower in December; last two efforts have been creditable, though he did carry his head a bit awkwardly last time; still has it to prove over this trip (beaten 5l when fifth over C&D).

runners.name: Boubou
runners.comment: Failed to beat a rival on stable debut; improvement required now switched to handicaps.
runners.spotlight: Has failed to progress in three outings (6.5f/6f) and failed to beat a rival home on stable debut last time when she hung left; improvement required now handicapping over this longer trip.

runners.name: Little Bittern
runners.breeder: Mrs S M Rogers &sir Thomas Pilkington

prev_owners.owner: The Late Sir T Pilkington & Mrs S Rogers
Sir Thomas Pilkington & Mrs S M Rogers

runners.comment: 5lb above her sole win (January); below that level since; has left Eve Johnson Houghton.
runners.spotlight: 25-1 when winning off 5lb lower on handicap debut at Southwell over 6f in January following three quick runs over longer trips; failed to match that level in two further 6f starts and has left Eve Johnson Houghton (changed hands); back up in trip; best watched.

6:45.race_name: Download The At The Races App Maiden Fillies' Stakes (GBB Race)

runners.name: Dubai Beach
runners.comment: Beat a length by a subsequent winner at Kempton in November; shouldn't be far away
runners.spotlight: Both starts at Kempton a year apart, sent off 8-15 when beaten a length into second of four (1m) in November; winner landed a handicap next time and this trip may be more suitable on breeding; shouldn't be far away.

runners.name: A Day In Bloom
runners.comment: Failed to beat a rival in two 5f AW maidens this month
runners.spotlight: Failed to beat a rival in two 5f AW maidens this month.

runners.name: Aoifes Thunder
runners.comment: Well held in two 7f Tapeta novices four months apart; handicaps an option after this
runners.spotlight: Well held in two 7f Tapeta novices four months apart, albeit hinted at abililty on the first occasion; handicaps an option after this.

runners.name: Crimson Flo
runners.comment: Fifth of six on her debut over C&D last month; needs plenty of improvement
runners.spotlight: 66-1 when fifth of six on her debut over C&D last month; a couple of those in front of her have won since, but she still needs plenty of improvement.

runners.name: Cuban Lady
runners.comment: Runner-up on her Southwell debut in November; shortlisted if building on that
runners.spotlight: Sent off 33-1 for her Southwell debut (6f, Tapeta) in November, but showed plenty of promise in staying on into second of ten (first and third have won since); shortlisted if building on that.

runners.name: Desert Beauty
runners.comment: Has beaten a total of one rival in her first two starts; handicaps her thing after this
runners.spotlight: Big prices and beat a total of one rival in her first two starts over 6f at Chelmsford and Southwell; handicaps are likely to be her thing after this.

runners.name: French Sand
runners.comment: Second in both starts over C&D last month; latest form franked and looks the one to beat
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in both starts over C&D last month and although beaten further on the second occasion, the winner of that race went on to land a 0-100 handicap at Newmarket; looks the one to beat.

runners.name: Kalahari Blue
runners.comment: Placed in two turf maidens last summer; a player if ready to roll after six months off
runners.spotlight: Useful form in a couple of turf maidens last summer, especially when beaten a neck at Nottingham (6f, good to firm); found the trip too sharp at Southwell (5f, Tapeta) in October, but a player back over this distance if ready to roll after six months off.

runners.name: May Encounter
runners.comment: Third on debut and faced stiff task next time; worth a market check on reappearance
runners.spotlight: Showed promise when third of eight on her Salisbury debut (6f, good to firm) last summer (just behind Tropical Heat) and faced a stiff task in a Newmarket sales event (6f, good to soft) in October; half-sister and dam both won on the AW and worth a market check back from seven months off.

runners.name: Piddies Pearl
runners.comment: Behind two of these when last of nine on her Southwell debut this month
runners.spotlight: Behind two of these when last of nine on her Southwell debut (6f, Tapeta; 80-1) this month.

runners.name: Tempest Star
runners.comment: Regressed after promising debut; makes stable debut after six months off; market revealing
runners.spotlight: Beaten only half a length on her debut for Ger Lyons at Naas (5f, good) last July, but regressed in her next two starts, the latest at Dundalk (5f, Polytrack) in November; makes her stable debut (same owners) after six months off and the market should be revealing.

runners.name: Tropical Heat
runners.comment: Promising second on Salisbury debut last July; a player if in similar form, but drawn wide
runners.spotlight: 7-2 when a promising second of eight (just ahead of May Encounter) on her Salisbury debut (6f, good to firm) last July; a player if in similar form back from nine months off, though she has an awkward draw.

runners.name: Vamp
runners.comment: Non-runner
runners.spotlight: Steadily progressive in three starts and had two of these behind when beaten a neck at Southwell (6f, Tapeta) this month; has the form to figure, but the outside stall isn't ideal; non-runner.

stable_tour.quote: I like this filly but she won't be out again for a while. 18-09-24

6:15.race_name: Play At The Races Stableduel Novice Stakes (GBB Race)

runners.name: Sudden Flight
runners.comment: Battled well when winning at Southwell and he's open to more progress back up in trip
runners.spotlight: Made a promising debut when third over C&D in February and he took a major step forward when beating the favourite over 5f at Southwell (first two 6l clear) three weeks later; this is tougher under a penalty but he battled well last time and is open to more progress back at this track.

runners.name: Carrados
runners.comment: Runner-up at Goodwood in final two 2yo runs, with RPR of 83 last time; respected on return
runners.spotlight: £360,000 breeze-up buy; had excuses for failing to justify favouritism on Leicester debut (5f, good to soft) last May and he left that form behind when runner-up under prominent tactics at Goodwood (6f, good/good to firm) in his final two runs last season; recorded an RPR of 83 last time and he's strongly respected back in trip on his return.

runners.name: Our Planet
runners.comment: Big improvement dropped to 5f when a close second over C&D last month; hood now added
runners.spotlight: 220,000euros yearling; faded into sixth of 12 on Kempton debut (7f) in October but he found plenty of improvement dropped to 5f when front-running second here (85-40 favourite) last month; that was a narrow defeat behind a previous winner and he's a big player on that form; hood added.

runners.name: Havanas Dream
runners.comment: Tailed-off last in two runs in the autumn and latest was at this track
runners.spotlight: Tailed-off last in her two runs (5f/6f) in the autumn and latest was at a massive price at this track.

runners.name: Hello Luna
runners.comment: Ex-Irish; tailed off on recent stable debut at Southwell (7f) and others are preferred
runners.spotlight: 220,000euros yearling/breeze-up 2yo; promising third in one run (5f, Polytrack) for Joseph O'Brien in December but, after changing hands for 36,000gns, she failed to beat a rival on recent stable debut at Southwell (7f); that trip may have stretched her but this looks a tough assignment back at 5f; cheekpieces added.

runners.name: Peregrine Falcon
runners.comment: Only just caught over C&D on stable debut and has claims if she can back that up
runners.spotlight: Mixed record in a variety of races for Emmet Mullins last season including a run in the Albany; 20-1 on stable debut over C&D (maiden) three weeks ago but she travelled well for long way and was only just caught on the line; that was her best effort so far and has claims if she can back that up.

8:15.race_name: Free Tips Daily On attheraces.com Handicap

runners.name: Tazaman
runners.comment: Record fresh suggests recent reappearance would have been needed; respected back in a 0-55
runners.spotlight: Ran his best race since returning from a mammoth absence last summer when second of ten at Southwell (1m6f, Tapeta) in September; his record fresh suggests his recent reappearance at the same track would have been needed; respected back down to a 0-55.

runners.name: Man Of Riddles
runners.comment: C&D winner who has dropped 9lb below his last winning mark; hood on
runners.spotlight: Two of his four wins have come here, including one over this trip; beaten a long way at Pontefract (2m6f, good) 12 days ago but he is much better on the AW and his previous third of seven here (1m6f) was encouraging; 9lb below his last winning mark and a player with a hood given a go.

runners.name: Razzo Italiano
runners.comment: Not in much form under either code lately and needs to improve on Flat handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Three-time winner over hurdles but well beaten in three Tapeta novices over 7f-1m4f; not in much form under either code lately and needs to improve on Flat handicap debut.

runners.name: Sophar Sogood
runners.comment: Has won over this trip at Southwell; 3lb lower than when winning at Kempton last August
runners.spotlight: Five-time AW winner including over this trip at Southwell; 3lb lower than when winning at Kempton (2m, Polytrack) last August and shortlisted in the returning cheekpieces.

runners.name: Courageous Gold
runners.comment: 0-5; over 10l behind Fine Print here three weeks ago; 6lb pull not enough to tempt
runners.spotlight: Best effort in five starts when fourth of nine on handicap debut here (1m6f) last month, but he finished over 10l behind Fine Print over the same trip three weeks ago; 6lb pull not enough to tempt.

runners.name: Fine Print
runners.comment: Off the mark at the 19th attempt over 1m6f here three weeks ago; high on the list
runners.spotlight: Sent off 5-2 when off the mark at the 19th attempt under Hollie Doyle here (1m6f) three weeks ago; 4lb higher but still high on the list.

runners.name: Chef De Troupe
runners.comment: Dual C&D winner who is likely to need this after 283 days off
runners.spotlight: Dual C&D winner who was running well over hurdles last summer but this veteran is likely to need the run after 283 days off.

quotes.race: bet365.com Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Chef De Troupe was entitled to win after his easy win at Southwell last week under a penalty. He was inclined to jump to his right again but actually seemed much better when able to take a lead. He is progressive - Sean Bowen, jockey.

runners.name: Scylla
runners.comment: 1-17 and needs a bit more if she is to double her tally; visor on
runners.spotlight: Twice in the frame on Tapeta since blinkers went on, but she is 1-17 and needs a bit more if she is to double her tally; first-time visor.

runners.name: Candy Warhol
runners.owner: Homecroft Wealth, Paul J Dixon & Partners
runners.comment: Made all here in two of his last three runs including over C&D last Saturday; big player
runners.spotlight: No win in first 24 starts but he's made all here in two of his last three runs, including over C&D last Saturday; up 6lb but that was a comfortable success on his first run at this trip and he remains well treated on best form; leading contender.

runners.name: Due Date
runners.owner: A Bangs & Miss J A Challen
runners.comment: Won a classified in January and close up back in handicaps in both runs since; in the mix
runners.spotlight: Five-time AW winner including two over C&D; last success was in a classified event at Chelmsford in January but he's finished close up back in handicaps in both runs since; usually races prominently and he should be in the mix again.

runners.name: Mehmo

prev_owners.owner: Winterbeck Stud, T Bownes & G Kelleway

runners.comment: All wins at 5f and he didn't pack a punch at Lingfield (6f) latest; others preferred
runners.spotlight: All six wins have been at 5f and latest was on turf 12 months ago; finished a creditable fourth over C&D on his penultimate start but he didn't pack a punch at Lingfield (6f, Polytrack) last time and others are preferred.

runners.name: Vitalline
runners.comment: On dangerous mark but has a tough draw and others look more likely
runners.spotlight: All four AW wins have come on Polytrack; returned from an absence with a respectable fourth over C&D in February but he failed to build on that here last month; on dangerous mark but has another tough draw and others look more likely.

runners.name: Supernova Steps
runners.comment: Respectable efforts in last five runs but she needs to find more in first-time blinkers
runners.spotlight: Successful in a 6f handicap at Southwell in November but that hasn't been a springboard to better things; respectable efforts after slow starts in her two runs (C&D/turf) this spring but she's now 1-11 and needs to find more in first-time blinkers.

runners.name: Bankrupt
runners.comment: Won at Lingfield in January but has taken backward steps here in two subsequent runs
runners.spotlight: Recorded his fifth AW win when making all at Lingfield (5f classified) in January but he's taken backward steps here (6f/5f) in two subsequent runs; bit to prove again and he could have competition for the lead; cheekpieces removed.

runners.name: Araifjan
runners.comment: Not easy to predict and his last win was in November 2023; others are more convincing
runners.spotlight: Seven-time winner but none since in November 2023; went close over C&D in September but he's been well held in three runs since; may have needed his recent reappearance but he's not easy to predict and others are more convincing; tongue-tie back on.

runners.name: Black Cab
runners.comment: Unexposed 4yo but was behind Candy Warhol here last week and has tough draw this time
runners.spotlight: Unexposed 4yo; made some late headway when fifth on handicap debut over C&D (40-1) last week but that was behind Candy Warhol and he has a tough draw in this rematch; could be one for another day.

runners.name: Rain Cap
runners.comment: Ended last year with a heavy defeat and his last win was in July 2023; opposable on return
runners.spotlight: Had some close calls last year but he ended 2024 with a heavy defeat at Newcastle (6f), when he bled from the nose and was reported to have had an irregular heartbeat; has something to prove after 193 days off and his last win was in July 2023.

runners.name: Savalas
runners.comment: Last win was off this mark over C&D; dangerous if he gets a good pace and some luck
runners.spotlight: Defied this mark over C&D in November and he was a creditable third in a classified event here last month; drawn out wide again but has possibilities if he gets a good pace to aim at and some luck.

quotes.race: totesport.com Tangerine Trees Conditions Stakes (Plus 10 Race)
quotes.quote: Savalas is just so tough and to win three in a row is some effort. I believe he is an out-and-out five furlong horse, so he will be staying at this trip. I'm not sure where we'll go next with him, we'll just take him home and have a think about it - Kevin Ryan, trainer.

runners.name: May Remain
runners.comment: Went close over C&D last month but wasn't in same form latest and losing run is up to 18
runners.spotlight: Went close in a classified over C&D last month but he wasn't in the same form here last time and that took his losing run to 18; risks attached.

quotes.race: Winter Series Awards At Dundalk Stadium Handicap
quotes.quote: May Remain is a horse that likes to get on with things. He just idled a small bit in front having been there so long, but he did it well - Gavin Ryan, rider

quotes.race: Matchbook Betting Exchange Novice Auction Stakes
quotes.quote: May Remain is a nice horse. Mr Cole said he would benefit from his previous runs. I thought he had him spot-on for today. The ground was a bit lively for him, but he did everything right. He's got plenty of speed and he doesn't need to step up in distance - Jamie Spencer, jockey.

runners.name: Snow Boots
runners.comment: Seven-race maiden who has not finished closer than 6l to a winner; makes no appeal
runners.spotlight: Seven-race maiden who has not finished closer than 6l to a winner including in three sprint handicaps this spring; makes no appeal.

runners.name: Tommytwohoots
runners.breeder: D & S L Tanker Transport Ltd

prev_owners.owner: D & S L Tanker Transport Limited

runners.comment: Dual C&D winner but he's been quiet in last two runs and needs to get back in the groove
runners.spotlight: Dual C&D winner who came well clear on turf (6f) in October; has had a few placed efforts at Newcastle since but he's been well held on Tapeta in last two runs and needs to get back in the groove.

4:10.race_name: bet365 Gold Cup Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)

runners.name: Grangeclare West
runners.comment: Second in the Irish Gold Cup and excellent third in the Grand National; up another 5lb
runners.spotlight: Second in the Irish Gold Cup at Leopardstown (3m, yielding) in February and an excellent third in the Grand National at Aintree (4m2f, good to soft) three weeks ago, rallying very gamely after a bad mistake at the final fence; going up another 5lb demands that he reaches even greater heights.

quotes.race: Randox Grand National Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: That was some spin. Grangeclare West jumped for fun and ran the race of his life. He did something a bit similar in the Gold Cup in Ireland, but repeated that here today with eleven stone eight on his back. Going out on the second circuit I knew he was going to run a big race. I gave him a breather and then he started winging fences down the back. I thought he was going to do the business but he just got into the bottom of the last and that cost him momentum - cost him second place - Brian Hayes, rider.

quotes.race: Neville Hotels Novice Chase (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: I didn't expect that - I was hoping Grangeclare West would run well but that was a top race. Paul was very worried about him pulling too hard and he had some job there. He'd want to be as fit as he is as he just pulled his arms out for the three miles. To do that in that ground and win like that going away, it was a huge performance. His jumping was excellent. He just came out of Paul's hands at the first fence and from then on he was just trying to settle him back. You can't keep jumping like that over three miles. He got him back jumping normally and then when he needed him over the last few fences, especially at the third-last, he was there. He's just a natural chaser. We were looking at it and asking ourselves is he a Brown Advisory horse? But we nominated Fact To File for that. The winner could go for the Brown Advisory and Fact To File might go to the Turners, but we'll see, it's a nice problem to have. We might come back here for the Dublin Racing Festival first - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Mongey Communications Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: Grangeclare West has always promised and I would say chasing might just help him to fulfil his promise now, hopefully we can get a good run with him now. The two fences in the straight being taken out was no help to him. I was using his jumping to fill him up, so if I was going to get beat it was the long run-in which was going to do it but his class got him through - Paul Townend, jockey.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: I have to say Grangeclare West impressed me, considering he was so keen early on and jumped a bit big during the race. Then he settled and Paul got him together and balanced. Once he got down to gallop he impressed me. The obvious race for him would be the Lawlors of Naas Novice Hurdle (January 8). He surprised me in the manner he did it there. As I said to the owner before racing, we could run well here and finish fourth or fifth. It looked a good race - Willie Mullins, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: We were kind of looking at the Grand National for him, but I spoke to the owners during the week and I said we're going to Cheltenham. Now the dust has settled I think we'll wait and see what weight he gets before deciding where to go next. 5-2-25

runners.name: Minella Cocooner
runners.comment: Won this last year off 4lb lower; big shout if his Aintree run has not taken it out of him
runners.spotlight: Delivered late to win this race on good ground last year by a neck, 26 days after his third in a heavy-ground Irish National; he shaped as if back to his best in the Grand National three weeks ago, travelling well to dispute the lead two out but ending up seventh as the 4m2f took its toll; this trip is presumably the ideal fit and, although 4lb higher than last year, a big run should be forthcoming if Aintree has not taken it out of him.

quotes.race: Jack Kiernans Celebrating 55 Years In Business Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: Minella Cocooner jumped spectacular there and seemed a lot more settled than he was in his hurdling days. Paul was delighted with him - Patrick Mullins, assistant trainer.

quotes.race: Albert Bartlett Novices' Hurdle (Grade 1) (Registered As The Spa Novices' Hurdle) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Minella Cocooner ran a cracker. He was a little bit keen early and was beaten by the better horse on the day. The ground is drying out a bit - Paul Townend, jockey.

quotes.race: Nathaniel Lacy & Partners Solicitors "50,000 Cheltenham Bonus For Stable Staff" Nov Hurdle (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: Minella Cocooner was very well ridden by Danny, he got some tremendous jumps from him and he got his breathers into him after his hurdles and paced it beautifully. I don't see any need to go up in trip - Willie Mullins, trainer

quotes.race: Mervyn Gray Construction Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Miella Cocooner had the benefit of his Cork run and he's maturing the whole time. He's a real galloper and we will see the best of him when he jumps a fence - Paul Townend, rider.

stable_tour.quote: He did us proud last spring, finishing third in the Irish Grand National and then winning the bet365 Gold Cup at Sandown on the final day. He ran in a red-hot John Durkan on Sunday, but there will be other days for him this season when the company is not as competitive as that. 25-11-24

He's done little wrong in his three hurdles runs, which included victory in the Grade 1 Nathaniel Lacy & Soilicitors Novice Hurdle at Leopardstown. Danny gave him a terrific ride and I was very pleased with his jumping. He has options in the Ballymore and Albert Bartlett and just looking at how he races it might be that the latter would be tough for him. We will make up our minds nearer the time but looking at his style of running and racing then the Ballymore might the one for him. 09-03-22

runners.name: Threeunderthrufive
runners.comment: This race last year was not one of his good efforts; neither was Grand National latest
runners.spotlight: Fourth in the 2023 Scottish National (4m, good); commendable efforts most starts since, for instance beaten a nose by Victtorino at Ascot (3m, good; 1lb higher today) in February, but this race last year was not one of them and neither was the Grand National three weeks ago.

quotes.race: Injured Jockeys Fund Ambassadors Programme Swinley Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Threeunderthrufive is not going to go to Cheltenham in three weeks and Max is quite keen on him running in the National. I've always had a reservation about his jumping but today it was as good as I've ever seen. He lost his way a bit last year and it never happened. I've tinkered with his wind a bit in the summer and he's ran three solid races this year and just got better and better - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

quotes.race: Wigley Group Hampton Novices' Chase (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Threeunderthrufive will have entries for the RSA and National Hunt Chase but I'd think we'll go for the former as he's not short of speed and his times compare favourably. He's jumped around Cheltenham and Adrian can ride him in that race - his record on him is phenomenal - Iain Turner, owners' racing manager.

quotes.race: bet365 December Novices' Chase (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Threeunderthrufive is never going to be too flashy, but he gets the job done. He's got the experience and he'll have a break now and I'd say his next target might be the Reynoldstown or possibly the Lingfield race at the end of January in the million series - Ian Turner, owner's racing manager.

quotes.race: mallardjewellers.com Novices' Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: That was a nice jumping and staying performance. Threeunderthrufive improved enormously for his first run at Chepstow, I thought we'd beat Kim's horse (Does He Know) just on the fact we needed it first time and we'd improved since Exeter. I was slightly nervous 12 days since Exeter was soon enough, but we wanted to try and support it. I just said to Max he'd be superb for it (National Hunt Chase) and something like Reynoldstown in the spring would suit and that could be the route back. I wouldn't be thinking the Brown Advisory as they'd go too quick for him. He's a real strong stayer, he jumps and gallops away and you can ride him handy. My head lad (Clifford Baker) said that horse would run well in a National one day, I hope he's right. He's a lovely staying horse - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

quotes.race: bet365 Scottish Stayers Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Threeunderthrufive is a really progressive horse, who jumped nicely. The only question mark was the distance, but Adrian said he stayed really nicely. He would have preferred to get a lead a bit longer because when he gets to the front, he sometimes doesn't always do as much as he might. He probably won with a little bit in hand. There's a chance we could go to Aintree for the Grade 1 novice hurdle over three miles. Paul would like to go to Aintree with him, but we'll have to speak to Max. Paul thinks he's going to be a really smart chaser next season - Harry Derham, assistant trainer.

quotes.race: Shukers Introductory Hurdle
quotes.quote: That was really good. It wasn't ideal because Threeunderthrufive's still a bit green after only one start over hurdles. But he's a thorough stayer and he's done it the hard way. Paul had the Winter Novices' Hurdle at Sandown pencilled in but it will all depend on how he comes out of this race. He's a real, good tough horse. Essentially he'll be a really smart chaser for the future - he's a lovely horse and one to really look forward to - Harry Derham, assistant trainer.

quotes.race: Siobhan Winterbottom Supports Children With Cancer UK Standard Open National Hunt Flat Race
quotes.quote: Threeunderfive is a nice young horse for the future and we thought he'd improve for his run at Fontwell. It's attritional out there, but he's stuck to it well. There are no fancy plans but he'll have another run before we put him away. He doesn't really like that ground, but he's tough and improving and will make a nice novice hurdler over two and a half next season - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: We've entered him in the Grand National, which is his main aim, and he's going to Ascot this month for the race he won last year, but I've put him in this as an option. He's run only once this season, finishing third at Ascot. 9-2-25

runners.name: Dancing City
runners.breeder: J Moutel, L Moutel & V Moutel
runners.comment: Three-time Grade 1 winner as a novice hurdler; reverses in Cheltenham and Aintree Grade 1s
runners.spotlight: Three-time Grade 1 winner as a novice hurdler, including twice last spring, and he began his chasing career in promising style with two wins this winter; there have since been significant reverses when well beaten at Cheltenham and falling at Aintree, both in Grade 1s over about 3m, but he'd previously suggested a strength in stamina which gives this test some appeal.

quotes.race: Brown Advisory Novices' Chase (Grade 1) (Registered As The Broadway Novices' Chase) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Dancing City was travelling well until he made a mistake at the third-last - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Finlay Ford At Naas Novice Chase (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: Dancing City gallops and jumps, he is lazy as sin, but that's what you want from these staying chasers, horses that do exactly what you want them to do. He probably got beaten once or twice early on in his career because of that. That was a very good performance on very tasting ground. He will go straight to the Brown Advisory now - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: All in all a great start, Dancing City was clever when he had to be. I had to give him a reminder before the last but just to make him concentrate - Paul Townend, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

quotes.race: Channor Real Estate Group Novice Hurdle (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: It just shows how tough Dancing City is that he's been to every racing festival, it takes a lot of doing. It all bodes well for the future going over fences. He did quite well coming back from Aintree. We haven't done that before - Cheltenham, Aintree and Punchestown. It looks achievable so we might do more of it in the future. He didn't show how good he was until we went out in trip - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Cavani Sartorial Menswear Sefton Novices' Hurdle (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Crossing the bottom, Dancing City went off the bridle for a few strides and Paul even thought the game was up and then he seemed to get his second wind. Paul just nursed him and got him over the last as they were out on their feet on the testing ground. It was a good performance. It took him a long time to show me he was the horse that we thought we'd bought, and there were a few times when we thought about shipping him on. He's come right and is going to be an exciting novice chaser - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Nathaniel Lacy & Partners Solicitors Novice Hurdle (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: It was a small field but you could make a very strong case for everything in it. Dancing City was probably disappointing the first day Paul rode him in Navan. I got to win a maiden on him the next day and found a lot of improvement and he's found it again today. Turning in here I didn't want to be setting sail too early but once I committed him he didn't stop the whole way to the line and it was a proper Grade 1 performance - Danny Mullins, jockey.

quotes.race: BetVictor Proud To Support Irish Racing Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Dancing City missed the last and still ran out a good winner, I would say that was a good performance. We were hoping he would improve and it was nice to see him go and do it - Danny Mullins, rider

stable_tour.quote: The Brown Advisory is the plan. He's a four-wheel-drive horse and I hope the ground is soft for him at Cheltenham. He just gallops and jumps and is a nice type for the race. 5-2-25

runners.name: High Class Hero
runners.breeder: Mr & Mrs D Futter & Peel Bloodstock

prev_owners.owner: Sullivan Bloodstock Limited & Neill Hughes & P Crowley

runners.comment: Novice but he's been favourite for this handicap debut and Townend takes the ride
runners.spotlight: Close second to Dancing City in Grade 1 Punchestown novice hurdle (3m, good to yielding) last May; while his form as a novice chaser has not matched that, defeat at 2-13 last time was over an inadequate 2m5f and he's basically made a satisfactory transition; work to do but, faced with this new, serious stamina test, this lightly raced 8yo has been favourite this week for today's handicap debut and the stable's top jockey Paul Townend takes the ride.

quotes.race: QuinnBet Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: High Class Hero did it nicely. The ground was quite testing as they had a lot of rain before racing. He's in the Brown Advisory and he would look like that type of an animal. We'll probably head that direction. Loughglynn will probably stay at home and we'll find something for him. Overall, I'm very happy with them - Willie Mullins, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He just kept on winning last season and appreciates nicer ground. He's going chasing and he's going to be a force to be reckoned with in all those top staying novice chases. He stays, jumps and gallops, so he's got a lot going for him. 25-11-24

runners.name: Victtorino
runners.comment: 4-5 over 3m at right-handed Ascot and finished strongly over 3m2f at Newbury in November
runners.spotlight: Poor Cheltenham record was extended at the Festival last time; 3m at right-handed Ascot, on the other hand, produced four wins (two on good ground) from five attempts and his strong finish in Newbury's big 3m2f handicap in November catches the eye with regard to today's new trip; his stable has had a long dry spell recently (it ended on Thursday) but he's a strong candidate otherwise.

quotes.race: Betfair Swinley Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I thought Victtorino was beaten but that was great. The ground is loose but I don't think it's testing and there were still lots of horses there with three to jump. I thought we were going to get outsprinted but it was nice to see the first and second were up there the whole way around - Venetia Williams, trainer.

quotes.race: Howden Silver Cup Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Charlie (Deutsch), quite deservedly, gets plaudits for that lovely ride as it wasn't easy, but Victtorino's jumping was a huge turnaround and key for winning and finishing third. Ascot helps a bit as the last mile is all uphill and if horses are getting away from you then you have a chance of getting back at them. Venetia Williams - trainer.

quotes.race: Coral Gold Cup Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Victtorino flew home, but I felt we were outpaced all the way. He only got into gear turning in really and he then made up a lot of ground, but it was probably too late. I was always squeezing him and trying to get him jumping, but we lost a bit of ground. We missed the last, which didn't help, but it was a brilliant effort. He's still only six and it's more experience for him, so it's a good start to the season for him - Charlie Deutsch, jockey.

quotes.race: Howden Silver Cup Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It looked like it wasn't going to go our way today. There was a strong pace and he wanted to go on the outside but Blackjack Magic was holding that position on the front and he couldn't get past and into the position he wanted. At Swinley Bottom onwards it was pedal to the metal and Victtorino met a few of the fences on a really awkward stride, which made things difficult for him, but he dealt with it and went on to win. He's remarkably grown up for a five-year-old. He's really, really exciting - Venetia Williams, trainer.

quotes.race: Sodexo Live! Gold Cup Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: That was a joy to ride. I don't know if Victtorino was getting lonely at the last but that's the only one he didn't jump, but I picked him up from the back of it and he was quickly back up to his running speed. He was a lovely ride and there are lots of races for him - Charlie Deutsch, rider.

stable_tour.quote: He won two £100,000 handicap chases at Ascot last season and we'll probably start back there in the Sodexo Gold Cup. He needs the full three miles and it didn't suit dropping him back in trip at Cheltenham in January. We could possibly consider the Coral Gold Cup and I think he'll stay beyond three miles down the line. He's looking well. 23-10-24

runners.name: Monbeg Genius
runners.comment: Did not spark in the Grand National and good ground would give him more to prove
runners.spotlight: Dictated the pace for a Uttoxeter win (3m, soft; 3lb higher today) in February with second-time cheekpieces (kept since) in a less demanding race than he's often appeared in; 13l fourth in the Welsh National (near 3m7f, soft) was respectable but he did not spark in the big one at Aintree three weeks ago and good ground would give him more to prove.

quotes.race: Lisa Mitten Turns 60 Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Nick Scholfield gave Monbeg Genius a lovely ride and it's great to see him get the job done. The National weights are out Tuesday, so we'll see what happens there, but hopefully he'll get a run. He's good with cut in the ground but ran a nice race at Newbury last season. We've been waiting for this day with him as the form at Cheltenham worked out well. It's great to see him get his head in front - AJ O'Neill, joint-trainer.

quotes.race: Coral Gold Cup Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: They were going so fast over the first couple Monbeg Genius didn't get into a rhythm until halfway down the back. He'll be better with a bit slower ground but he ran a blinder. He's in the Welsh National and will hopefully be in the Grand National too. He'll have a go at all of those and let's hope we have a bit of luck in one of them - Jonjo O'Neill, trainer.

quotes.race: Ultima Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Monbeg Genius ran a cracker and I could not be more pleased with him, except of course, if he had won. He could now go for the Scottish National next month at Ayr but that will be ground dependent as he has to have soft ground. If it was on the quick side at Ayr he would not run and we would put him away for this season with a tilt at the Aintree Grand National next spring at the forefront of our minds - Jonjo O'Neill, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He ran very well to be third on ground that was a little bit too quick for him in the Coral Gold Cup. He then got a foot abscess and wasn't able to make the Welsh National or the Classic Chase, which would have been his proper target. The track was a bit sharp at Kelso and then he struck into himself in the Ultima at Cheltenham. He's in good form again now and has been schooling really well. He'll start either at Bangor next Wednesday over three miles or at Cheltenham on Sunday week over three miles three. The Welsh National and Classic Chase will be his targets again and hopefully we can get him up a bit in the weights to have a crack at the Grand National. I don't think he's lost any of his ability; things just haven't gone for him. 06-11-24

quotes.race: Ballymacarbry Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: Lombron made me work for that. He made that mistake at the first fence down the back but there were some fence attendants on the track when we came round the bend and I'd say he had one eye on those orange jackets. He impressed me when he won first time over hurdles but he regressed after that. I hope he'll be a better chaser - Paul Townend, jockey, talking to Racing TV.

quotes.race: Sign Up To GavinLynchRacing.com Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Lombron was very straightforward and settled well, His jumping put him back into the race throughout. He lengthened nicely and picked up again from the last. He will come on for that and has a lot of natural ability - Paul Townend, rider

runners.name: Olympic Man
runners.comment: Favourite for Scottish National but didn't settle in front and subsided into 7th; hood now
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced 8yo; jumping was a major issue on his first two starts over fences but some improvement when he won a 2m4f beginners chase at Naas seven weeks ago, rallying extremely well; favourite for the Scottish National (4m) a fortnight ago but he didn't settle in front and subsided into seventh; today's hood could help with that and he may still bring potential.

runners.name: Resplendent Grey
runners.comment: Laboured badly out the back on his way to 4th in the 3m6f NH Chase; cheekpieces go on
runners.spotlight: 1lb out of the handicap; chasing last five starts, winning first attempt and creditable results in the others; performed wonders to finish fourth in the 3m6f NH Chase at Cheltenham last time, given he'd been labouring badly out the back three out, but a much more zestful, fluent display would clearly be preferable and connections therefore reach for cheekpieces.

stable_tour.quote: He probably hasn't had the rub of the green in his last two runs, but his form from Sandown when beaten only a few lengths by Handstands reads well. He could have a decent chance in the Kim Muir or National Hunt Chase. 18-2-25

He ran a cracker to finish second in the Persian War but he had a hard race. He's getting 7lb off the handicapper, so we'll have a look at a handicap or a novice hurdle at Cheltenham this month before potentially jumping a fence with him, as he loses his novice status at the end of the month. He has grown up an awful lot and went through his race at Chepstow better than ever, so there's lots to look forward to. 01-11-23

runners.name: Omoore Park
runners.comment: Rather a free-going sort but he's been staying on admirably at the finish of late at 2m4f
runners.spotlight: 2lb out of the handicap; fell in his first two chases but has got his act together since and placed over the extended 2m4f when racing prominently at Cheltenham on last two outings; ridden by Sean O'Keeffe throughout chase career; stamina is a big question, particularly after he attempted 2m7f twice as a hurdler, and he's rather a free-going sort, but a hood (tried once) returns and he's been staying on admirably at the finish of late.

quotes.race: Jack Richards Novices' Limited Handicap Chase (Grade 2) (Registered As The Golden Miller) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: O'Moore Park has run a blinder. He jumped well and stuck at it really well. I would say going up in trip will suit him. I had a nice position everywhere. I was following the winner and he was just very good on the day - Sean O'Keeffe, rider.

quotes.race: Fairyhouse Supporting Treo Eile Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: O'Moore Park benefitted from the run the last day which knocked the freshness out of him and brought him on. He's progressing away and is going to be a chaser - Paul Townend, rider.

stable_tour.quote: He'll go novice hurdling, though I imagine he'll be more of a chaser down the road. He's been placed in a few bumpers and is probably a shade unlucky not to have won one. 07-11-22

runners.name: Goshen
runners.comment: 5lb out of handicap; stuck on over 3m lately as if next reinvention could be as a stayer
runners.spotlight: 5lb out of the handicap; 9yo whose career has contained plenty of surprises and performing so manfully in 3m handicap chases on good ground at Ascot and this track on his last two starts is arguably one of them; that's nowhere near his old hurdles form but he's been sticking on as if his next reinvention could be as a stayer.

quotes.race: Betgoodwin National Spirit Hurdle (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Goshen's always hung but there are just so limited opportunities for him. We know we have to go right-handed on soft ground but there are literally no races for him. We took a punt and it didn't work out again. I'd say that's the last time [going left-handed] - Jamie Moore, rider.

quotes.race: Ladbrokes Long Walk Hurdle (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Goshen ran well, he stayed well and he wasn't good enough - it's as simple as that - Jamie Moore, rider.

quotes.race: Coral Hurdle (Registered As The Ascot Hurdle) (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I ran three horses here yesterday who had had leg trouble but they were all fine this morning, so I wasn't worried about running and that ground is different from July/August ground - this is winter good ground. I'd love to run Goshen once more in a two-mile chase on heavy ground around a Kempton or even here. Lingfield would be ideal if it was right-handed - Gary Moore, trainer.

quotes.race: Wincanton Matchbook Betting Exchange Kingwell Hurdle (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Goshen showed so much guts, he'd ran at Lingfield then Sandown and he had hard races both times and I said to Scu [Tom Scudamore] two out 'you've got me here' but fair play to the horse, he knuckled down and battled as hard as he could - Jamie Moore, jockey.  I knew when the other horse came upsides that he wasn't going to give in, he's a bull of a horse and he just wants to go. From here we'll step up in trip again to go over fences next season and fingers crossed. We've had an amazing ride with him so far and he's only six so who knows - Steve Packham, owner.

quotes.race: Virgin Bet Contenders Hurdle (Listed Race) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Hopefully we can now get some rain at Wincanton and then that's where Goshen will go next. This race was his aim because it's a stiff two miles, whereas Wincanton is a fast track. The only other place I might run him next is Fontwell because the National Spirit is a valuable race. It's left-handed but he has won around there and it wouldn't worry me. Cheltenham will be the owner's decision not mine but if it's up to me he won't go there - Gary Moore, trainer.

quotes.race: Betway Kingwell Hurdle (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: You can't believe how pleased I am with Goshen. They probably went fast enough but Jamie had the sense to sit him. It's a sharp two round there and he probably wants a stiff two but I'm over the moon he looks like he's back.    On Champion Hurdle bid - I certainly hope so, we'll see how he gets back in the morning. I'll have to chat with Jamie and Steve - who has been absolutely fantastic since Cheltenham - and if he comes out of it well and as long as he's good in the run-up to Cheltenham then he'll go. It's not going to be so easy but now he doesn't have to make the running so if something else wants to lead him they can lead him - Gary Moore, trainer.

quotes.race: Close Brothers Premium Finance Handicap
quotes.quote: It was very disappointing. Goshen was a bit keen and lit up early and hopefully something will come out in the wash. We've only managed to gallop him once on grass and it probably wasn't enough. Plans have been scrapped at the minute and he won't go to Ascot [Long Distance Cup] on the back of that - Gary Moore, trainer.

quotes.race: Pinsent Masons Introductory Juvenile Hurdle
