quotes.quote: Goshen was never going to be a two-year-old on the Flat but schooled well and I was worried the ground was not soft enough for him at Brighton first time this year. All he has done is amaze and impress me. He will have a break now and won't run until the Cheltenham trial in January and if that works out well he will continue otherwise he could go back on the Flat - Gary Moore, trainer.

quotes.race: Carpetright Supports The BHF Handicap (Jockey Club Grassroots Flat Stayers Series Qualifier)
quotes.quote: Goshin is a horse I like and was bought to go jumping but I think there's a very nice Flat race in him as well. He'll have a break - Gary Moore, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He picked up an injury when winning over fences at Exeter in March. He's fine but is a little bit behind the rest and you won't see him before Christmas. Despite his history - which reads worse than it is - he jumps well and will probably mix between hurdles and fences when he returns. 29-10-24

It was encouraging to see him running an okay race again last time at the big Lingfield meeting but if I am totally honest I was bitterly disappointed and he will not be going left-handed again - he never really helped Jamie going around. Cheltenham is out of the question for him so we are looking at this weekend's Contenders day card at Sandown. Clearly, he still has the class we all know him for and hopefully going right-handed will allow him to show himself in his true light again. 02-02-22

runners.name: Spanish Harlem
runners.breeder: E A R L Elevage Des Loges
runners.comment: 9-1 when carried out in the recent Scottish National but 6lb out of the handicap this time
runners.spotlight: Sole win was in France on debut, so he's now 0-13 for Willie Mullins and 0-9 over fences; clearly best effort came in the Scottish National on soft ground last year when about 8l sixth, coming from well off the pace (2lb higher today); penultimate outing gave some renewed hope, before he was unluckily carried out in the latest Scottish National when cheekpieces were added; just 9-1 that day but he's 6lb out of the handicap this time.

stable_tour.quote: He was sixth in the Scottish National, but he's still a novice over fences as he drew a blank last season. I'm hoping he can put his chasing experience to good use and make it pay this season in novice company. 25-11-24

runners.name: Collectors Item
runners.comment: C&D second before his Wincanton 3m3f win; Eider flop and he's now 7lb out of the handicap
runners.spotlight: Emerged in second for London National over C&D (soft) in December and won from the front in the Somerset National at Wincanton (3m3f, good to soft) in January; flop in the Eider at Newcastle in February, while good ground may be a problem today; position 7lb out of the handicap certainly is.

quotes.race: Hinton Workspace Somerset National Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: We're delighted with Collectors Item. Maybe something like the Eider could suit him, but there are plenty of options. Kev gave him a lovely ride with plenty of positivity, which he responds quite well to. His jumping was better towards the end and he didn't put in any short ones - AJ O'Neill, joint-trainer.

quotes.race: Coral Get Closer To The Action Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Collectors Item is not the biggest but he looks like an athlete and he will gallop all day long for you. The ground has been too dry for him and Jonjo said how he won over two miles he will never know as this is his trip. The ground was too quick for him at Cheltenham last time but he stayed on all the way up the hill. He really pinged the last and he's run right to the line. We will look at the EBF Final at Sandown with him now but he needs to qualify for that so we will look at a little qualifier in February - John Goodman, spokesman for the winning owners.

quotes.race: Chepstow Plant International Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Collectors Item did it nicely, he jumped and travelled well. I'd say he's a nice horse to look forward to. He ran well in a nice bumper at Newbury and it's worked out quite well so you never know. He took to it well and he'll be a nice chaser - Jonjo O'Neill, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He showed good form over hurdles, but it took a while for him to get the hang of things over fences. First-time blinkers definitely sharpened him up when winning well at Uttoxeter in May and we were encouraged by that. He handles soft ground and the main aim is the London National at Sandown in December. He'll need a run before that, but he looks like stepping beyond three miles will be no problem. 06-11-24

runners.name: Chosen Witness
runners.comment: Pulled up when 12-1 for the Scottish National on latest outing; 7lb out of the handicap
runners.spotlight: Won novice handicap hurdle at Ayr (3m, soft) last April in a first-time hood (tried twice since); only one echo of that form in his five races since, when third in a beginners chase; seemed to be running well when unseating four out in a Grade 2 on penultimate start but pulled up when 12-1 for the Scottish National on latest; 7lb out of the handicap.

quotes.race: ThurlesRaces.ie Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Chosen Witness is a fine big horse. He can be a bit ignorant at one or two hurdles but he has loads of scope and should jump a fence - Sean O'Keeffe, rider.

stable_tour.quote: Won a competitive race at the Scottish Grand National meeting at Ayr and I'd say we'll go novice chasing with him. He looks a stayer. 25-11-24

runners.name: Kings Threshold
runners.comment: Won his last three, smoothly on last two; 8lb out of handicap, on top of latest 7lb rise
runners.spotlight: Ran poorly in December on sole visit here; tongue-tie went on when he won all three starts since (Huntingdon, Warwick and Newbury) and, following wind surgery, he's done it pretty smoothly on last two occasions; however, he's not proven beyond an extended 2m7f (this is his first run much beyond 3m) and is now 8lb out of the handicap, on top of latest 7lb rise.

quotes.race: BetVictor A Run For Your Money Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: King's Threshold had the tongue-tie on for the first time at Huntingdon and it made a big difference, so it's stayed on and helps him. The other thing is he is growing up. He's massive and it's taken him a long time to reach maturity. He's definitely going the right way and he stayed that trip well today. I wouldn't be looking to go further yet and he likes goodish, but not quick, ground - Emma Lavelle, trainer.

quotes.race: Join The 20 Club At Huntingdon Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: I thought King's Threshold would keep the race. The bump happened just after the last and he's won by over a length but he hasn't helped himself, he just drifted to the right and made it harder work than he needed to. Trip has always been a question mark but I do think there's an element that he just thinks about it as well. It wouldn't surprise me if we ended up in headgear and 2m6f is probably his ideal trip - Emma Lavelle, trainer, talking to Racing TV.

stable_tour.quote: A big, backwards horse who Barry [Fenton, husband and assistant] has always loved. Little by little we're getting there and I was really pleased with the way he jumped at Kempton on his chase debut. The tight track probably didn't suit but he travelled well. On slower ground and a more galloping track I think he'll win his races. 22-11-23

He has plenty of ability but he's a fine-margin horse - he wants everything right for him. I've just fired his palate because he can make a bit of noise and I think there are plenty more races in him. He's got himself well handicapped this season. 29-01-25

runners.name: Transmission
runners.comment: Worth this second crack at a marathon trip but he's 10lb out of the handicap
runners.spotlight: Took well to chasing on good/good to soft at Cheltenham initially this term, arriving late on the scene; he'd finished strongly over an extended 3m1f but did not get anywhere near to a challenging position when below-form fifth in the 3m6f NH Chase there on latest outing; worth another crack at a marathon trip but he's 10lb out of the handicap.

quotes.race: Steel Plate & Sections Ltd Amateur Jockeys' Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: We could maybe look at the National Hunt Chase now long-term. Today was the plan as we wanted to give Transmission a couple of runs around Cheltenham. His last run was good, he had a run under his belt and has course and distance form, so we tried to tick as many boxes as possible, and the ride was second to none - Neil Mulholland, trainer.

quotes.race: Extech Racing To The Cloud! Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: I'm not too sure this was an easier ride for Joe than in January - he was flat out from the word go and had to push him for a long way today. Transmission loves Plumpton and was very gutsy. They went fast enough for him today and fingers crossed he'll be an exciting staying chaser for the future. We'll see how he comes out of the race and we'll speak to his owner Paul McKeon about if we want to run him again this season - Neil Mulholland, trainer.

quotes.race: BetGoodwin Sussex Stayers Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Thank god that's over and done with. I lost my irons and I thought Transmission was going down, so he did well to stand up. I kept going for one of my irons but it went over the other side of my saddle as I was trying to get it back. Every time I moved he started lighting up, but when I jumped the last with a circuit to go he settled away and was able to get it then. It's a good job that he's very good at jumping. He took a massive step forward the last day, he did again today and is going the right way. He has a lot of ability and we've put it together for a good pot - Joe Anderson, jockey, speaking on Sky Sports Racing.

stable_tour.quote: He goes to Uttoxeter on Midlands Grand National day for the £100,000 2m7½f handicap hurdle. It's a good pot and it needed to be looked at as the prize-money is the same for the Pertemps. We wouldn't be looking at the Albert Bartlett. He missed the second-last hurdle at Sandown when he was just starting to get into it. He ran on well but it didn't go 100 per cent according to plan. We won the £75,000 race at Plumpton and fingers crossed he can still be competitive and make his presence felt. You'd think he'd make a nice chaser - perhaps he could be a Welsh National horse given he likes soft ground. 06-03-24

runners.name: Klarc Kent
runners.comment: Fourth and second in the last two Scottish Nationals; 12lb out of the handicap today
runners.spotlight: 0-14 since bumper win in 2022; fourth and second in the last two Scottish Nationals, latterly off a reduced mark when wearing second-time cheekpieces two weeks ago; while that was a welcome return to form, position 12lb out of the handicap today demands so much more; 5lb claimer is called up.

quotes.race: Coral Scottish Grand National Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Klarc Kent ran a great race. He'd been out of form all season, but that means nothing with Willie [Mullins, trainer]. I thought he'd win at the last and he actually quickened and I thought 'we're away', but in the last half-furlong I could see the orange colours coming. But I was relieved it was one of Willie's - Jonathan Burke, jockey.

quotes.race: Russellstown INH Flat Race
quotes.quote: Klarc Kent will probably get a spin in a winner's bumper somewhere but he's a real jumps horse and a real winter horse. I didn't think this track would suit him and the only reason we came here is because there weren't any opportunities coming up for a while - Willie Mullins, trainer.

runners.name: Hoe Joly Smoke
runners.comment: Two 3m chase wins here; could have plenty more to give but he's 12lb out of the handicap
runners.spotlight: Bled from the nose on penultimate start but has otherwise done well switched to chasing this term, notably for two 3m wins at this track (Goshen a close third last time); just a 7yo and a lightly raced one at that, whose style of victory last time (he travelled much the best) suggested he could have plenty more to give, but he's 15lb higher today, thanks largely to his position 12lb out of the handicap.

quotes.race: Best Odds On The Betfair Exchange Handicap Chase (Challenger Staying Chase Series Qual') (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Harry [Skelton] got off Hoe Joly Smoke immediately and said the Scottish National, but I just wouldn't want to go to Ayr and not run well, whereas we've got two weeks and we can come here to a track we know suits him. He's improving and everything about the bet365 will suit him. I like coming back to the scene of victories and obviously he likes this track. He's still a novice over hurdles, so next year we might have one run over hurdles, then find the nicest chase we can - Dan Skelton, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He ran well first time over fences at Uttoxeter but got in under the last and took a good blow afterwards. He'll definitely improve for that. He should go close next time and can be progressive. 12-11-24

runners.name: Knockanore
runners.comment: Runaway winner of the Eider but well beaten in Midlands National; 15lb out of the handicap
runners.spotlight: First foray beyond 3m saw him win the Eider at Newcastle (4m1f, good to soft) in February eased down by 16l; raised 10lb when nowhere near repeating the dose as favourite for the Midlands National (4m2f, good to soft) six weeks ago and he's now an additional 15lb out of the handicap.

quotes.race: Virgin Bet Eider Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Everyone who's ridden Knockanore says he wants further. He's a bit of a rogue, he's won very easily today and he's our best work horse by a country mile but he doesn't quite show it on the track all the time. He's shown it today - Ryan Potter, trainer.

quotes.race: Willis Cooper Chartered Accountants Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: It was pleasing because Knockanore is a tricky customer. The ground was right, the track was right and he got into a nice rhythm. He was always going to do it at some point, but when was anyone's guess - Daryl Jacob, jockey.

runners.name: Edwardstone
runners.comment: Jonbon has his number and he disappointed last time in the Game Spirit at Newbury
runners.spotlight: Grand servent to his connections but an 11yo now and was no match for Jonbon in this 12 months ago, which isn't the only time the Henderson horse has had his number; disappointed last time in the Game Spirit won by Master Chewy.

quotes.race: Shloer Chase (Registered As The Cheltenham Chase) (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Edwardstone ran very well. As he's getting older it's a little harder getting the weight off of him but I think he's run a grand race. We left a bit of work on, no doubt Nicky [Henderson] is the same [with Jonbon] but we'll take him on again in the Tingle Creek. It's probably pointless as it's 4-0 to Jonbon but there's a lot of money at stake. I think we'll stick at two miles. I'm very satisfied - Alan King, trainer.

quotes.race: Betfair Exchange Game Spirit Chase (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Edwardstone enjoyed it. We've come back in trip with him and it's worked out. He felt like a proper machine. He won the race in the first mile and had plenty under the bonnet. On his day he's as quick as I've ridden. I've always been his biggest supporter and on his day he can do things like this - Tom Cannon, rider, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

quotes.race: Betfair Tingle Creek Chase (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Tom [Cannon, jockey] thinks Edwardstone is still as good as ever, we've just got a superstar in front of us. I couldn't be happier with him. This really wouldn't be his ground but he's run a hell of a race and we're very proud of him. We'll have a chat with the owners and we might try one run at the start of next year over two and a half miles and decide whether he goes Ryanair or Champion Chase. The Ascot Chase is probably in my mind but we'll see, I would like to avoid today's winner if I can - Alan King, trainer.

quotes.race: Betway Queen Mother Champion Chase (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I have never been happier with Edwardstone and he has never missed a day at home, but he was beaten after two fences and just never going at any stage of the race. I cannot blame the ground as he has won on it before - I  just don't know what it is, I am at a total loss. But something must be amiss and hopefully something will come to light - Alan King, trainer.

quotes.race: Albert Bartlett Clarence House Chase (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I'm not happy to have got beat but I'm very happy with the run. Edwardstone was just a bit fresh and started to tank down the hill. Tom (Cannon) said he had to bring him back just a wee bit. He's probably used a bit of energy up getting there and probably at the last I thought we'd go away and win, but full marks to the winner. I'm happy, I needed to get this into him to try and get him right for the March meeting. He's perfectly fit but he needed this just to get the edge off of him. In the Kempton race he only got to the fifth, so that did nothing. He was just a bit gassy. I did stress to Tom beforehand that this wasn't the be all and end all so I'm perfectly happy - Alan King, trainer.

quotes.race: Ladbrokes Desert Orchid Chase (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: They're both fine and there will be another day. Normally Edwardstone is very good but Tom said they just weren't meeting it right. He's got to have his flu jab next week and I'd imagine we'll stick with the game plan and go to Newbury for the Game Spirit next - Alan King, trainer.

quotes.race: Betfair Tingle Creek Chase (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I owe Nicky a huge thank you for letting me take Edwardstone to Seven Barrows last week as we got a proper bit of work into him over a mile one. It was just to get him away and get a proper blow into him. Whatever he did today he was going to come on for it. He is a big heavy horse and that is why we couldn't risk him earlier in the season. I know there has been a lot said about it but we do know what we are doing with these horses. I had in the back of my mind that we would go to Kempton Park for the Desert Orchid but I will see. We are working back from the Queen Mother now. Whether we go one or two runs I don't know. The Game Spirit will come into it but it is a nice problem to have. I really wanted to get today out of the way. He has exceeded my expectations. The Tingle Creek is one of my favourite races - Alan King, trainer.

quotes.race: Poundland Maghull Novices' Chase (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I think Edwardstone has run his race, I just think the winner is a very good horse and perhaps a fresher horse as well. The best horse on the day has won but I'm thrilled with our horse - Alan King, trainer.

quotes.race: Sporting Life Arkle Challenge Trophy Novices' Chase (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Edwardstone had a break after Kempton, and Warwick is what we wanted. He was running very well in those big handicaps last year but we used to have to put him out the back but he was still finishing fourth or fifth making up 20 lengths. Now over a fence we can ride him just off the pace and that is lot easier. People have doubted his jumping but I've not had to many worries about it - Alan King, trainer.

quotes.race: Virgin Bet Kingmaker Novices' Chase (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: That was lovely, they went a good gallop and Edwardstone jumped superbly so we were thrilled with him. He looked foot perfect so I'm delighted and relieved to come through it. It's a long time between Kempton and Cheltenham so it was important to get a run into him. It was a proper test and he came through it well, so we'll enjoy today and worry about Cheltenham when it comes - Alan King, trainer.  Edwardstone was very good today and loved that ground, it was as quick as he's been on for a while. His jumping was electric and he saw it out nicely. He's always had an engine and everything he's done in his career has built up to this season. He's the best horse I've sat on - he's a horse of a lifetime and they don't come around very often - Tom Cannon, jockey.

quotes.race: Close Brothers Henry VIII Novices' Chase (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Edwardstone has got a great cruising speed. I'm thrilled with him. We couldn't win a bumper but he met some superstars along the way. He was progressive over hurdles and we tried him over fences last year. He unseated at Doncaster and it was too late to keep going but his form back over hurdles last season was as good as ever. He was always hopefully going to make a chaser. We got a nice confidence-booster into him last time. I didn't really want to come here. If I could have found a two-miler with a penalty I probably would have gone somewhere else but they weren't around. He's bred for a trip but doesn't need any further yet. He's had three fairly quick runs so it's a nice problem to have now. I hope and think he's an Arkle horse so we'll work backwards from there. The Kingmaker would be the ideal one but he'll probably want a race in between - Alan King, trainer.

quotes.race: Highflyer Bloodstock Novices' Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: His jumping was super and we were delighted with him. We're relieved and we can look ahead now, though I have no plans for Edwardstone yet. I just wanted to get today out of the way. It's only 12 days since his last run so we'll go home and have a think - Alan King, trainer.

quotes.race: Sky Bet Supreme Trial Rossington Main Novices' Hurdle (Grade 2)
quotes.quote: I thought Edwardstone had done enough, he's still a good horse. I maybe should have waited a fraction longer but I didn't think I was going as well as Gavin Sheehan. I thought he was the horse to beat and then he stopped down to the last - Tom Cannon, jockey.

quotes.race: Play Casino At Virgin Bet Novices' Hurdle (Novices' Championship Hurdle Series Qualifier)
quotes.quote: Edwardstone did a lot wrong today and he still won. I could have done with them going a bit quicker but he has plenty of gears and he stayed well. A better race, when they go quicker, would suit him well. Two miles is his trip for the time being - Tom Cannon, jockey.

quotes.race: Frome Scaffolding Group EBF Stallions "National Hunt" Novices' Hurdle (Qualifier)
quotes.quote: I think I've been trying to win this race for 20 years and have had horses placed in it. Edwardstone is a very nice prospect and, with his seconds in bumpers, he was beaten by some good horses. He's a scopey horse and did a lot wrong in the first half of the race, ferociously strong and fresh. He will stay at two miles for the time being. - Alan King, trainer

stable_tour.quote: He's back in good order and seems to be working as well as ever - the whole team is very happy with him. The plan is he'll start in the Shloer Chase at Cheltenham in November, then we'll look at the Tingle Creek or the Peterborough. He won the Game Spirit and generally ran up to his best last season, and although he'll be 11 in January he hasn't been over-raced and I hope there are a few more races in him. 25-10-24

He's been a star for us back and I'm glad to say he seems to be working as well as ever - the whole team are very happy with him. He'll probably start in the Shloer Chase at Cheltenham in November, with a view to looking at the Tingle Creek or the Peterborough afterwards. He won the Game Spirit and generally ran up to his best last season and although he'll be 11 in January, like Trueshan hehasn't been over-raced and I hope there are a few more races in him. 07-11-24

runners.name: Energumene
runners.comment: Former main man in this division but his powers would appear to be on the wane
runners.spotlight: Former main man in this division and defied his advancing years with a defeat of subsequent Cheltenham Festival heroine Dinoblue on his return from a long absence at Cork in December; however, he was swatted aside by Jonbon next time at Ascot and then folded tamely in the Champion Chase; as on those two occasions, today's ground will be livelier than ideal.

quotes.race: BetMGM Clarence House Chase (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: "On that ground, Jonbon had too much speed for Energumene. The race didn't pan out to suit us. Paul [Townend, jockey] just said he got alongside Jonbon at the fourth last and he just picked up and went away from him. Jonbon is a nine-year-old and reaching his peak, whereas our fella is 11. We just need to pick our battles and have the right conditions, and that would mean very soft ground. If the ground came up heavy at Cheltenham like it did last year, you'd maybe have a pop - Sean Graham, owner's racing manager.

quotes.race: Bar One Racing Hilly Way Chase (Grade 2)
quotes.quote: The Clarence House Chase was what we did previously, so we'll see how Energumene comes out of it before making any decision - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: William Hill Champion Chase (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: Energumene gave a couple of fences fair belts, which is uncharacteristic for him really. I think it showed how good a horse he is to do things not perfectly today and win, because we know how good Chacun Pour Soi can be on home soil - Paul Townend, rider.

quotes.race: Betway Queen Mother Champion Chase (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Energumene was just brilliant on the day and Paul was just brilliant on him. I was way more confident coming into this year's race as we hadn't got Shishkin to take on and we thought if there was any improvement from the Clarence House that hopefully with a clear round he would win. Paul came home from the Clarence House and said they won't beat us again. The whole game plan will be to work back from this next year - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Albert Bartlett Clarence House Chase (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Up to the second last we were running a really good race. The winner (Editeur Du Gite) won on merit and I loved the way that he won after being passed and it was a great performance from the second (Edwardstone) too. Hopefully that run will get Energumene used to the new English white fences, we've schooled over them at home but he didn't seem as happy over them today as he did last March. You saw what he did at the first and he was a little bit long at one or two. It's different and I didn't expect him to be that way as he'd done plenty of schooling but he obviously did. I think the winner set the pace and won, it was a great performance and I'm not going to take anything away from him. We weren't able to beat him on the day. We just hope that there's a different result on the next day for us - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: William Hill Champion Chase (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: Energumene is by the same sire as Un De Sceaux and looked like he might be a similar sort but he has a lot more speed than we gave him credit for. The fact that he was able to come off a pace like that shows it. He was still able to gallop away from them and show speed going down to the last fence. It tells me that he's improving all the time - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Betway Queen Mother Champion Chase (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We just felt that we had completely the wrong tactics at Ascot. But today it wasn't about tactics so much - Shishkin just didn't handle that ground and Nico wisely pulled him up, and I was just very disappointed to see Chacun Pour Soi going out of the race early, but I could see Paul travelling and Energumene loving conditions here. It probably suited him better. He's got more speed than maybe we thought - at Ascot we thought after the race we should have waited, rather than play our cards early - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: SBK Clarence House Chase (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Energumene ran his heart out and Paul gave him a terrific ride. Nico de Boinville was excellent on Shishkin and, of course, Shishkin did what he always does. He pretends to be beaten and then he nabs you on the line - although, to be fair, he usually does it a bit earlier than that. I think our fellow probably jumped a bit better than the winner. Shishkin might have that up his sleeve if he puts it all together next time. It's going to be difficult for us. I hope we're not going to be far away from him at Cheltenham but it's going to be difficult to turn it around. If I was looking at it as a neutral I would say Shishkin just has the edge. God knows what he had left in the locker as well. It's all to play for the next day but I would say the betting people will have Shishkin as favourite again - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Kerry Group Hilly Way Chase (Grade 2)
quotes.quote: You would have to be delighted with that. Sean said they went very quick early, they ended up racing all the way down the back but Energumene's class told and he won very easily. But for that he would have been very impressive. But Notebook took him on and he finished last having had a run. Sean was very impressed and he will improve loads. At the moment there is no need to go further with him but we know he does stay - David Casey, assistant trainer.

quotes.race: Ryanair Novice Chase (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: Energumene met a few wrong down the back but once he got his eye in again he was brilliant over the last four. A great performance to finish up the season. I thought he would be a two-and-a-half mile horse but when he gets his jumping right, he's like a hurdler jumping fences. He will go the Champion Chase route at first next season and see how that goes - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Patrick Ward & Company Solicitors Irish Arkle Novice Chase (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: Energumene put up a hell of a performance there to jump and gallop the way her did. He stood a little far off a couple of them but you couldn't ask more from a novice having just his third run over fences - Willie Mullins, trainer

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Novice Chase
quotes.quote: Energumene was very impressive and he has a great method of jumping. He's obviously not too bad over this trip. That was very testing ground to do most of his own work. We'll probably go down the 2m route now and the Irish Arkle would look to be the next target - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: He loves chasing and Paul was very taken with him which has to be a good sign. We'll probably find something for him around Christmas. Paul said he wouldn't mind going back in trip but he could easily go up in trip as he has a nice relaxed way of galloping - Willie Mullins, trainer

quotes.race: MansionBet Get Paid As A Winner If 2nd In The Supreme Novices' At Cheltenham Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Energumene jumped fantastic when he was going at racing speed. I would like to get a couple of runs into him before Punchestown and go for a novice hurdle there. He'll go chasing next year, that will be his forte - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Holy Cross Flat Race
quotes.quote: I'd say he's still learning and will learn from today. His future will lie over fences. I'm not sure what the plan is with him, plenty of horses missed last year with the ground and he was around then. I'd say he has a fair engine - David Casey, assistant trainer to Willie Mullins, trainer of Energumene\P

stable_tour.quote: He's coming along great and I'm delighted with him. Everything I have asked of him he has answered so far, and I'm keeping my fingers crossed he'll make the Hilly Way at Cork and we'll have a smooth passage through the season and get back to the Champion Chase. 25-11-24

He won me a first Champion Chase last year and followed up at Punchestown the following month. This season he started off with an easy win at Cork in the Hilly Way. I then took him over for the Clarence House, which had been rerouted from Ascot to Cheltenham, and he finished third. I think he needed the run over those different style of fences. Even though we had schooled him over them at home, sometimes a horse just needs to get out on the course and see them while racing. I feel that experience will stand to him at the festival. There's never a slowly run Champion Chase and I think that'll suit our fellow. The Clarence House was a very tactical race and some of the jockeys might change tactics next time. We learned a lot and Paul [Townend] is happy he'll improve a good deal from that experience. 08-03-23

runners.name: Harpers Brook
runners.comment: This looks far too tough a task for one who is essentially a smart handicapper
runners.spotlight: Highly talented but a quirky customer and even if on his best behaviour this looks far too tough a task for one who is essentially a quality handicapper.

quotes.race: William Hill Castleford Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It was a genius ride and a brilliant job by Dan [Skelton, trainer] and the team because Harper's Brook is good at throwing races. They've worked him out - although even then Kielan thought he'd got upsides too quickly. He has masses of ability but he's just odd. When he thinks he's done it, he stops - Andrew Megson, owner.

quotes.race: Virgin Bet Every Saturday Money Back Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Harper's Brook got his head in front, which is great because he's got a lot of ability. We all love him to pieces because he's a bit of a rogue. He almost got taken out completely and then almost fell at the second-last before somehow coming back on the bridle again before the last - Ben Pauling, trainer.

quotes.race: Join Racing TV Now Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race) (Div I)
quotes.quote: That was a very nice performance. Harper's Brook is a big raw horse and was a little bit keen, but he jumped fantastic and I'd have won regardless of the horse in front of us running out or not. I just wanted to teach him a bit up the straight, but whatever he does over hurdles will be a bonus as he's a chaser in time - Kielan Woods, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He'll get an entry in the Grand Annual but I don't know whether Cheltenham really suits him. He made a bad mistake at Windsor and couldn't really get into the race, but he won well the time before at Wetherby and has had a productive season. He's got loads of experience in these big fields and is not without talent.  10-2-25

He joined us having won a point-to-point last year for Tom Ellis and was impressive from day one. He is a fine, big chasing type and the fact he won at Carlisle in his first attempt over hurdles was a bonus. He is not short of speed and the plan is to go to Sandown on Friday for the Grade 2 Winter Novices' Hurdle. If things go well there we will look for something bigger over Christmas. I hope he is well above average, as he certainly shapes that way. 30-11-21

runners.name: Il Etait Temps
runners.breeder: E Clayeux & S C Ecurie Couderc
runners.comment: Absent for nearly a year but trained by a genius and he's proven at this level
runners.spotlight: Top-class novice chaser from 2m to 2m4f, winning his third Grade 1 over fences (also won at that level hurdling) when flooring the Arkle winner Gaelic Warrior on yielding ground at Punchestown last May; this is a huge ask after almost 12 months off but he is trained by a genius; he could give Jonbon something to think about.

quotes.race: Barberstown Castle Novice Chase (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: Il Etait Temps is an extraordinary horse, that's his third Grade 1 this year.  He doesn't look like a big steeplechaser but he's got an engine and he jumps well. He's just maturing and learning all the time - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Close Brothers Manifesto Novices' Chase (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: That was nice. I loved the manner in which Il Etait Temps did it. I was really taken with how he walked round the parade ring before the race - I haven't seen him as loose for a while, and I thought if he could run like he walked, he'd run a big race. And then when he jumped off at the start, I think for the first three-quarters of a circuit, I was very worried. He just seemed very behind himself, and I don't think he'll need his hood in future. But he warmed to his task, jumped well later in the race and he just kept galloping. Jukebox Jury is a right sire and we'll be using more of him. I think probably trip is more important than track to him. He did win over two miles, but this performance today over two and a half is fantastic. At this end of the season horses are tired and he took a bit of time to warm into it, but I'm happy that he's going to improve for further a trip as he gets older. He's a fine horse, probably only 16.1hh if that - the normal sort for today is a big 16.3hh chaser - and the important thing about him is that he turns up for everything. He's made of iron. There's never an issue with him, and that counts for a great deal - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Goffs Irish Arkle Novice Chase (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: Il Etait Temps is obviously very effective over this trip and we'll look forward to the Arkle in Cheltenham. He showed plenty of resolution and Danny just timed his run well - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Guinness Faugheen Novice Chase (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: It was a great run. Il Etait Temps is proving himself as a Grade 1 novice chaser. He was very consistent in his novice hurdle season and he is showing he will be competitive in all of those Grade 1 novice chases. His jumping was good, although the winner's was something else - Danny Mullins, jockey.

quotes.race: Download The BetVictor App Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: Il Etait Temps paid a lot more respect to his fences than he did hurdles. I thought he jumped brilliantly overall. It was a good gallop, a good horse led us and he showed a good turn of foot from the last - Paul Townend, rider

quotes.race: Tattersalls Ireland Novice Hurdle (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: Il Etait Temps is a very good horse. He's just got to get his jumping right, he made a mistake at the first again today. He's a Grade 1 horse - Willie Mullins, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He was a revelation last season, winning three Grade 1 races over a variety of distances. He's not your typical chaser. He's extremely versatile and we'll see what way his season starts panning out before deciding on a target for him. He could be a Ryanair horse. 25-11-24

I always thought he was a fair horse, which is why we ran him in the races we did last year and he ended up being a novice for this season. He finished a four-length second to Facile Vega over Christmas but turned the tables on him last time at Leopardstown. He made a mistake at the first that day but Danny said that when he turned down the back he flew his hurdles and got it all together. I know the two ahead of him made it easier for him, but now it's all falling into place who knows how good he'll be? He's very keen but when he settles I think his jumping will come together. I know we have Facile Vega in the Supreme but this fellow will be a live one as well. 08-03-23

runners.name: Jonbon
runners.comment: Except for his Champion Chase blunder he's looked as brilliant as ever this season
runners.spotlight: Again forgot his lines at the Cheltenham Festival where he stayed on for a never-dangerous second in the Champion Chase after an almighty blunder at halfway; has been his brilliant self otherwise this season and was only doing enough when ridden out for  further top-level honours at Aintree (2m4f, good); has won the last two editions of this race and made it 5-5 at the track in the Tingle Creek on his last visit in December; Mark Walsh replaces the injured Nico De Boinville; hard to oppose.

quotes.race: My Pension Expert Melling Chase (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: You've got to admire two things there - Jonbon, who is amazing when he's doing that, and Nico [De Boinville, jockey]. He's been very brave, because it's been a tough little session, and to go out and ride him like that, that's a guy who had no fears. They went some clip - I don't know what the time was, but it must have been quick. Whether he's short or long [at his fences] - he's very clever when he dances, isn't he? To be able to do that - when he's long it's great, and when he's short, he's just very quick and in and out. It just went all wrong at Cheltenham, and it was proved today, he just loves doing that. That's what he does best. At Cheltenham the start went wrong, and he was on the back foot the whole way. He loves his own space. It was unfortunate, the tape went straight across his face and he went backwards. That was some gallop. Not many horses can jump that well that fast. We'll certainly think about going to Sandown again - Nicky Henderson, trainer.Jonbon was an absolute superstar today. He was incredibly brave and courageous when I needed him to be and he made the job easy. Credit to him, he's got us out of a tough period - Nico de Boinville, jockey.

quotes.race: BetMGM Queen Mother Champion Chase (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We were stood up against the tape and the tape pinged back and went under Jonbon's nose. It just startled him for a moment then you are on the back foot and they have gone hard. I would say there was a stride there [at five out] but I think he might have lost his sight slightly and he decided to chip in and didn't think it was there. Then you are just trying to do what you can. He is some horse to manage to finish where he did - Nico De Boinville, jockey.

quotes.race: BetMGM Clarence House Chase (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Jonbon is not the most straightforward horse, but he's just a joy. What a performance. Nico [De Boinville, jockey] said he was very fresh and nearly too much on it. He was out and really up for it. He just wanted to do it and loves the game - Nicky Henderson, trainer.

quotes.race: Betfair Tingle Creek Chase (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Jonbon was up for a battle today. He's a very classy terrier because he just loves the scrap. He is the two-miler that I think can represent our country. We've got to fight against the enemy, who are going to come over in force - Nicky Henderson, trainer.

quotes.race: Shloer Chase (Registered As The Cheltenham Chase) (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Jonbon really enjoyed himself. I expect Nico will tell me he had a good blow between the last two and we now have three weeks until the Tingle Creek. That would be the perfect prep I would say. Like a lot of horses, as they get older they get further and he won over two and a half at Aintree last year which was no problem. But as JP [McManus, owner] said at the end of last season, we are a two-miler and we'll stay at two miles - Nicky Henderson, trainer.

quotes.race: bet365 Celebration Chase (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It's great to see Jonbon come back and put on a display on like that. He's a brave horse as he had a hard race at Aintree and I'm proud of him. We had a three-week blip around Cheltenham but the horses are finishing on a good note. Jonbon is a flagship horse and there's a lot to look forward to. He means a lot to JP [McManus] and a lot to me - Nicky Henderson, trainer.

quotes.race: My Pension Expert Melling Chase (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Jonbon got into a lovely rhythm, that was perfection. I've never seen him jump better. He travelled well. I think the two and a half miles is probably ideal. I'm trying to get Nico (de Boinville) to say that he will stay three, but he is reluctant to say that at the moment, but we can think about those things throughout the summer. Should we have been thinking about the Ryanair this season, I don't know? When we did that with Shishkin and jumped him up to two and a half miles, we soon realised he wanted three miles. I'm not saying that about Jonbon at the moment - Nicky Henderson, trainer.

quotes.race: My Pension Expert Clarence House Chase (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Jonbon didn't see a nice stride at the last and if he'd have winged that he might not have let the other horse back. He's lost the battle but not the war.  He's quite a busy person, he lives on his wits a little and the extra wait from Ascot wasn't exactly what he wanted. He's a clock that you can wind up, now we can unwind him and go again. We were really looking forward to El Fabiolo last weekend and I don't think that's changed anything dramatically. We've got to let him off for a little bit and start the preparation for March - Nicky Henderson, trainer.

quotes.race: Betfair Tingle Creek Chase (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: There's only two options for Jonbon really - the Clarence House Chase at Ascot and the Game Spirit Chase at Newbury. He's growing up all of the time. I've mentioned before that we had a gallop at Windsor with him earlier this year and he was quite geed up by that and in his preparation. But at Cheltenham and since then he has been more settled and grown up. It was always going to be tough in this ground. We said to hang on to him for as long as we could as it is the sort of ground you can get caught out in. It was essentially to keep our power a little bit drier today. He's an attacker and you can really let him rip at fences but that would've been dangerous in these conditions. He's jumping very well this year - Nicky Henderson, trainer.

quotes.race: Shloer Chase (Registered As The Cheltenham Chase) (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: They went a good gallop and it wasn't a tactical race. It was a sensible, good, honest gallop in that ground. It was going to find Jonbon out first time if he wasn't ready, but he was (ready). You have to be very pleased. He was just pricking his ears on the run-in. He has had a nice time and he has enjoyed himself. He should come on for it. He looked like a two-miler there, and he has got to stay there for now because of the Tingle Creek. There is the conundrum as to how far he will get as I'm convinced he will get further but you don't need to - Nicky Henderson, trainer.

quotes.race: bet365 Celebration Chase (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Jonbon is exceptional. He's such a good horse. You can do whatever you want on him - he's so good, I've been saying that for two years - Aidan Coleman, rider.  My final deciding reason for running was we'd find out if he could take these two-milers on who he'd be meeting next year. If he can cope with them, around here, now, then we can start thinking of Tingle Creeks next year - and that's what he's answered - Nicky Henderson, trainer.

quotes.race: EFT Systems Maghull Novices' Chase (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Jonbon was good today wasn't he? I think he loves that slightly better ground after it's dried out a bit today. I think he was a better horse here than he was at Cheltenham, and that's in part because of the ground. That's the way he jumps when he's right. He jumped from fence to fence today and he didn't at Cheltenham. Aidan said on good ground he feels like a two-miler, although I've always thought he'd go as far as you like. We don't have to make any decisions today though - Nicky Henderson, trainer.

quotes.race: Sporting Life Arkle Challenge Trophy Novices' Chase (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I've always thought he'd be better on better ground. Jonbon gallops like that, but he's done nothing wrong. He's come to have a crack at it and we were tracking Dysart Dynamo, whom I'm glad to see is okay - that's important, but El Fabiolo was doing the same to us. We'll definitely go further - I think he'd go as far as you'd like on good ground. We'll think about Aintree and you could certainly go two and a half miles as it's an easy two and a half there. All being well, they'll stay in Ireland and we'll go to Aintree. You wouldn't know how far he'd get in time though - Nicky Henderson, trainer.

quotes.race: Virgin Bet Kingmaker Novices' Chase (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I'm going to look on the bright side. Jonbon has had such easy races, I think it took him by surprise when the other horse attacked him like that and he just shook his head. But he's done nothing wrong, he's not had a race since Aintree last year and I'm going to look on the bright side of it. It was his prep, it looked like it shook him a little bit and I'll get all the feedback off Aidan and AP - Nicky Henderson, trainer.

quotes.race: Close Brothers Henry VIII Novices' Chase (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: There's a certain amount of relief, I think everyone was expecting and hoping to see that and like at Warwick Jonbon was as good as you could wish to see, he's very clever with a very high cruising speed.  He was enjoying himself and can go both ways, when you're under no pressure you can afford to be careful and if you want to be showy and have a yahoo, he can do. He's a genuine two miler at the moment but I'd love to find out how far he can stay. Don't worry, we're not going anywhere else at the moment - we'll stay at two miles for now because he's so quick. He's doing everything right so far - Nicky Henderson, trainer.

quotes.race: Highflyer Bloodstock Novices' Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: This was always going to be his game but Jonbon was a very high-class novice hurdler last season. There was only one horse better than him and he's safely tucked up at Seven Barrows hopefully ready for Saturday (Constitution Hill), so this was always going to be his game. It's what we hoped for but it's just a huge relief now it's over. He jumps and he gallops and it's a great racecourse and beautiful ground, so it was a good test for him. The fences have to be jumped here so it was a perfect start for him. This isn't a racecourse to take lightly for a novice over fences, but he was pretty flawless there. I liked how he was a bit long at the ditch and then he sort of danced in and he was perfect all the way. Most of our hoses are needing the run and coming on for it and I don't see why he won't be the same. He was fit enough to do what he had to do today minding that the timing wasn't ideal, as we couldn't find many races that could lead us into the Henry VIII at Sandown. We've got two and a half weeks now and it just gives us a bit of time before Sandown. You couldn't go there first time out so this has served its purpose - Nicky Henderson, trainer.

quotes.race: Betway Top Novices' Hurdle (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Jonbon has had a good campaign. He's a lovely, big, young horse and his future probably lies over fences. You have to admire him for the way he battled there, that was tough. He had to brave and he was, very much so. Constitution Hill was the only horse to lower his colours but you can't take that out on him, he's unbeaten otherwise. He's finished up getting his Grade 1 here. I'm pretty certain he'll go over fences next season and he'll get further, I'm sure he would. We had him in the two-and-a-half mile races at Cheltenham and here. He'll get that trip easily - Nicky Henderson, trainer.

quotes.race: Sky Bet Supreme Novices' Hurdle (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: That was a special performance by the winner, but Jonbon ran incredibly well. He's a free sweater but that's it - he's always the same. He's a pleasure to ride - Aidan Coleman, rider.

quotes.race: Sky Bet Supreme Trial Rossington Main Novices' Hurdle (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It's a sharp two miles round here. The ground is tacky, and it was very hard work. Jonbon was flat out turning in but picked up well. I was very happy with the performance. He's such a pleasure to ride. I winged the third last and landed in the back of the other horse. He's so straightforward and we can stop talking about him being precocious because he's not. He's a lovely ride and he's beat a good field - Aidan Coleman, jockey.

quotes.race: Howden Kennel Gate Novices' Hurdle (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Aidan said you can do anything with Jonbon and he's extraordinarily professional for a horse that had so little experience. He was a cool dude the whole way around and he had them off the bridle a long way out off no gallop as his cruising speed is so high. We'll enjoy today, and I'd say it'd be one run before Cheltenham - Nicky Henderson, trainer.

quotes.race: Play Ladbrokes 5-A-Side On Football "National Hunt" Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Jonbon's a brother to Douvan so he's got plenty of boot. He was on his toes and I call him a fidget, but he doesn't do anything wrong. We'll take it step by step and see where we want to go. He wasn't over-keen, but his jumping took him there. He was only in second gear and Aidan said he had to go on - Nicky Henderson, trainer.

quotes.race: BetVictor Standard Open National Hunt Flat Race (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We're very lucky to be sent horses like this. You feel the pressure that comes with it. We were waiting and hoping for what we thought would, and luckily did, happen. There are plenty of these horses who don't turn out to what they're thought to be and it's just lovely to see him do what he did today. Jonbon relaxed, raced beautifully and quickened up well. Thanks to JP for letting us have him. He'll go back to JP's Martinsntown stud for the summer and we've all got a summer where we can dream of what might happen next season - I think he is a bit special. He's a gorgeous horse who has the looks and pedigree. I spoke to Derek O'Connor, who rode him in his point this morning and he came with big recommendations. It's only the first step of what I hope will be a long and successful career - he's something to look forward to. He's a bit of a fidget at home and wouldn't stand still for long, but he looks magnificent on it and is not a horse who worries about it. He can anticipate things a bit, but I was pleased with how he relaxed in the race and got on with the job - Nicky Henderson, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's done his racing, it's all been very good and he's in great form for the Champion Chase ? everybody's very happy, so now we wait for the invasion, from Ireland or France or wherever. We could be hassled from all angles, but that's what the festival's about and I love it, as long as the Russians aren't coming! As ever, though, there's no point worrying what's going to turn up against us. We'll try to get him there at his best and that's that. He hasn't always impressed everybody and there are still some who have a theory he doesn't act around Cheltenham, but I can't see what he's done wrong ? he's won two Shloer Chases, so he can't do much more on that score ? and he's in great nick with three weeks to go, terrific shape. 16-2-25

runners.name: Master Chewy
runners.comment: A good bet to give his running but he's relying on some of these being off their game
runners.spotlight: Smart novice last season, running well when falling in the Arkle and then nearly winning the equivalent at Aintree (good to soft); at least matched that form in winning the Grade 2 Game Spirit at Newbury in February and his Ryanair defeat can be attributed to the 2m4f; a good bet to give his running but he's relying on some of these being off their game.

quotes.race: William Hill Best Odds Guaranteed Game Spirit Chase (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Master Chewy was always going to run on and he probably needs further, so perhaps we'll go for the Ryanair - Nigel Twiston-Davies, trainer.

quotes.race: My Pension Expert Maghull Novices' Chase (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It was a massive run. I'm heartbroken obviously but we are delighted to have put the Arkle run behind us, I don't think we'd have beaten Gaelic Warrior in a million years, but I think we might have been third or fourth. Master Chewy fell two out so ended up not having a hard race there, whereas some of those others did, but he had to back it up. He's run a cracker. The owners wanted to see if they had a Grade 1 horse and I think we can safely say they have. His jumping was brilliant. He learned from his fall a bit and he's learning all the time. We were getting there - Tom Bellamy, jockey.

quotes.race: Ladbrokes Wayward Lad Novices' Chase (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: You can't knock his form at all as Master Chewy has been very good. He has been called a few names, but I think it is important that he gets there late. He was beaten by a more experienced rival last time then at Aintree (on his second start) they took three fences out up the home straight and that completely mucked him up as his jumping is where he gets his air in his lungs and that helps him and that is why he is so much better over fences than hurdles. We will either look at the Kingmaker at Warwick or the Lightning with him at Doncaster before Cheltenham. We will then see how goes after that. The Arkle can often be a small field, so why not (give it a go)? - Nigel Twiston-Davies, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: We were very pleased with him in the Game Spirit, and he's always threatened to put up a performance like that. He was beaten only a head in a Grade 1 at Aintree, and was running a big race in the Arkle when he fell. We hope a step up in trip will bring out even more improvement.  17-2-25

runners.name: Unexpected Party
runners.comment: Jonbon comfortably has his measure on their previous clashes; lots to find on the figures
runners.spotlight: Won last season's Grand Annual at the Cheltenham Festival and put up a sterling defence when runner-up last month; however, Jonbon comfortably has his measure on their previous clashes; lots to find on the figures.

quotes.race: Johnny Henderson Grand Annual Challenge Cup Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Unexpected Party had a great start to the year, but in the winter he was nowhere - he was finishing last in four-runner novice chases, admittedly good races, but finishing last and never looking like beating a horse. But the handicapper reassessed him from the Paddy Power days back to the mark he started off this year, and that was probably a big help to him. He was very brave over the last two fences - two big jumps over them. I would say I was surprised Harry got both big jumps, but fair play to the horse, he needed both of them - Dan Skelton, trainer.

quotes.race: Happy Birthday Sue Novices' Chase (Listed Race) (For The Robert Mottram Memorial Trophy) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: This has been the long-term plan ever since Unexpected Party ran at Ayr. He hadn't won as a novice and we'd asked him some big assignments without winning so he had experience in his favour. He was always coming here and we've trained him specifically for it. That's a good start to the season. He'll have an entry in the Paddy Power as well as the Grade 2 over two miles in case it was really soft. Dan Skelton, trainer

quotes.race: SBK Holloway's Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: He travelled very well through the race and I had been keep to drop him back in tri, but Harry didn't want to do that. We're very pleased to have still got him because he almost got to the point where he was too fragile. He'll have all the entries but the Coral Cup will be highest on his agenda. I think I'll get my wish to run him over two miles one day but that might not be until he goes over a fence in eight months' time. Dan Skelton, trainer.

quotes.race: bet365 Novices' Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race) (Div I)
quotes.quote: Unexpected Party is a horse who's always shown ability. It's frustrating it's taken as long as it has but he was a very fragile horse when he was younger. The step up in trip was a big help. The race fell apart and I wouldn't be convinced about the form but he could do no more than win as he's done - Dan Skelton, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He won the Grand Annual last year and will go there again. He's higher in the handicap this time, so it's not going to be any easier, but he ran really well when second at Windsor last time. I'm not saying I think he'll win but he knows how to run well in races like this and I do think he'll go well. 10-2-25

1:20.race_name: bet365 Novices' Championship Final Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)

runners.name: Give It To Me Oj
runners.comment: Back in deeper waters and on a tough mark having gone up 15lb for penultimate effort
runners.spotlight: Good fourth in the Grade 1 juvenile hurdle at Aintree is flanked by wins that were straightforward tasks; returns to deeper waters and concedes weight all round having gone up 15lb for penultimate effort.

quotes.race: Get Best Odds Guaranteed At BetVictor Juvenile Hurdle (Novices' Championship Hurdle Qualifier) (GBB)
quotes.quote: Apart from the last, Give It To Me OJ jumped well. He was going a bit left-handed, but that might have been because the front horse was going left-handed. Through no fault of his own he's had a messed up season, but he needed that run the other day when he was second - Gary Moore, joint-trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's been running well on the Flat all summer without winning but has taken well to hurdling at home and ran well on his first start over jumps at Wincanton on Sunday. He was beaten by two higher-rated Flat horses and looked like a stiffer test would have suited him better. It was a good start and he'll improve for it. There could be a nice juvenile hurdle in him this winter. 29-10-24

runners.name: Serious Challenge
runners.comment: Completed a hat-trick with Southwell success, beating some of these rivals; improving
runners.spotlight: Only 1-17 on Flat in Ireland but is building up a good strike-rate over hurdles for new stable; completed a hat-trick with Southwell success (2m) most recently, beating some of these rivals; improving.

quotes.race: BoyleSports Casino Irish EBF Maiden
quotes.quote: Serious Challenge is a lovely horse. The run earlier in the week brought him forward a lot. He's in the Futurity at the Curragh so that's probably where he'll go next - Una Manning, assistant trainer.

runners.name: Wolf Moon
runners.comment: All out at Huntingdon last time but has a smart pedigree and may do better still
runners.spotlight: Beat all bar a notable rival on hurdles debut; questionable whether he has improved in justifying favouritism twice since, all out at Huntingdon (2m) latest; however, has a smart pedigree and may do better still.

quotes.race: Weatherbys Racing Bank Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We had to come here to get another run into Wolf Moon to qualify for the novice championship handicap at Sandown next month, which is the last race of the season. He won't go up much for that and two miles around here was not ideal, but you can see he'll make a lovely chaser one day - Ben Pauling, trainer.

runners.name: Hms President
runners.comment: Useful but is a high-mileage contender, having raced 41 times (Flat/hurdles)
runners.spotlight: Useful on Flat and has a solid record (2122) over hurdles; penultimate effort in this sphere is a strong piece of form; however, rather lacks room for significant progress, having raced 41 times in total.

quotes.race: Duke Of Edinburgh Stakes (Handicap)
quotes.quote: A huge run! What can I say, I am delighted. I thought at the furlong pole that Joseph's horse had got HMS President, and just for a second, that we might come back. Bar winning, I couldn't be happier with him - Alan King, trainer.

quotes.race: Howden Handicap (Heritage Handicap)
quotes.quote: HMS President probably suits a bigger field as they do go a gallop and they come back to them if they go hard in front like they did today. He's a very talented horse and he's settled into the routine at Barbury Castle well, so we're very pleased to have him. To be honest the plan has been for quite some time to come for this today. We'll re-evaluate now and see - Robin Smith, assistant trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He had a holiday after the Ebor and, having done some decent schooling when we first got him in the spring, he's one to look forward to over hurdles. He wouldn't want deep winter ground but he's rated 101 on the Flat and is an exciting prospect for novices. 25-10-23

He's in good form and could start back over hurdles at Kempton next Monday. They took the last two flights out on his debut at Plumpton last February and that didn't suit him because he's always loved jumping and it was a long way home from the third-last - he lost a bit of interest and got outstayed. 07-11-24

runners.name: St Pancras
runners.comment: Second in a substandard Adonis is flanked by wins; this demands best form yet
runners.spotlight: Two wins apiece on Flat and under this code, notably in 4yo Listed hurdle; subsequently ran well in substandard Adonis then had a straightforward task at Stratford; this assignment demands best form yet.

quotes.race: bet365 Scottish Triumph Hurdle (A Juvenile Hurdle) (Listed Race) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: St Pancras only ran a couple of weeks ago and we were anxious to get some more experience into him as quickly as possible as he's a lovely horse but just a bit novicey. We were wary even though it is a Listed race that I'd be waiting around until the end of February for some nice ground, so I'm glad we put him on the box with tomorrow's two runners. He did a lovely bit of work the other day and we're over the moon as that is our first Listed winner. We didn't think he'd have the pace of some of them as he probably wants further, but Kevin was patient and came with one good run - Toby Lawes, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's a good-looking horse. He's getting there now and is nearly ready to run. 29-04-24

I always thought he was a lovely horse. He came out really well from the Ascot race, where he was fifth, and the aim was to get him plenty of experience for the spring. I couldn't see that many options for him in February that were going to be run on decent ground and, luckily, I managed to persuade Andrew Wates to let me take him up to Musselburgh for the Scottish Triumph Hurdle. He's a big, scopey horse who stayed very well on the Flat and I wasn't sure he'd have the tactical speed for it. I thought he'd be running on and collecting some nice prize-money but it was a pleasant surprise how much speed he showed to win - the sprint times from the race were very good and his finishing percentage was outstanding. He has a terrific attitude and showed that in spades at Musselburgh. I'd like to get him qualified for the novices' championship final at Sandown on the last day of the season, so I suppose I might go for a qualifier at Newbury in a few weeks' time and then look at something like the juvenile handicap at Ascot at the end of March before going on to Sandown. That would be my plan A, but if he improves in spades again and takes himself to a rating where we think we should be having a crack at something like Aintree, that would be fantastic. I think we'll play it as sensibly as we can for the time being. 12-02-25

runners.name: Mythical Moon
runners.owner: The Lee Family, A Stennett & J Wright
runners.comment: Won on hurdles debut and consistent since; however, this looks a difficult task
runners.spotlight: Made a winning debut over hurdles and has proved very consistent in defeat since, creditable third in Newbury handicap (2m) most recently; faces a stiffer task off same mark in this bigger prize.

stable_tour.quote: He's a lovely, big horse and I thought he was a smart member of our bumper team last season. He overraced a touch first time then ran a good second at Bangor. He made a winning hurdling debut at Stratford in what looked an above-average novice but we'll take our time with him. 07-11-24

runners.name: Were Red And Blue
runners.comment: Ran respectably in the Imperial Cup but needs improvement in another warm prize
runners.spotlight: Registered odds-on wins over hurdles in Scotland and the far north of England; respectable eighth when 28-1 for the Imperial Cup here last time but needs improvement in this similarly valuable race.

stable_tour.quote: He was novicey when he unseated at Chepstow on his first start over hurdles, but it was a good run at Uttoxeter when he was beaten by Wade Out, who Olly Murphy thinks a lot of. We'll stick at two miles for now and he might shape up into something like a Betfair Hurdle horse in the spring. 06-11-24

runners.name: Kientzheim
runners.comment: Hasn't lived up to expectations the last twice but is nicely bred and not written off
runners.spotlight: Ex-French mare who hasn't lived up to expectations in two starts since Kempton win and was behind some of these opponents last time; however, she's very nicely bred and may yet resume progress; not written off.

quotes.race: Ladbrokes "Gaffer Of All Accas" Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Kientzheim is related to Epatante, so it's lovely as she's a sweet filly too. She jumped really well until they really kicked on, but she's a novice. She'll have to grow up a bit more, but I'd think she can go up to some nicer races now. This was a lovely race to start in - Nicky Henderson, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: She's closely related to Epatante and is in good form ? we like her a lot. She's neat and has been running in some pretty good AQPS Flat races, but we'll find a lot more about her here. 23-12-24

runners.name: Sorceleur
runners.comment: Generally consistent; ties in with some of these rivals on last two efforts; solid
runners.spotlight: Two novice wins in November and generally consistent otherwise; ties in with some of these rivals on Sandown (Imperial Cup) and Southwell form the last twice; solid contender who should give his running.

quotes.race: BetMGM EBF 'National Hunt' Novices' Hurdle (Qualifier) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Sorceleur is a hardy horse and came out of Friday like he'd never been anywhere. I think I've had horses run on consecutive days six times and they've all won. He had a canter round at Exeter and he's won two nice pots. We won't run for a little while and look for a good race over Christmas - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He had good bumper form last season, notably an impressive Taunton win and a decent effort at Aintree in a Grade 2 when he didn't get a clear run, and should now develop into a decent novice hurdler. Considering he was as big as a bull, he not surprisingly got a bit tired on his jumping debut at Exeter last month after looking the likely winner for most of the way up the straight. Harry [Cobden] wasn't hard on him - one of the things I love about his riding - and came back in and said, ‘Winner next time', so given the improvement I'm anticipating, he looks a readymade winner of a novice hurdle. 04-11-24

runners.name: Big Ginge
runners.comment: Largely consistent but is the odd one out, being the only maiden in this field
runners.spotlight: Went close over C&D in November and ties in with a couple of these rivals on Imperial Cup running last time; has proved largely consistent but is the odd one out, being the only maiden in this field.

runners.name: John Barbour
runners.comment: Solid operator; ties in with some of these opponents on latest effort; not ruled out
runners.spotlight: Solid operator, with form figures of 314 in bumpers and 212 over hurdles; ties in with some of these opponents on Southwell running last time; half-brother to smart Gidleigh Park and open to further progress.

quotes.race: John Haine Memorial Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: John Barbour is full of ability but he's very quirky. When he won his first bumper he beat some lovely horses and then the next day didn't really go to plan. He then travelled and jumped all at Ludlow. If you could guarantee he could focus his mind he'd be a very good horse. Johnny [Burke] does a brilliant job on him. He's the sort of horse we might look at the Persian War with. We'll run him again because he needs experience, even if he's beaten - Fergal O'Brien, trainer.

runners.name: Fasol
runners.owner: P J Vogt And Bryan Drew
runners.comment: French Flat form suggests he's capable of rating higher still over hurdles
runners.spotlight: Only 1-8 over hurdles but has a generally consistent record and two starts since wind surgery include the Taunton success (2m); French Flat form suggests he's capable of rating higher still in this sphere.

quotes.race: DragonBet - Oncourse And Online Maiden Hurdle (Novices' Championship Hurdle Series Qualifier) (GBB)
quotes.quote: Fasol choked at Windsor last time so we had his wind done and he liked the better ground here. He'll have plenty of options during the spring - Paul Nicholls, trainer, talking to Racing TV.

stable_tour.quote: Horses who come to us from France mid-season often take longer to acclimatise and he was a prime example. Having run just okay on his hurdling debut in January, he was a lot better at Kempton four months later. As he was Group-placed on the Flat in France, we switched codes in June and he ran a blinder in the Queen Alexandra, not quite seeing out the two and three-quarter miles. So now we're in the unusual position of having a horse highly rated on the Flat who is lowly rated over hurdles. Hopefully, that's something we can now take advantage of when he reappears in the two-mile novice handicap at Cheltenham's Paddy Power meeting. He probably wants a bit further, but if they go a good gallop that should suit him. He had a nice run round at Wincanton in their charity race eight days ago and that was ideal. I suspect there's bags of improvement to come. 04-11-24

runners.name: Quantock Hills
runners.breeder: S C E A Haras De St Maur
runners.comment: Juvenile hurdler whose limitations have been exposed the last twice
runners.spotlight: Juvenile hurdler whose progress culminated in a share of the spoils (dead-heated) at Cheltenham in December; limitations seemingly exposed since, never dangerous in the Fred Winter last time.

quotes.race: JCB Triumph Trial Juvenile Hurdle (Novices' Championship Hurdle Series Qualifier) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Quantock Hills travelled through the race well and I think he's got a bright future. He wandered when he hit the front, this is a big place, but he's a good horse. He could be a Fred Winter and he'd be better on softer ground - Warren Greatrex, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He'll probably have two more targets this season. The Fred Winter at Cheltenham will be one and then I might look at the £100,000 juvenile handicap at Sandown. I was disappointed with the way he finished at Cheltenham last time, but he travelled very well. He was found not to be quite right after he had a tracheal wash a few days after and he was a bit dirty, so we've sorted that out. He had another tracheal wash this week just to make sure and he's in good health. 05-03-25

runners.name: Marche Daligre
runners.owner: Billam Roe Swindell Wilson & The Molds
runners.comment: Has failed to back up his Chepstow Grade 2 effort; something to prove
runners.spotlight: Juvenile hurdler who has failed to back up his Chepstow Grade 2 effort in two subsequent outings, turned over at short odds latest; has something to prove off his mark and is not a solid option.

stable_tour.quote: He was very consistent on the Flat in France and we got him for €72,000 this summer at the sales. He has the perfect profile to go juvenile hurdling this winter and I think he could develop into a serious Triumph Hurdle or Fred Winter type for Cheltenham. 06-11-24

runners.name: Nardaran
runners.comment: Galloped on strongly at Taunton and could well build on that emphatic win; interesting
runners.spotlight: Only four runs in total; galloped on strongly up the run-in at Taunton (2m) latest, opening his account; could well build on that emphatic win and show further improvement; interesting off bottom weight.

stable_tour.quote: We bought him at the Arqana Sale in July after he'd finished third on his only start for the Aga Khan in a Saint-Cloud maiden. Already gelded, he came back into training later than the others but I already like what I've seen and I hope he'll be a valuable member of our juvenile hurdling squad. He could go for the juvenile event at Kempton the day after Boxing Day. He's in the mould of Afadil, an ex-Aga Khan Flat horse who was bought at the same sale. I hope Nardaran turns out as good. 04-11-24

2:25.race_name: bet365 Oaksey Chase (Grade 2) (For The Menorah Challenge Trophy) (GBB Race)

runners.name: Appreciate It
runners.comment: 11yo who ended long losing run in Thurles Grade 2 in January; others have stronger claims
runners.spotlight: 11yo who ended a long losing run when beating stablemate Classic Getaway by 6l in Grade 2 at Thurles in January (2m5f, good); brought down ten fences out in the Grand National three weeks ago; it's possible he might run into a place but a few of the others have stronger claims.

quotes.race: Horse & Jockey Hotel Chase (Grade 2)
quotes.quote: Appreciate It probably missed his prime when he got injured after winning the Supreme so it is great for him to win such a prestigious race as this today. I think he loved the ground and dropping back to a Grade 2 helped as well - Patrick Mullins, assistant trainer

quotes.race: WilllowWarm Gold Cup Chase (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: Paul said Appreciate It might have been a little bit flat after Cheltenham. He nearly got brought down as well but he said that didn't make a lot of difference - David Casey, assistant trainer.

quotes.race: Rathmore Stud Irish EBF Novice Chase
quotes.quote: It was the same as the last day and you'd love to get a lead on Appreciate It as he's idle in front - Paul Townend, rider.

quotes.race: Last Chance 20% Off Festival Tickets Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: Appreciate It was having a look everywhere and not doing a lot. When Jack (Kennedy) did come alongside us, and got competitive, he was always in control I felt - Paul Townend, rider, speaking to Racing TV.

quotes.race: Sky Bet Supreme Novices' Hurdle (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: You'd have to think that was a Vautour-like performance, wouldn't you? The way he destroyed them up the hill was fantastic. Appreciate It was awesome. Paul (Townend) was exuding confidence the whole way down the hill. It was textbook stuff from Paul and the horse. In my head I had that he would probably be an Arkle horse. I never envisioned him as a Champion Hurdle horse. We'll go to Punchestown and leave that to next season. I always had chasing in mind - but then I always had chasing in mind for Faugheen. I think we might be back to the same argument. We'll have a word with the owner Michael Masterson, see what he'd like to do and have a word with everyone on my team. He could do either, I think - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Chanelle Pharma Novice Hurdle (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: I'd like Appreciate It to jump better than he did today. He was a bit careless down the back - Willie Mullins, trainer

quotes.race: Paddy Power Future Champions Novice Hurdle (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: He surprised me and impressed me. I was wondering if he was a two-and-a-half mile horse or a two-mile horse. I know he can easily do it over two and a half, but to come back to two miles and put in a performance like that in a Grade 1 was impressive. I'd say we'll go down the two-mile route now. He's not flashy like Ferny Hollow but he has a great cruising speed and covers a lot of ground which helps him to burn other horses off. He'll probably have another run here at the Dublin Racing Festival - Willie Mullins, trainer of Appreciate It

quotes.race: I.N.H. Stallion Owners EBF Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: I'm very happy with that. He picked up when I wanted him at the back of the last. He's deadly to jump, electric. He had a lot of it done before he came to us in terms of jumping. Over two miles today, you couldn't be happier. He'll have no problem going further - Paul Townend, rider of Appreciate It

quotes.race: Goffs Future Stars (C & G) I.N.H. Flat Race (Grade 2)
