quotes.quote: Appreciate it was very impressive. The way he put away a field of what looked the best bumper horses in Ireland did surprise me but Patrick had way more confidence in him than I had. He was keen on him all the time. I thought it was a very tough race. He looked like a Cheltenham type for me anyway - Willie Mullins, trainer

quotes.race: Paddy Power Games "One For The Road" INH Flat Race
quotes.quote: That was a very good performance. Patrick said riding him at home that he'd come on a lot from his last run and you can see the evidence of that today. He showed a nice turn of foot albeit over two and a half miles. He did it the hard way making all and I liked the way he changed gear in the last two furlongs. He's a real chaser in the making but I'd imagine we might try and go down the Cheltenham bumper route - Willie Mullins, trainer

stable_tour.quote: He's back on song and looks really well. He has an entry at Thurles on Thursday and could run in that Listed chase. He ran a big race in the Punchestown Gold Cup and wasn't beaten far. 25-11-24

He started his novice chase career very well, winning twice, but ran disappointingly last time out in the Irish Arkle when beaten by El Fabiolo. He ran flat but he's nine now and it looks as if he's not as fast as he was, so a step up in trip is what's needed. He's likely to go for the Turners as it's over an extra half-mile, which I hope will suit. Any give in the ground will help him. 08-03-23

runners.name: Classic Getaway
runners.comment: Fair sixth off lofty mark at Cheltenham recently but suspicion he'll be vulnerable today
runners.spotlight: 6l second to stablemate Appreciate It in Grade 2 at Thurles (2m5f, good) in January before winning three-runner Grade 2 at Gowran Park (2m4f, soft) in February; fair sixth off lofty mark in handicap at Cheltenham (2m4f, good) ten days ago but there's a suspicion he'll be vulnerable today.

quotes.race: Red Mills Chase (Grade 2)
quotes.quote: It was a good performance and Classic Getaway has been improving all season. Danny [Mullins, jockey] was keen to stress that the three fences in the straight made a big difference as his jumping brought him into the race without any effort and he had that final kick. It's nice for Cheveley Park to have a Red Mills winner. He ran well at Thurles on very quick ground and the different going here helped him - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Make Your Best Bet At BetVictor Chase (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Classic Getaway had some very good form last year. We were hoping he could do something like that. His jumping was so good and he is very agile for a horse of his size - Danny Mullins, rider

quotes.race: Noreside Catering Irish EBF Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: b\Classic Getaway didn't fulfil potential last year, but to see him put his head down today and gallop to the line was nice - Danny Mullins, jockey.

quotes.race: Festival Hospitality (C & G) Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Classic Getaway was workmanlike. The hood had the desired effect in settling him and maybe it worked too well. He was probably just lazy in front and he had a good blow afterwards. There should be plenty of improvement in him - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Junction INH Flat Race
quotes.quote: Classic Getaway is a beautiful horse with a great walk. He was a bit more expensive than a Rolls-Royce Phantom but I'm pretty sure Mrs Thompson will get more fun out of him than a Rolls Royce. This horse is a big baby for a five-year-old with a point-to-point run and that's why I was keen to teach him to stride out. He's not really a bumper horse and I'd imagine he'll go jumping. When the ground was so wet, we thought we'd get a run into him. Willie hasn't rushed him and let him settle in. I think he'll continue to improve mentally - Patrick Mullins, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He had a setback after he beat Minella Cocooner in a beginners' chase at Gowran Park in the early part of last season and missed most of the campaign. We managed to get him back to run at Punchestown but it was a big ask for him there. He jumps well and looks like he has the makings of a nice staying chaser if we get a clean run with him. 13-11-23

He's not so highly tried as many of his stablemates, but he won comfortably at Punchestown last time. I feel he wants a trip which could mean the Ballymore for him as I wouldn't think he has enough experience for a race like the Albert Bartlett. 09-03-22

runners.name: Gaelic Warrior
runners.comment: Won the Grade 1 Bowl at Aintree recently; he's the one to beat on that form
runners.spotlight: Impressive in last season's Arkle (2m, soft) and rediscovered that abundant promise when upped in trip to win the Grade 1 Bowl at Aintree (3m1f, good to soft) 23 days ago; has run well on good to yielding going (unraced on good); he's the one to beat if repeating that latest form.

quotes.race: Brooklands Golden Miller Chronograph Bowl Chase (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It's great that Patrick [Mullins, jockey] got on Gaelic Warrior. I thought Paul [Townend] would ride him, but he chose Embassy Gardens. His main target was to get him round in one piece, and then if he was able to do that we all know he has the class. I'd been a little disappointed in his two previous runs, when he just didn't fire, but he'd run well enough at Leopardstown and we thought he'd be better for it, but then he just wasn't right for Cheltenham. I thought if I didn't run him here I'd have to wait until Punchestown, so I thought we may as well run him here to get a race into him anyhow, so he's done a bit more than that - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Paddy's Rewards Club Chase (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: Gaelic Warrior just took a blow before the third last and I had to sit on him, but he has run on well. The winner is hard fit and probably got away - Patrick Mullins, jockey.

quotes.race: My Pension Expert Arkle Challenge Trophy Novices' Chase (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Gaelic Warrior jumped a lot straighter, there were two fences he shifted right just to sort himself out. Stamina came into play today and we know he stays. I just pointed him the right way! That's the best ride I've got off Gaelic Warrior in a long time. He was very manageable once we got out on to the track. Willie's done an unbelievable job on him - Paul Townend, jockey, speaking to ITV Racing. You can see what a difference a hood made to him, he wasn't inclined to jump right and Paul could ride the race on him. I was sort of asking myself as he was coming down the hill, 'what were we doing in three-mile races last year with him?' I think he has enough class now to do two miles, and he will probably stick at that game now, after that performance - Willie Mullins, trainer, speaking to ITV Racing.

quotes.race: Guinness Faugheen Novice Chase (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: Two of Gaelic Warrior's defeats have been at Cheltenham going left-handed. Cheltenham doesn't really suit him. The Turners is run on the New course, which is not as tight as the Old course, but he is better going right-handed. Going left-handed at Leopardstown in February is one option, maybe we should try it and see. The way he jumps, this might be his best trip, perhaps two miles on soft ground. He is very versatile. A lot of credit goes to Rachel Robbins, who rides him out and looks after him - Patrick Mullins, jockey.

quotes.race: Ballymore Novices' Hurdle (Grade 1) (Registered As The Baring Bingham) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Gaelic Warrior took out his earplugs on the way to the start and he didn't settle as well as we'd want him to, but Patrick said he could go up to three miles. He'll be a big, strong chaser down the line - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Festina Lente Charity Liffey Handicap Hurdle (Grade B)
quotes.quote: Gaelic Warrior has a bit of class and he proved it there, to do that in a competitive handicap was very good. We always thought he had a serious engine and he's progressing all the time. He's in the Supreme and Ballymore, I'll have a good chat with Paul later on and see what direction we go with him.  We'll see what the fall out of this weekend is and see what we have for different races. He's inclined to go right but that seems to be only when he has the space to do that. He was very good even when he went right - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Munster Hurdle
quotes.quote: Gaelic Warrior was quite fresh in himself at the start but he was grand after that. He's a lovely horse, it was hard work out there and he is quite hard on himself. He prefers to go right handed - Paul Townend, rider.

quotes.race: Boodles Juvenile Handicap Hurdle (Registered as The Fred Winter) (Grade 3) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Gaelic Warrior ran a great race. On the whole he jumped well. We would have probably liked a bit more juice in the ground. He is a nice prospect for next season. It didn't help him how he jumped the last but that is racing. There was only a short head in it and you can if an and all day but he ran a great race. I hope there will be plenty of good days with him as he is a real jumping type. We will stay novice hurdling next season as he is still a maiden and he will be back here for the Ballymore next year - Willie Mullins, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: I was disappointed with him on Sunday. He looked to be going so average at the fifth-last and it looked like Paul might pull him up, and he said the same afterwards. He got his second wind and stayed on well then. The Ryanair now comes into the equation or he could wait for Aintree or Punchestown, but we'll see. 5-2-25

He was beaten a short head in the juvenile handicap hurdle at the festival 12 months ago on his debut for us, which although disappointing was a big effort. Since then he has really found his stride and improved with each run - in fact, the handicapper thinks he's 24lb better now. He won his first two races this season by an aggregate of 101 lengths and we then had the option of taking on Facile Vega and Il Etait Temps in a Grade 1. But it would have been a sin not to go for the big handicap at the Dublin Racing Festival off his mark of 143. We had the option of that race or the Betfair Hurdle, but we thought it best to stay at home with Cheltenham so close. And he did just as we expected by winning it nicely. There's the option of going for the Supreme, but at the moment he's more likely to go for the Ballymore. He's still progressing. 08-03-23

runners.name: Pic Dorhy
runners.comment: Posted third Grade 1 win in the Ascot Chase in February; trainer has good record in race
runners.spotlight: Made it 2-2 for the season and posted his third Grade 1 win when readily making all in the Ascot Chase (2m5f, good) in February; excels at Ascot and hasn't shone on either visit here, but those were in 2021 and 2022 and he's a strong form contender; trainer has a good record in this race.

quotes.race: Betfair Ascot Chase (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I knew Pic d'Orhy was right today - he looked great - and he put them to the sword. I'd say that was probably a career-best from him and he's ten. He loves it round here, and this is the sort of race that suits him. We've always thought Cheltenham wouldn't suit and we won't go to Cheltenham, so we'll try to get him ready for Aintree again and get him there in top form - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

quotes.race: Copybet 1965 Chase (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I'm thrilled with that and it's a nice start to the season. Although Pic d'Orhy was fit, a big horse like that will always improve.  He'll definitely get three miles. Johnny and I have spoken about the King George and it's a possibility. The thing about supplementing is it allows us to wait until closer to the time to see who is and who isn't in it.  There's also the Fleur de Lys Chase at Windsor just after Christmas which would suit him. It's a big pot and he'd love it around there and there's the Grade 1 Ascot Chase back here which he won last year. There's a lot of nice races for him really and we've just got to make a plan - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

quotes.race: Betfair Ascot Chase (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Pic d'Orhy is absolutely brilliant and winning another Grade 1 with him means a hell of a lot. I woke up at seven o'clock this morning thinking I'd be following Charlie [Deutsch, L'Homme Presse's jockey], but I sensed that there wasn't loads of speed and no one really wanted to go on and make it.  I worked out L'Homme Presse was slow over his jumps last time and I thought we'd have a few lengths from the tape before we start - Harry Cobden, jockey.

quotes.race: Coral Silviniaco Conti Chase (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It's a bit frustrating because there wasn't quite a stride there at the last. Pic D'Orhy needed a big one to keep him in it and he didn't quite get it. He was giving three pounds away to the winner and they're two good horses. We'll go to the Ascot Chase next and then to Aintree, which suits him brilliantly. He loves tracks like that and Kempton. We've never been convinced Cheltenham is his track and he can't do both Cheltenham and Aintree. The Melling Chase is perfect for him - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

quotes.race: Nirvana Spa 1965 Chase (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I'm not sure Pic D'Orhy was at his best today, as he didn't really travel early and he didn't jump that well, but I couldn't give you a reason for it. When I turned in we had Straw Fan Jack upsides and I thought it might get ugly, so I tried to get the race put to bed before the second-last just so I wasn't relying on two good jumps. He's got the job done - Harry Cobden, jockey.

quotes.race: Marsh Chase (Registered As The Melling Chase) (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: This race has been Pic D'Orhy's target since he won the Peterborough Chase. He was trained for this race. It makes a big difference when you target them. We set out we were going to go to the Silviniaco Conti Chase and then Ascot. This track suits him very well. He's been improving all the time this season. He started at Newton Abbot, he's worked his way through and that was a proper Grade 1 performance. Physically he's just a different horse to what he was last year - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

quotes.race: Coral Silviniaco Conti Chase (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Pic D'Orhy's jumping has improved immeasurably and he looked quite quick today. We love the Ascot Chase and that would be the obvious race to go to now and maybe Aintree after that. We always think he's slightly better on a flat track and he's not a million miles from a proper Grade 1 horse - winning owner Johnny De La Hey.

quotes.race: Fitzdares Peterborough Chase (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Pic D'Orhy has improved and is getting better with his jumping. He's staying a lot stronger in his races and he's a lot stronger. The plan was always to bowl along in front and he just keeps galloping. He was good. He was a bit frustrating last season and used to make some stupid mistakes but he's learned from those. He's still only a young horse and he's a big horse. He's needed all the time and I think the best is probably still to come from him. He's still in the King George and I've got to have that discussion with Johnny [de la Hey, owner] but I think the race that would suit him really well is the Silviniaco Conti Chase at Kempton and then we've got to get him really fresh for Aintree - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

quotes.race: Howden Noel Novices' Chase (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Pic D'Orhy has got a hell of an engine but he's been frustrating. It's been a case of getting him to learn as he always had the tendency to take one on and come unstuck. That was his best round of jumping. He'll be a danger in races like the Pendil, the Scilly Isles and then we might skip Cheltenham and go to Aintree for the two and a half-mile race there. He's a proper, proper horse and when we get his jumping right he'll be winning proper races - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

quotes.race: Bet 10 Get 20 With MansionBet Novices' Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Pic D'Orhy was a little bit novicey in places and Harry said on that evidence the likelihood is he's probably going to want two and a half miles. It was good ground and he was a little bit flat out. The good thing is that he jumped round and he'll improve a lot for the jumping experience - Harry Derham, assistant trainer.

quotes.race: Betfair Hurdle (Handicap) (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: We really fancied Pic D'Orhy at Auteuil and he fell and had a few niggles after that. I was on the backfoot and he went to Ascot last time and travelled really well, but walked up the straight a bit. I rang Johnny that night and said if that was his first run of the season we'd be delighted. I don't think he gets two and a half miles at the moment. I always thought he was a smart horse, but he's needed time. We bought him to go chasing and he's a big horse who will be a serious chaser. He doesn't lack speed. A lot of those French horses come over and everyone says they want heavy ground because all they've ever done is run on it, but they get on decent ground and bingo - they enjoy it - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's one of our current stars and in fine form, looking as enthusiastic as ever in his work. It makes sense to follow a similar route to last season, so he'll reappear on the 23rd of this month in the 1965 Chase at Ascot. He won it last year and has only ever been beaten once at Ascot in four starts there. I gather Protektorat is also a possible, so that would make things interesting. It might make sense to enter him in the King George, as I've been toying with the idea of trying him over three miles one day, but we're likely to stick to two and a half and have another crack at the Grade 1 Ascot Chase. He was runner-up in it last year and went one better last spring. He's been wonderfully consistent down the years. When he had a rare off-day at Aintree in the spring, it was the first time in two years he'd finished out of the first two. 04-11-24

runners.name: Ga Law
runners.comment: Even on his best form he has something to find and he's been pulled up the last twice
runners.spotlight: Best known for his exploits in the big 2m4f handicap chases at Cheltenham; however, even on his best form he has something to find in this field and he's been pulled up the last twice; first-time blinkers replace cheekpieces.

quotes.race: Paddy Power Gold Cup Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: That was a smashing run and I can't fault the horse. Off a mark of 155, that was probably a career best to be honest. Ga Law slipped turning in which didn't really help him but you can't fault his effort. He lost his momentum and had to get going again but it hasn't cost him the race. We'll see what the handicapper does and I'm sure we'll go three miles at some point - Jamie Snowden, trainer.

quotes.race: Paddy Power Cheltenham Countdown Podcast Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Ga Law had a fall on this day in the Sky Bet Chase last year and it's taken him time to get over it. We always thought we'd get him back but that fall was pretty nasty. He ran really well in the Coral Gold Cup, but didn't stay and I think the drop back in trip and the New course here has helped him. We'll think about the old Racing Post Chase at Kempton and then maybe the Plate or Ultima at the festival - Jamie Snowden, trainer.

quotes.race: Paddy Power Gold Cup Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: When Ga Law got injured during his novice season, I said to the team not to worry because we'll win the 2022 Paddy Power Gold Cup. It's one thing to say it and another to get him back from injury. We knew off a mark of 142 we had to have a go at this. He's not the finished article. He showed a bit of inexperience and there's things to brush up on. Who knows how good he can be? There's no set plan but he will step up in trip - Jamie Snowden, trainer.

quotes.race: "Rising Stars" Novices' Chase (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I think the one thing this horse does is jump and GA LAW is electric at it, especially as he's a 4yo with so little experience. We were contemplating coming here or going to Cheltenham next week. I suppose when the rain comes and if it becomes a little softer, we wouldn't be afraid of dropping back in trip. He's got a bit of pace, but he strides on and jumps well. We were thinking about the Henry VIII as a possibility, but we'll enjoy today and plan afterwards.

quotes.race: Subscribe To Racing TV On YouTube Handicap Chase (Challenger Middle Distance Chase Series Qualifier)
quotes.quote: I am absolutely delighted with Ga Law, coming into this with so little experience. He is very athletic, and he will go on soft ground. He may go for the Rising Stars at Wincanton next - Jamie Snowden, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: His last winning mark was 150 and he's now down to 152, so it's the right time to go back into a handicap. He has run well over three miles before when he fell at the last in the Sky Bet Chase at Doncaster, so I think he does stay. 18-2-25

What a day he gave us when he won the Paddy Power before falling at the last in the Sky Bet Chase when it looked like he had every chance. He schooled over hurdles recently and went really well, and the three-mile Grade 2 hurdle at Wetherby on November 4 is the plan. That's his prep run before Newbury's Coral Gold Cup, but there have been plenty of chasers who have gone back and excelled as staying hurdlers, so we'll see how he gets on. In the back of our minds there is the option to stay over hurdles. 28-09-23

runners.name: Gentleman De Mee
runners.breeder: A M Pommerai, Mme A Pommerai Et Al
runners.comment: Back on song with Topham Handicap win off big weight and he could be in the mix
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in last season's Champion Chase and, after a difficult season, he returned to form to win the Topham Handicap off a big weight at Aintree (2m5f, good to soft) recently; also effective on good ground; unexposed at this sort of trip (unraced beyond 2m5f) and he could be in the mix.

quotes.race: Randox Supporting Prostate Cancer UK Topham Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: They went a very strong gallop the whole way. I missed the start - I wanted to pop Gentleman De Mee out handy, but the way things worked out, he stood at the start a little bit and I was at the back most of the way, but when I turned away from the stands going down to Bechers, he just started winging fences and getting himself a nice position. I knew they had gone quick and I was happy sitting there going into the fourth-last and the third-last, and going to the second-last I was lucky enough that a gap came off the rail, and I was able to scoot up there. The loose horse was no help to Johnny Burke, but made no real difference to me. This horse won a Grade One a couple of seasons ago and was second in the Champion Chase, so that was a fair performance off 11st 11lb. This is his time of year - Mark Walsh, jockey.

quotes.race: Betway Queen Mother Champion Chase (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Gentleman De Mee has run a cracker. I'm delighted for Henry, delighted for Rachael, and our fellow has run a cracker, so we're delighted - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Ladbrokes Dublin Chase (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: It's fantastic for Gentleman De Mee and great for Danny. I thought Danny was very brave on him and he was asking him everywhere the whole way down the back. The horse was loving it and responding to him. I thought it was a terrific performance. I was very happy with his last bit of work the other morning, I thought it was as good a gallop as I've ever seen him do. Things didn't go right for him at Christmas, possibly a little bit of drier ground here played to his strengths rather than Blue Lord's - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Betfair Tingle Creek Chase (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I thought Gentleman De Mee ran well and hit the line. We went a good, even gallop and I got a good spin. He stayed on again from the back of the last so it was a good run - Aidan Coleman, rider.

quotes.race: Poundland Maghull Novices' Chase (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We were fresh coming here and we were hoping our freshness might be the right card to play and it looked like that. Mark was very good on Gentleman De Mee, he got him out and got him jumping. He was giving him a breather when he made a mistake at the fourth-last but Mark felt he was always in charge. He's improved in the last six or eight weeks, probably for a change of tactics and getting confidence winning races, rather than being held up and getting beaten earlier in the season. He's maturing and growing into himself, he's a big horse. I'm hoping there's more to come, we'll see if Mr McManus wants to go to Punchestown. He's entitled to be a contender in the Champion Chase. He's improved hugely - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Flyingbolt Novice Chase (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: Gentleman De Mee is settling better, jumping better and settling into his game. He likes to get on with the job but Mark just thought he settled a fair bit better today, after the first two fences he said he was grand - Willie Mullins, trainer

quotes.race: BetVictor Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: Gentleman De Mee did that very well and we will probably keep him at that trip. I imagine he is one we will keep at home for the nicer prizes - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Naas Business Club Members Maiden Hurdle (Div II)
quotes.quote: Gentleman De Mee had a setback early in the season so I hadn't done as much with him as I would have liked, his sheer ability got him through there. He would look more like a Ballymore horse to me, I think he will improve as he goes up in trip - Willie Mullins, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He was disappointing the other day at Navan but, when you look through all his form, he never does anything in the autumn and is more of a spring horse. Hopefully he will come alive again in the second half of the season. 25-11-24

His first runs this season hardly set the world alight but he did a piece of work the week before the Dublin Racing Festival that was probably the best I'd ever seen him do. So we went for the Dublin Chase hoping he could translate that to the track as he was clearly in good form. We had Blue Lord in the race, who had attracted all the attention, and as a result Gentleman De Mee was like the forgotten horse. As it was Danny [Mullins] was very brave on him as he asked him everywhere down the back straight, and the horse answered every time. It was a very good performance and he heads for the Champion Chase. Obviously Energumene is the one to beat from our team but this fellow is thoroughly entitled to his place. 08-03-23

runners.name: Boombawn
runners.comment: Highly creditable fourth in Grade 1 novice at Aintree; needs another career best today
runners.spotlight: Won Grade 2 novice at Wincanton (2m4f, good) last November and posted a career best when highly creditable fourth in the Grade 1 Manifesto Novices' Chase at Aintree 23 days ago (2m4f, good to soft; his ninth chase start); his form needs to go to another new level if he's to come out on top today.

quotes.race: Boodles Rising Stars Novices' Chase (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I'm stopping short of calling it top-class form but for horses that like that ground it's got to be a good race. The second has worn his heart on his sleeve but some days you win sometimes you lose. We'll see what happens, the Pendil could be the starting point.  We can't have a bad season as Boombawn has just won a 75,000GBP race - Dan Skelton, trainer.

quotes.race: Read Nicky Henderson's Exclusive Unibet Blog Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We had Boombawn ready for the Silver Trophy at Chepstow in the autumn, but the ground was unusually wet. I sent him home to his co-owners to give him a month to freshen up and he's been aching for this better ground, although I know it's not officially good ground. He's entitled to be progressive. He'll have Aintree, Ayr and Sandown on his agenda and we might even consider going over fences with him if the races suit - Dan Skelton, trainer

quotes.race: Huyton Asphalt Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We gave Boombawn a bit of a break and he ran really well the last day in what was a really competitive race. He's come on for that and he's done it really well here and shown a really resolute attitude. It could have been that he was just a bit of a weaker finisher in his younger days, but he seems really resolute now and we'll keep him going this summer. We could look at chasing in the autumn  - Tom Messenger, assistant trainer.

quotes.race: Racing TV Novices' Hurdle (Listed Race) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: This was always the early season target for Boombawm and he was really ready for today. We're trying to look after him as he could be a nice chaser next year, so we're not going to over-race him. We ran him in a few handicaps last year to try and battle-harden him and it really paid off here. We'll see what the handicapper does with him. I didn't see Jamie drop the whip but Dan rang me from home and said that, so I don't know if that made a difference. We were pleased with our horse's attitude, as last season he might not have fought like that - Tom Messenger, assistant trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He won the Rising Stars Novices' Chase at Wincanton on Saturday, putting up a good performance in what looked like a grown-up race. They went a real strong gallop, he came off it well and jumped nicely throughout. He's good when he's fresh and has that good ground. I'm not sure what we do next, but I'd say the Pendil in the spring and other similar races would come on to the agenda, although when the ground goes he'll have to have a break. 12-11-24

runners.name: Le Patron
runners.breeder: S C E A Ecurie Domaine De Baune Et Al
runners.comment: Won Grade 1 novice here in December 2023 but needs to be better than ever today
runners.spotlight: Won the Grade 1 Henry VIII Novices' Chase here (1m7f, heavy) in December 2023 and comfortably won handicap at Newbury (2m4f, good to soft) last November; the return to Sandown is an interesting angle but he's been well beaten the last twice and needs to be better than ever today; headgear applied.

quotes.race: Sri Lanka - The Wonder Of Asia Novices' Limited Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Le Patron got it all his own way out in front, but I'll be quite honest, I'm amazed he won as easily as he did as he won a bad race at Fontwell and the runner-up has since been beaten in a 0-100. Blow Your Wad is a decent horse and he had good form and Henri The Second was a Grade Two winner over hurdles, but he has done that very well. His greatest asset is his jumping and what a place to bring a horse that jumps like he does. He never got out of second gear really. It has exceeded my expectations what he has done. He has always been a horse that we liked but we nurtured him last season with a view to going chasing this season and it has been so far so good. You could look at the Scilly Isles back here in February. He doesn't have to make the running as well but as he had the experience over fences Jamie (Moore) wanted to keep it simple - Gary Moore, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He surprised how well he won on his chase debut at Fontwell but he backed it up next time out and then won his Grade 1 at Sandown. Hopefully he'll start at Ascot on Saturday in the 2m1f handicap chase but he'll improve for stepping up in trip this season. I know he won the Henry VIII last season but he's not a speed horse and hopefully he can find his feet over a bit further. It's going to be tough for him off his handicap mark but he's a big individual who has done well through the summer. 29-10-24

runners.name: Hitman
runners.breeder: Mme C Villaud Ameline & Mr Q Villaud
runners.comment: Hard to win with nowadays but frequently runs very well in defeat; each-way contender
runners.spotlight: Just one win from his last 20 starts and pulled up in the Grand National three weeks ago; below-par third in this 12 months ago; however, he frequently runs extremely well in defeat and has twice finishing second in Grade 1s here; each-way contender back down in trip if last time hasn't left a mark.

quotes.race: Get Daily Rewards With Betfair Graduation Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Hitman was a little bit keen and fresh at Aintree the other day and needed that run and we let him bowl along in front. He settled and galloped and jumped. For a six-year-old rated 160, we've been patient with him and he's run some really good races for a young horse and is just becoming the finished article now. He's got an entry for the King George and I'd say that's where we'll be heading. I might give him a couple of other entries, but I'd say the plan would be to go to the King George - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

quotes.race: Jewson St Helens Old Roan Limited Handicap Chase (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I'm delighted with Hitman. I tried to keep him covered up and getting a lead and everything went right apart from our head wasn't in front. I'm very happy but frustrated at the same time - Harry Cobden, jockey.

quotes.race: Marsh Chase (Registered As The Melling Chase) (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I've always held Hitman in high regard, he's just been a big, weak horse. He's a work in progress. That was probably a career-best run. He's needed a bit of time. He'll definitely step up in trip next season which will suit him. He got beat by a very good horse today - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

quotes.race: BetVictor Novices' Chase (For The Jacky Upton Trophy) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Hitman will go to Aintree now for the Manifesto Novices' Chase, although if it was testing he could drop back to two miles for the Maghull Novices' Chase; he won't go to Cheltenham, which I didn't want to do after a fall. He's still a big baby and the plan was a clear round today, which was beautiful. It's too soon for Cheltenham and that's perfect today so off to Aintree - Paul Nicholls, trainer

quotes.race: Planteur At Chapel Stud Henry VIII Novices' Chase (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I think the first and second are both very good horses. Hitman's inexperience may have caught him out down the back but I wouldn't be afraid to take the winner on again. I could also see our horse coming back here for the Scilly Isles - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: You have only to look at his record in recent seasons to see how hard he is to win with. It doesn't help that he's been troubled on and off with his breathing, and he had his fourth bout of surgery last winter. Despite his frustrating tally of one victory from 16 starts in the last three seasons, he's still capable of smart form and he came back at Aintree eight days ago to run another good race in the Old Roan. He suffered a bout of colic on the way home and spent the night in a veterinary hospital, but he's fine again now. I'll enter him in the Betfair Chase, although the trip would probably tax his stamina. Of course, he'd be up against it, but a horse like him will more than pay his way, picking up plenty of valuable place prize-money. 04-11-24

runners.name: Blueking Doroux

prev_owners.owner: Patrice Puyravaud, Arnaud Chaille-Chaille Et Al

runners.comment: Well beaten last time but the return to better ground is a likely plus; in with a chance
runners.spotlight: Below best the last twice (particularly last time) and finished held in fourth in this last year; however, today's race may not be as hot and the return to better ground is a likely plus; 1l runner-up to Lucky Place in good-ground Grade 2 at Ascot last November and now 6lb better off; chance.

quotes.race: Coral Hurdle (Grade 2) (Registered As The Ascot Hurdle) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We were hopeful of \Blueking D'Oroux today but we didn't know what he would do, so we haven't made any big plans. I think he has a bit of class, I really do. We were pretty disappointed with the first two runs and we couldn't think of anything else to do but give him a breathing op and it's transformed him. Everything he's done at home has just got better and better - he was hard to train last year but isn't anymore. It's hard to say because I was cheering so much, but it looked like he was just staying and staying, so whether we end up going three miles with him, we'll see. Typically it's a weaker division, so it might make sense. That's a pretty strong performance I'd say - Johnny de la Hey, owner.

quotes.race: Masterson Holdings Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Blueking D'Oroux is a nice horse. On ratings he was entitled to win and we had him ready for today. He has improved so much for last season's wind operation, as he was a disaster at the start of last season. The Greatwood Hurdle would have to be under serious consideration now. If not Johnny (de la Hey) likes having runners at Ascot so we could wait and take him there - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

quotes.race: Royal Ascot Racing Club Juvenile Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We were confident earlier in the season at Cheltenham in a Grade 2. Blueking D'Oroux did some great work before that but ran a stinker. He ran poorly after that as well. We gambled on a wind operation. It wasn't obvious that was the problem. I just think he's grown up a bit. To be honest, we thought he was badly handicapped off 127 but I didn't think he was a 50-1 shot. That was quite crazy. When you turn in like that, you're there to be picked off but he kept galloping, which was encouraging. I actually think he probably needs further. He's not Cyrname but that was decent enough - Johnny de la Hey, owner.

stable_tour.quote: I've trained countless good four-year-olds who have struggled in their second season over hurdles, but this is one who managed to buck the trend last season. On the back of a victory in the Grade 2 Coral Hurdle at Ascot we threw him in at the deep end by going for the Long Walk. It was a big ask for such a young horse, but he ran really well when fifth to Crambo. Unfortunately, his season was interrupted by a small setback and it wasn't until the final day that we got him back. The Grade 2 Select Hurdle at Sandown looked ideal and, although it was more like a Grade 1 thanks to a strong Irish challenge, he again shaped well behind Impaire Et Passe. We'll start off back at Ascot, first in the Coral Hurdle this month and then in the Long Walk. With another summer on his back I hope he can improve again, in which case we can start thinking of the Stayers' Hurdle. He has to show he truly gets three miles first, but now he's a year older he should do. 04-11-24

runners.name: Gwennie May Boy
runners.comment: Won Grade 2 at Haydock in February but tailed off in recent Grade 1 at Aintree
runners.spotlight: Posted handicap hat-trick at the end of last season and was better than ever when comfortably landing a Grade 2 at Haydock (3m, good to soft) this February; a case can be made on that form but he was tailed off in a Grade 1 at Aintree (3m, good) just three weeks ago and needs to bounce back.

quotes.race: WKD Rendlesham Hurdle (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Gwennie May Boy won at 80-1 on his debut at Bangor and has been fantastic ever since.There was talk of sticking to last year's plan of Uttoxeter and then Aintree, but we might have to start thinking about Cheltenham - Nick Clarke, owner's son.

quotes.race: William Hill Handicap Hurdle (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I genuinely thought West Balboa would win and I'm astounded by the improvement in this horse. Gwennie May Boy is only six years old and I've not had him all that long, and it's remarkable how much he has improved - Dan Skelton, trainer.

quotes.race: Bangor-On-Dee Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Gwennie May Boy travelled nicely and did it well in the end. He hasn't got much respect for his hurdles but he gets from A to B - Fergus Gillard, rider.

stable_tour.quote: He won three races last season, including two big ones at Uttoxeter and Aintree. A fast-run race is what he wants, and he just hasn't had that this season. The faster they go the better, and he'll probably run in the Rendlesham before the festival. 10-2-25

runners.name: Lucky Place
runners.breeder: E Aubree & Mrs J Goffin Van Aken
runners.owner: Mrs G Van Geest & M George
runners.comment: Soundly beaten in Stayers' Hurdle but could be a leading player back down in trip/grade
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced 6yo who has improved this season, with Grade 2 wins at Ascot (2m3f, good) and Cheltenham (2m4f, soft); soundly beaten in the Stayers' Hurdle at Cheltenham (3m, good to soft) last month, but drops back down in trip/grade today and he's a leading player if back to his best.

quotes.race: Dornan Engineering Relkeel Hurdle (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Lucky Place is an absolute terrier. He doesn't know when he's beat and galloped all the way to the line. I think we'll be stepping up in trip again because he saw out today's trip on soft ground. On spring ground in March, I think three miles [in the Stayers' Hurdle] is where we'll end up - Nico de Boinville, rider.

quotes.race: Howden Ascot Hurdle (Grade 2) (Registered As The Ascot Hurdle) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: That was plan B unfortunately. I'm not going to bang on about it but Lucky Place was meant to be going novice chasing but I couldn't see anywhere to go, so we brought him back into here instead. He jumps fences beautifully but maybe we'll keep that until next season now.  We're going to have to have a look if he stays three and whether he's a Stayers' horse. We could look at the Relkeel Hurdle on New Year's as a stepping stone - Nicky Henderson, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: A horse you have to love. He's very straightforward and has done nothing but improve. He was earmarked to go novice chasing, but through lack of opportunities I couldn't find anywhere to launch him ? among our big team of novice chasers queuing up for places at the start of the season ? so we switched him back to hurdles and he won two races. At Ascot over just shy of two and a half miles he was very good, and when we moved him up a little bit in trip for the Relkeel he was good again and very tough. He was looking like a stayer, but we resisted the temptation to find out because we'd have had to give him a hard race on Trials day, and luckily the horse he beat in the Relkeel [Gowel Road] went and won the Cleeve. So we know pretty much where we are in the British pecking order, and although we're unproven over three miles, we have to take that on trust, and maybe take the view he could even improve for the extra distance. He's in great form, and is one of those who could go away for a racecourse gallop at Kempton on the Tuesday a fortnight before the festival, which would do him the world of good. Yes, you'll have the likes of Teahupoo and Home By The Lee against you at Cheltenham, but we'll go there in a positive frame of mind. 16-2-25

runners.name: Kitzbuhel

prev_owners.owner: Mme M Juhen-Cypres, D S De Beauregard & Mme T De Beauregard

runners.comment: Only fifth in Liverpool Hurdle but could benefit from hood and shorter trip; major claims
runners.spotlight: Made it 2-2 for Willie Mullins in Grade 3 at Gowran Park (2m, soft) in February; 15l fifth when upped markedly in trip in Grade 1 Liverpool Hurdle (3m, good) three weeks ago, but this headstrong 5yo could benefit from today's first-time hood and drop back in trip; could play a major role.

quotes.race: Red Mills Trial Hurdle (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: I love the way Kitzbuhel jumped, he'd have no trouble going over fences. I loved the way he stayed on when it looked like the race was over when he was taken on by Sir Gerhard and he had to find again to take on the challenge of Break My Soul. It's the sign of a real good horse that he was able to pick up a second time. I'm probably looking at Liverpool more so than Cheltenham. With the timing of the race and the two and a half miles for the Liverpool Hurdle, Aintree would be a big possibility. I think he'd love to step up in trip and I'd have no problem going three miles - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Members Club 2025 Hurdle
quotes.quote: He was very professional. I think Kitzbuhel will stay further, he surprised me the way he quickened into the straight - Paul Townend, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.name: Salver
runners.comment: Running creditably this season; could be in the mix if handling the forecast good ground
runners.spotlight: 5yo who has been running creditably in defeat this season and was in the mix in the Grade 2 Relkeel Hurdle at Cheltenham (2m4f, soft) in January when falling at the final flight; effective on good to soft (unproven on good); could be in the mix if handling conditions.

quotes.race: Virgin Bet Victor Ludorum Juvenile Hurdle (Go North Grey Bomber Series Qualifier) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Salver has done it nicely, it was a case of he's done what he had to do. It's proper heavy ground out there and he goes on it and copes with the conditions. Cheltenham will be ground dependent - I think he'll only be going there if it's soft or worse than soft. If it's a good ground Triumph, I can't see him running there. He's a nice horse - Josh Moore, assistant trainer.

quotes.race: Coral Finale Juvenile Hurdle (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Salver loves soft ground and enjoyed the conditions, whereas the rest probably didn't. He has already done more than I expected and he isn't just going to be a juvenile, either, because he is a big horse and can only improve. His jumping today was unbelievable as well. He was gaining lengths at every hurdle. I'll have to think about a better race now and we might have to look at the Triumph Hurdle, but if it came up quick at Cheltenham we wouldn't have to run him. We could wait for Aintree or just put him away - Gary Moore, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He had a fantastic season as a juvenile, winning four on the bounce and finishing third in the Triumph. It's going to be a hard season for him because he's a big horse who is still filling into himself and it was surprising just how well he did as a juvenile for a horse with his size. We won't be too hard on him this term because ultimately he'll be a three-mile chaser. Something like the Relkeel at Cheltenham on New Year's Day might be his sort of level. He'll stay very well. 29-10-24

runners.name: Take No Chances
runners.comment: Third in Grade 1 mares' hurdles the last twice; needs a career-best now taking on males
runners.spotlight: Won Grade 2 mares' hurdle at Ascot (1m7f, good) in January and she's been a creditable third to easy winner Lossiemouth at Cheltenham (2m4f, good to soft) and Aintree (2m4f, good to soft) the last twice; could give another good account now against males but a career-best is required.

quotes.race: BetMGM Mares' Hurdle (Grade 2) (Registered As The Warfield Mares' Hurdle) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I thought I was flat out at the home turn but Dan and Harry [Skelton] said Take No Chances would stay really well and to keep after her. I saw Paul Townend's head come upsides me and I thought I might just be in trouble. I suppose he didn't have race fitness on his side and we did - Kielan Woods, jockey.

quotes.race: bet365 Mares' Hurdle (Listed Race) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We dropped back in trip like we did with Molly Ollys Wishes and she's a similar type of horse. Take No Chances has a fabulous attitude and jumps very slickly. I'm going to be adventurous and put her in the Fighting Fifth, just in case Constitution Hill frightens everybody off. There's a few quid on offer and she'll be getting weight. We won't be beating Constitution Hill but we might turn up for a few pennies on offer. She's improving and when mares get confidence they do even more for you - Dan Skelton, trainer.

quotes.race: Download The Rhino.Bet App Mares' Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Take No Chances had some really good bumper form without winning, but we have always liked her a lot. We were relatively confident coming here. I'm sure Dan has got something in mind for her. I should think if she goes in again in another race like this then she would be stepped up in class. I do think she is up there with our better mares - Bridget Andrews, stable spokeswoman.

stable_tour.quote: She's had a fantastic season and put up a great performance to beat Kargese at Ascot last time. She's in flying form and is versatile between two and three miles, so she's a likely runner in the Mares' Hurdle.  10-2-25

1:50.race_name: bet365 Josh Gifford Novices' Handicap Chase (GBB Race)

runners.name: Mark Of Gold
runners.comment: Solid most of this term; put firmly in his place in Grade 1s; this also needs career best
runners.spotlight: Last season over hurdles ended on a low note at this meeting; solid for most of this term, switched to fences for last five starts and winning twice in small fields; put firmly in his place in Grade 1 novice events over 2m4f here in February and particularly at Aintree last time, but this return to a handicap will also demand a career best.

quotes.race: Howden Noel Novices' Chase (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Mark Of Gold is a good horse and we were quite confident coming here. It's a big thing to do first time over fences as Ascot is a tricky track to jump round, but it was a small field and it was like running in a normal novice chase. You used to be able to get them, but you can't get them anymore and you'd rather start him and give him a good experience. He's done that and picked up a big prize. The aim was to go to Plumpton on January 5, but I'm not sure we'll do that now. We could still do it, but we'll have to seriously consider him over fences now as he took to them so well - Josh Moore, joint-trainer.

quotes.race: Coral Racing Club Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: I schooled Mark Of Gold yesterday and he was fresh and well, so I was confident he'd run well today. He jumped and travelled well and had the turn of foot to put it to bed. I think a smaller field suits him as he's the type of horse who doesn't like to be crowded. We were disappointed he fell in the Lanzarote last time because we thought he'd have gone close - Caoilin Quinn, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: It was great to see him win the same race at Kempton in February for the second year running and he ran well on the Flat at Goodwood this month. He'll start off on the handicap hurdle route again but we'll probably school him over fences at some stage and that might give him more options, depending how it goes. 29-10-24

runners.name: Insurrection
runners.comment: Emphatic win at Musselburgh; 25-1, not disgraced in mid-division at Cheltenham Festival
runners.spotlight: Two disappointing runs before he resumed improvement with an emphatic win at Musselburgh (2m4f) in February, for which he's 7lb higher today; not disgraced when 25-1 in mid-division at the Cheltenham Festival (near 2m5f, also on good to soft) and good ground should be fine; not dismissed.

quotes.race: Betway Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We've won this with some nice horses and Insurrection looked really good. We've always thought a lot of him. He had a breathing op and we wanted to see him go and do that today. He bowled along in front and sprinted from the last. We could go down a similar route to Tahmuras and end up in what was the Tolworth. He's a talented horse - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: I have quite high hopes for this former Irish point-to-point winner as a novice chaser, and he ran a race full of promise first time up when narrowly beaten at Chepstow last month, by a horse who was rated 15lb higher than him over hurdles. He wouldn't have wanted the ground any softer and, like most of ours at that meeting, he needed the run, so he's sure to improve on that. He was Grade 2-placed as a novice hurdler and I hope he can reach Graded level over fences. We'll stick to our original plan and go for the Grade 2 Rising Stars at Wincanton on Saturday. 04-11-24

He probably ran the best out of all of Paul Nicholls' horses at Chepstow's opening meeting, so you have to take good heart from that. He ran well to be beaten by a much higher-rated horse [Springwell Bay] on his chase debut. He did well over hurdles last season and it was a lovely first run and he can only improve for that. We have a plan to potentially go for the Rising Stars Novices' Chase at Wincanton next month. He needs nice ground and probably won't want to be running in the depths of winter. He's an exciting novice chaser with plenty of improvement to come over fences. 24-10-24

runners.name: Bad
runners.comment: Won twice over an extended 2m4f at Kempton before pulled up over the big fences at Aintree
runners.spotlight: Ex-French 6yo, somewhat frustrating in Britain before the blinkers went on for last four starts and he won twice over an extended 2m4f at Kempton (good ground the first time); pulled up over the big fences at Aintree on latest, which can probably be forgiven and he's still on a competitive mark.

quotes.race: Virgin Bet Daily Extra Places Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Bad didn't miss a beat today, he's always been very economical with his jumping. He was very unfortunate to fall at Ascot when he was going very well, but today was deeper race than the last day. We went a good gallop from the start and it probably worked out better for him, because I had a lead for longer. Once I got upsides Tristan [Durrell on Flegamatik] coming down to the last, I didn't know how much my lad wanted it, but he had a good jump and I just held on. It was do or die at the last. If I missed it and Tristain winged it, he was going to win, and vice versa. That's what won it for us in the end but he has loads of ability. He's one of the yard favourites and a hell of a character at home, so for him to get his head in front twice now, it's brilliant. If he gets out of bed on the right side then he's got loads and loads in hand - the days he doesn't want to do it then he won't - Ben Jones, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: We haven't been hard on him, so knew he'd need the run at Ascot on Saturday, when he finished third. We wanted a feel for where we are with him and we got that. He's a promising horse who will improve, and I'd love to work towards the Betfair Hurdle. He'd need to go up in the handicap a bit, but that's easily possible. 10-11-23

quotes.race: Matt Hampson Foundation Silver Trophy Handicap Chase (Grade 2) (A Limited Handicap) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I always had this race in mind and, in current times, I thought we'd better run again. It's worked out really well. Riskintheground will run on the last day of the season at Sandown - Dan Skelton, trainer.

quotes.race: Hillhouse Quarry Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Riskintherground was always going to improve for going chasing and he has done this season. We're delighted with him, he went through the race nicely and enjoyed the ground. He's entered next week at Cheltenham and that's possible or he could run at Sandown on the last day of the season - Dan Skelton, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He ran well in the Badger Beer Chase on Saturday, but they went so fast and he didn't quite stay out the trip. He's getting plenty of experience, though, and I think he'll continue to pay his way, with an eye to one of the bigger prizes in the late spring or summer. 12-11-24

runners.name: Mahons Glory
runners.owner: C Nightingale & Hold My Beer Partnership
runners.comment: New stable for last two starts and won them both, from the front in small-field handicaps
runners.spotlight: New stable for last two starts and he won them both, from the front in small-field handicaps over an extended 2m6f at Leicester (good to soft) and Stratford (good); hit a new high last time, doing it comfortably off 3lb lower than today, and he's on a roll but this race is much more competitive.

quotes.race: Green Diamond Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Mahons Glory is great, isn't he? He gets in a rhythm out in front from fence to fence and is such a nice horse to ride. I thought with the two fences being dolled off it might cost us a bit, but he travels out on his own and loves it. It rode slow enough on the chase course, which helped. He seems to have lumped 12st round there nicely, so hopefully Dylan can find an opportunity somewhere to try and pick up a nice prize - Lee Edwards, jockey, speaking on Racing TV.

quotes.race: Betting And Gaming Council Novices' Limited Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: You wouldn't say Mahons Glory was sour, but he needed a change of scenery, so we said we'd give it a go. Lee [Edwards, jockey] schooled him a few weeks ago and was very confident that he'd run well - Dylan Cunha, trainer.

quotes.race: Ladbrokes Get Best Odds Guaranteed Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: It didn't go to plan the last day but Mahons Glory still ran a cracker. We came here knowing he was in super form and the last day just knocked some of the gas out of him as he was very fresh. We've changed a few things like putting a new bit in his mouth for today and I think he'll have a future over fences. I think he's a graded horse and I'm not sure the three mile hurdling division is that deep and he'd be rated high enough to be thinking about those sorts of races - Patrick Neville, trainer.

quotes.race: Jewson Birkenhead, Price Street Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We didn't really expect it because we thought Mahons Glory would need it, like lots of mine who are needing the run. There are a few quirks in there but he's got a lot of ability. He's not the easiest horse to keep sound, and that's the challenge, but he's definitely got an engine. I think we'll look for a novice with a penalty somewhere - Dr Richard Newland, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's had a couple of little issues, but we've sorted them out now and he seems to be in great form. We put him over fences and he was second on his first run. Then we took him to Perth and he got a bit worked up. He's settling better now and we've freshened him up, and he might go back to Kempton on Boxing Day for the handicap hurdle he won last year. Otherwise, he might have an option over fences. He's got loads of ability if we can get his head right. 11-12-24

runners.name: Pic Roc
runners.comment: Major downturn at the big Cheltenham and Ayr meetings last two starts; headgear enlisted
runners.spotlight: Six seconds and one win, from 13 races; one of the seconds was over hurdles on this card (good) last year and he showed his best form with two more on soft ground over fences this winter; major downturn at the big Cheltenham and Ayr meetings on last two starts, however, which sees headgear enlisted.

quotes.race: European Breeders' Fund Betfair 'National Hunt' Novices' Handicap Hurdle Final (Premier H'cap) (GBB)
quotes.quote: Pic Roc ran a mighty race in second. He probably got a bit lonely out in front after doing plenty and got nabbed on the line, but they've both run really well - Ben Pauling, trainer.

quotes.race: Ascot Shop Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Without a shadow of a doubt this would be the best bunch of novice hurdlers I've ever had. There's seven or eight which are better than anything I've ever had in the last three years. Pic Roc is a nice horse and I've always thought plenty of him. He'll be a proper staying chaser next year - Ben Pauling, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He could go for the National Hunt Chase, but it's perhaps more likely he'll run in the Jack Richards. He met with a setback after he fell at Carlisle, and we knew he was going to need it at Exeter. He then ran a lovely race at Newbury. He stays three miles and has the pace for two and a half, so I think he's going to be quite exciting. 17-2-25

runners.name: Inedit Star

prev_owners.owner: Dominique Vigneron, Nicolas Paysan Et Al

runners.comment: Rallying 3rd under Tom Broughton at Aintree (2m) latest; may be worth a second go at 2m4f
runners.spotlight: Has raced only on softer than good; 2m3f hurdle winner in France in May 2023; minor honours in six of seven British starts, the exception when he bled here on penultimate outing; rallying third of 14 under Tom Broughton at Aintree (2m) latest and may now be worth this second attempt at about 2m4f.

runners.name: Eyed
runners.comment: Highly progressive for new yard this term; back down in trip but still a leading contender
runners.spotlight: Highly progressive for new yard this season, winning three times and better form when runner-up on last two outings; his last six have been at about 2m6f-3m and it's also a while since he raced on good ground; also edging up the weights but he still looks a leading contender.

runners.name: Classic Anthem
runners.comment: 5lb rise may underestimate C&D win and he could also be open to further improvement
runners.spotlight: Solid record at Sandown was enhanced when he scored in good style over C&D (good) seven weeks ago, leading three out to get off the mark as a chaser at the fifth attempt; 5lb rise may underestimate that and he could also be open to further improvement; big shout.

runners.name: Bunting
runners.comment: Free-going sort; questions over the trip and how well handicapped he is, but Townend rides
runners.spotlight: Free-going sort and that seemed to cost him in the Coral Cup at Cheltenham (2m5f) on his only run beyond 2m1f; sixth of 12 in hot 2m race at Ayr two weeks ago was as good as any of his form, which showed that better is needed, but Paul Townend nevertheless takes the ride.

quotes.race: Aqua Process Solutions 3-Y-O Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Bunting is a nice horse, he did everything well and showed a lovely attitude. He jumped well, just had a little look over the last two, but he did it well - Sean O'Keeffe, rider.

stable_tour.quote: He goes novice chasing and has schooled well. I've been happy with him. He's a young horse who could have more to offer over fences. 25-11-24

runners.name: King Alexander
runners.comment: Safely held in two major handicaps since comfortable win at Fairyhouse (3m) on yard debut
runners.spotlight: Safely held in two major handicaps since winning comfortably on stable debut at Fairyhouse (3m, yielding to soft) in January; back in calmer waters and good ground should be fine, but there remains plenty to be proved off this sort of mark.

stable_tour.quote: I've plenty of time for this gelding, who had a constructive first season here, winning a bumper and twice over hurdles. He's been growing up physically and mentally all the time and could jump a fence, but I'd like to see what more he can do as a hurdler first. 30-10-23

runners.name: Push The Button
runners.comment: Creditable sixth in big-field handicaps at Cheltenham (2m4f) and Aintree (3m) festivals
runners.spotlight: Creditable sixth in big-field handicaps at the Cheltenham (extended 2m4f) and Aintree (3m) festivals on his last two outings; he needs to find extra, however, and this test may well be on the sharp side.

quotes.race: Olly Murphy Racing Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: To see your homebred win is just fantastic. I've bred some nice horses from his dam Tara Rose, but Push The Button is by far the best. He just keeps improving and has achieved plenty for a four-year-old - Jimmy Wenman, owner-breeder.

stable_tour.quote: He was a bit disappointing at Exeter recently after a great run at Windsor. We probably ran him too soon, but two and a half miles on the New track for the Martin Pipe will suit him well. 17-2-25

runners.name: Dr Eggman
runners.comment: Won Limerick maiden; 2nd in Cheltenham novice; this handicap debut demands more from him
runners.spotlight: Seventh attempt to get off the mark over hurdles when scoring in a big-field Limerick maiden (2m3f, soft) last month; creditable front-running second in novice at Cheltenham (2m4f, good) ten days ago and looks a reliable sort, but this handicap debut demands more from him.

stable_tour.quote: A Ballinrobe bumper winner who is still a maiden over hurdles. Maybe I should be heading straight over fences with him now, but I would like to win a maiden hurdle with him before I do. 25-11-24

runners.name: Electric Mason
runners.owner: Ktda Racing And Mrs Nicola Morris
runners.comment: Cut little ice on handicap debut at Cheltenham Festival but may still have potential
runners.spotlight: Maiden and novice winner as a hurdler; cut little ice on last month's handicap debut at the Cheltenham Festival (2m4f; 33-1 off 2lb higher) but seems versatile regarding ground and may still have potential.

stable_tour.quote: He'll go for the Martin Pipe. I've done it slightly differently with him than my usual way. The half-owner has horses with Gordon Elliott and all roads lead to Cheltenham with him - he's very much a modern-day owner. So we've got him, shall we say, pretty harshly handicapped, but he's taken it well. It wouldn't have been a very impressive run when he won at Fontwell last time, but he's a lazy type. I said to Freddie to win it by the bare minimum and he did well, winning by a length and half. He'll go in the Martin Pipe off a mark of 132 and I'm looking forward to it. He seems to go on any ground but, if I had to choose for him, good to soft would be perfect. 26-02-25

runners.name: Jump Allen
runners.comment: Won handicap debut at Naas (2m3f) and good second of five at Ayr (3m); promising
runners.spotlight: Picked up well to make a successful handicap debut at Naas (2m3f, soft) in March, justifying favouritism in 16-runner race; good second of five at Ayr (3m, good to soft) two weeks ago and this step back down in trip may help with further progress; promising.

runners.name: Ike Sport
runners.comment: Won this last year in good style off 4lb lower; never-nearer fifth of 20 at Aintree latest
runners.spotlight: Three wins last term, most notably in this race (good) and he did that in good style off 4lb lower than today; less reliable this season but never-nearer fifth of 20 at Aintree (2m4f; hooded first time) on latest start was a hint that he could be a player in this race for the second year running.

stable_tour.quote: He's in good form after winning a big handicap chase for us last time out. Like Any News, we won't be running him on the winter ground but the plan will be to have him back out again before the end of the season. He's done very little wrong for us and I think he can step up again. 27-11-23

He's solid and very consistent. He'll go chasing after May 1. There's nothing major jumping out for him at any of the festivals. He had a rating of 116 before he last ran. He's done very little wrong and it was a £70,000 race he won last time out. He's a six-year-old who jumps, stays and has a big heart, so now is the natural time to go chasing. He cost only £16,000. We could end up targeting him towards the Summer Plate or something similar. 06-03-24

runners.name: Peacenik
runners.comment: This new trip for handicap debut is interesting, notwithstanding the very different ground
runners.spotlight: Has run in two bumpers and four hurdle races, all on soft or heavy; won a novice at Exeter (2m) on New Year's Day and creditable places on both starts since, albeit put firmly in his place last time despite starting 4-7; this new trip for handicap debut is interesting and, notwithstanding the very different ground, he needs a second look.

runners.name: Mostly Sunny

prev_owners.owner: Desk Till Dawn And Wetumpka Racing

runners.comment: 6lb penalty but back in serious calculations after winning well at Plumpton on Monday
runners.spotlight: Had been languishing this season prior to winning a ten-runner novice handicap at Plumpton (extended 2m4f, good) on Monday, leading before the final flight and going nearly 5l clear; has 6lb penalty but firmly back in serious calculations.

quotes.race: Southern Cranes Novices' Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I didn't think Mostly Sunny would run badly at all, he just wanted a bit better spring ground. The step up in trip and cheekpieces, it all helped him that little bit. I love to see it, he's entered at Sandown and he'll be going there, that's penned in now - Dan Skelton, trainer.

runners.name: Got Grey
runners.breeder: S C E A Haras De Treli
runners.comment: Finished strongly from the rear for second of seven at Haydock (1m7f, good) one week ago
runners.spotlight: In good form last August/September, winning twice on good or firmer; tongue-tie returned when back near that level at Haydock (1m7f, good) one week ago, finishing strongly from the rear for second of seven; back up 3lb and needs a career-best, with a question to answer regarding stamina.

runners.name: Catherine Chroi
runners.breeder: Manister House, N Anderton & P Leonard
runners.comment: Nine-time winner, two creditable 6f runs in March, no match for an easy winner at Naas
runners.spotlight: Nine-time winner; well below best on last two Dundalk outings before returning to form with a long-priced fourth at the Curragh; no match for an easy winner at Naas, but had a few of these rivals behind, including subsequent winner Step Back In Time.

quotes.race: Virgin Bet Daily Extra Places Apprentice Handicap
quotes.quote: Catherine Chroi is a tough little filly and very consistent. She rarely runs a bad race so hopefully she can go out and win again at some point. It's harder to win in Ireland than it is here, but she enjoys being trained with us and we're picking the right type of races for her. She's thriving - Iain Jardine, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: She's thriving and I hope she can stay on an upward curve. She was rated 41 when she joined us and she's won six times and shot right up to 75. But I still think she can win off her new mark. She's getting stronger and ran well in a good race at Ayr last time, doing her best work at the end. The Bronze Cup at that venue could be a good target. She needs a wee bit of give in the ground and if there's no pace she has to go on herself. 26-07-24

runners.name: Mary Shoelaces
runners.comment: Ran well for a different 7lb claimer at the Curragh, this easier ground may not be ideal
runners.spotlight: Needed the run after a break when last of 11 at Dundalk in February; much more like it when running well for a different 7lb claimer at the Curragh two weeks ago; this easier ground may not be ideal

runners.name: Verified
runners.comment: Placed only once, needs to step up on the form he showed at Dundalk before a winter break
runners.spotlight: Placed only once from 11 outings; needs to step up on the form he showed at Dundalk before a winter break.

runners.name: Tawaazon
runners.comment: Eight wins to his name but none since 2023, has been out of form but ground will suit
runners.spotlight: Eight wins to his name but none since 2023; has been out of form but ground will suit.

runners.name: Aurora Nova
runners.comment: Recovered from a slow start to win over this trip on seasonal debut, slower ground here
runners.spotlight: Won over 6f at Fairyhouse last summer for which she got a big hike which anchored her in four subsequent starts; recovered from a slow start to win over this trip at Bellewstown on seasonal debut; slower ground might not bring out the best in her.

runners.name: Inishmot Prince
runners.comment: Nine of his 10 wins have come on AW, recent third at Dundalk shows he is in decent shape.
runners.spotlight: Nine of his 10 wins have come on AW; recent third at Dundalk shows he is in decent shape; 1-19 turf record is a negative.

quotes.race: Kilberry Handicap
quotes.quote: I would have been disappointed if Inishmot Prince had got beaten because of the form he was in at home. Since Bellewstown, he really came on very well. He is 21lb lower on grass than he is on all-weather, but he needed every yard of it! - Tom McCourt, trainer.

runners.name: Velvet Skies
runners.comment: Good effort over 6f on very soft ground at Naas before a disappointing display at Dundalk
runners.spotlight: Good effort over 6f on very soft ground at Naas before a disappointing display at Dundalk earlier this month; 1-18 turf record is concerning.

runners.name: Platino Bianco
runners.comment: Fair form in maidens last autumn, handicap form does not inspire any confidence
runners.spotlight: Fair form in maidens last autumn, including third over 6f at this venue; handicap form does not inspire any confidence, and lacks a recent run.

runners.name: Hero Of The Hour
runners.comment: Has produced two better displays since down the field behind Velvet Skies at Dundalk
runners.spotlight: Four AW wins; 2-13 on turf; not in the best form over the winter at Dundalk; has produced two better displays since down the field behind Velvet Skies on AW.

quotes.race: Join Us On Instagram @dundalk_stadium Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: What could go wrong did go wrong but Hero Of The Hour still won - Chris Hayes, jockey, speaking on RTV.

runners.name: Distillate
runners.owner: Mark Devlin & Nigel Ohare & Philip Smith

prev_owners.owner: N O'Hare/G Devlin/J McCrory/Kabin Racing Syndicate
Nigel O'Hare/Gary Devlin/Joseph McCrory/Kabin Racing Synd

runners.comment: Not easy to win with (5-59) but placed 11 times, recent Curragh fifth was encouraging
runners.spotlight: Not easy to win with (5-59) but placed 11 times, recent Curragh fifth was encouraging; 0-7 at this venue, second to Step Back In Time here in 2023.

quotes.race: Starman At Tally-Ho Handicap
quotes.quote: Distillate has improved all the time. Hopefully the handicapper won't be too hard on her and she should be a good fun filly. We'll probably go back to Dundalk for the winter - Ado McGuinness, trainer

runners.name: La La Lucrative
runners.comment: Won over 6f on heavy on his final start in Britain; well below best in two Irish starts
runners.spotlight: Won over 6f on heavy on his final start in Britain; well below best in two Irish starts; in rear in 6f Curragh event in which Distillate was fifth.

stable_tour.quote: He's taken some time to come together mentally. He's a bit of a sensitive soul. He ran three times last year, finishing third twice in small fields. We started him back at 5f this year at Beverley, where he was still learning, and have stepped him up to 6f for his next run, which will be at Catterick on Thursday. 23-05-24

runners.name: Shes Smart

prev_owners.owner: John Abbey, Jimmy Fairhurst & Emma Evans
John Abbey, Jimmy Fairhurst & Emma Evans

runners.comment: Looked unsuited by the Bellewstown track when fifth behind Aurora Nova, best on good going
runners.spotlight: Looked unsuited by the Bellewstown track when fifth behind Aurora Nova on return from a break; finished behind Beano Power and My Girl Sioux at Dundalk; seems best on good going.

runners.name: Green Valentine
runners.comment: Final run last season may have come too soon after a promising second at Cork
runners.spotlight: Final run last season may have come too soon after a promising second at Cork; relatively unexposed filly is one for the shortlist

runners.name: My Girl Sioux
runners.comment: Has been running consistently at Dundalk, 0-18 turf record is a concern, stable in
runners.spotlight: Has been running consistently at Dundalk; 0-18 turf record is a concern and she needs to reverse recent Dundalk form with Beano Power; stable in form.

runners.name: An Laochmor
runners.comment: Fair handicap debut over 7f at Dundalk, tailed off over 1m at Leopardstown, up against it
runners.spotlight: Fair handicap debut over 7f at Dundalk; tailed off over 1m at Leopardstown; visored now, up against it.

runners.name: Beano Power
runners.comment: Went very close at Dundalk last time, has run well over C&D on soft, each-way chance
runners.spotlight: Went very close at Dundalk last time and has a slight edge over My Girl Sioux on that running; has run well over C&D on soft, each-way chance with the capable Sorcha Woods taking off 7lb.

runners.name: Step Back In Time
runners.comment: 6f course winner on good ground earlier in the month, has also won on yielding ground here
runners.spotlight: 6f course winner on good ground earlier in the month; also won here in November 2023 (beating today's rival Distillate), the ground was yielding then.

quotes.race: Simonstown Handicap
quotes.quote: Step Back In Time got away with it today over the stiff five, she probably wants six. She ground it out really well. She has not been running badly and came out of the Cork race very well - Chris Timmons, trainer.

runners.name: Shoebox King
runners.comment: 2-33 on turf, not one of his better efforts at Bellewstown, C&D winner on soft
runners.spotlight: 2-33 on turf; not one of his better efforts at Bellewstown on his seasonal debut; should be sharper now and has the merit of being a C&D winner on soft.

quotes.race: Cusack Hotel Group Handicap
quotes.quote: It's hard in Ireland in those lower grades as there are a lot of horses with not much between them. I think he's genuine enough. We'll probably put Shoebox King in the August Sale now. I think he's done his job here and he'd be a good horse for England - Kevin Coleman, trainer.

runners.name: Pradas World
runners.comment: Outran 100-1 odds when third over 7f on handicap debut last October, 5f may be inadequate
runners.spotlight: Soundly beaten in three maiden; outran 100-1 odds when third over 7f on handicap debut at Galway last October; 5f may be inadequate but of some interest here with her new trainer putting up a good 7lb claimer.

runners.name: Far At Sea
runners.comment: Reserve, in rear at Dundalk in her first handicap, 10lb out of the handicap
runners.spotlight: Weak form at two; in rear at Dundalk in her first handicap, no apparent chance from 10lb out of the handicap; reserve.

runners.name: Balance Of Trade
runners.comment: Cheap yearling purchase, dam out of a winning sister to 5f Group 2 winner Divine Danse
runners.spotlight: E1,000 yearling; fifth foal; dam placed 7f 2yo, half-sister to two winners, out of a winning sister to 5f Group 2 winner Divine Danse.

runners.name: Canon Law
runners.comment: Half-brother to Listed winner Ship Of Dreams and two other winners, dam well related
runners.spotlight: E10,000 vendor as a yearling; eighth foal; half-brother to Listed winner Ship Of Dreams, and two other winners; dam unraced half-sister to dam of 1m4f Group 1 winner Shirocco.

runners.name: Charles Darwin

prev_owners.owner: Westerberg, Mrs J Magnier, M Tabor, D Smith

runners.comment: Brother to brilliant juvenile Blackbeard, should be better for Curragh experience
runners.spotlight: No Nay Never brother to three winners, notably Group 1 juvenile winner Blackbeard; improvement on the cards from debut over 5f at the Curragh, got outpaced late and just lost third.

runners.name: Clarity Of Thought
runners.comment: 160,000 gns yearling, half-brother to three winners best at 1m to 1m4f
runners.spotlight: 50,000gns foal, 160,000 gns yearling; fifth foal; half-brother to three winners, best at 1m to 1m4f; dam 1m juvenile Listed winner on heavy ground, half-sister to US 1m Grade 3 winner Thewayiam.

runners.name: Cliadh Dubh
runners.comment: Slowly away when last of six at Dundalk 15 days ago, unlikely to feature
runners.spotlight: Slowly away when last of six at Dundalk 15 days ago, unlikely to feature.

runners.name: Echo Of Faith
runners.comment: Half-brother to Listed winner Sakti dam 7f 2yo winner, has been gelded already
