runners.spotlight: E55,000 foal; fourth foal; half-brother to Listed winner Sakti; dam 7f 2yo winner, out of once-raced sister to Flat/hurdle winner Via Galilei, family of National Stakes/Dewhurst winner Teofilo; gelded.

runners.name: Estoublon
runners.comment: Dam 1m4f winner, sister to Group 2 winner Leo De Fury/half-sister to top-class Luxembourg
runners.spotlight: E160,000 yearling; first foal; dam 1m4f winner, sister to middle-distanceGroup 2 winner Leo De Fury, half-sister to 1m2f-1m4f Group 1 winner Luxembourg.

runners.name: Harmani
runners.comment: E50,000 foal, sixth foal; half-brother to three winners, dam 1m4f AW winners
runners.spotlight: E50,000 foal; sixth foal; half-brother to winners Sign From Above (Flat/hurdle), Floating Voter (7f AW) and I Am Thunder (Qatar); dam 1m4f AW winner, half-sister to 1m4f Listed winner My Renee.

runners.name: Ipanema Beach
runners.owner: Westerberg, Mrs J Magnier, M Tabor, D Smith
runners.comment: Siyouni colt is half-brother to Australian 1m winner Maximum Dividend, dam Group 3 winner
runners.spotlight: Siyouni colt is half-brother to Australian 1m winner Maximum Dividend; dam Group 3 winner, sister to a middle-distance winner First Officer, out of close relative of Grade 1 winner Court Vision; likely to need further.

runners.name: Nakamura
runners.comment: 33-1, apprentice-ridden, last of ten at the Curragh two weeks ago. safe to rule out.
runners.spotlight: 33-1, apprentice-ridden, last of ten at the Curragh two weeks ago; safe to rule out.

runners.name: Swinging The World
runners.comment: Stable had a good winner of the Curragh maiden in which Charles Darwin was fourth
runners.spotlight: First foal; dam hurdle winner, half-sister to hurdle winner Nemean Lion; stable had a good winner of the Curragh maiden in which Charles Darwin was fourth.

runners.name: Smart Sioux
runners.comment: 40-1 first time out at the Curragh, well held by Charles Darwin who was 6l in front of her
runners.spotlight: 40-1 first time out at the Curragh; well held by Charles Darwin who was 6l in front of her.

2:50.race_name: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Committed Stakes (Listed Race)

runners.name: Whistlejacket
runners.owner: P M Brant & Mrs J Magnier & M Tabor & Derrick Smith

prev_owners.owner: P M Brant & Mrs J Magnier & M Tabor & Derrick Smith
D Smith & Mrs J Magnier & M Tabor & Peter M Brant

runners.comment: Prix Morny winner, second in Phoenix Stakes/Middle Park, handles an ease, can defy penalty
runners.spotlight: Three wins from eight starts at two; out of the first three only twice, in top company both times, fourth of 13 in the Norfolk Stakes, and fifth of 12 behind Magnum Force in the Breeders' Cup Juvenile Sprint; has a Group 1 penalty for his Prix Morny win, status as a top juvenile underlined by Phoenix Stakes/Middle Park seconds; handles an ease, should be hard to beat.

quotes.race: Juddmonte Middle Park Stakes (Group 1) (Colts)
quotes.quote: Whistlejacket has run a decent race but Ryan [Moore, jockey] said he thought he could have done with a stronger pace. He was a bit slow out of the gates and took a lead whereas he likes things his own way - Aidan O'Brien, trainer

quotes.race: Sumbe Prix Morny (Group 1) (2yo Colts & Fillies) (Straight Course) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Whistlejacket is a very fast horse. He's very quick. At the Curragh, it didn't set up perfectly for him but because he's so fast and precocious we thought he could do both races. It's hard for a horse to do both, especially when they're only a week apart, but speed is his big thing really  He's a five and six furlong horse. He's very quick so I'd say it's the Middle Park for him and then go from there with the Breeders' Cup as an aim as well - Aidan O'Brien, trainer.

quotes.race: Kingdom Of Bahrain July Stakes (Group 2) (Colts & Geldings)
quotes.quote: Whistlejacket is obviously still a bit raw and is still learning. It was a good performance - he has given away a bit of ground in the last furlong and gone a long way ahead. He is a fast horse and I think there is a bit more in there which gives us hope for the rest of the year - Ryan Moore, rider.

quotes.race: GAIN First Flier Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Whistlejacket is one we thought would win first time but we are very happy with that. He could go five or six, he has plenty of speed. He will probably got straight to Ascot - Aidan O'Brien, trainer

stable_tour.quote: He's already a Group 1-winning sprinter, having won the Prix Morny last season. He was very consistent and is in good shape. He's a very fast horse and we think six furlongs is his trip. 07-04-25

runners.name: Cowardofthecounty
runners.comment: Beat Whistlejacket on debut, the Balllydoyle runner has a much stronger profile now
runners.spotlight: Won 7f Group 3 at Deauville last August on good ground; fifth in the National Stakes; ended the season on a low note when last of nine in the Prix Jean-Luc Legardere; debut maiden win was achieved at the main expense of Whistlejacket over 6f in testing conditions over 6f at the Curragh; however, the Balllydoyle runner has a much stronger profile now.

quotes.race: Prix Francois Boutin (Group 3) (2yo) (Straight Course) (Turf)
quotes.quote: The step up to seven furlongs suited and Cowardofthecounty feels like a nice horse with a good future - Ryan Moore, jockey.

quotes.race: Keadeen Hotel Irish EBF Maiden
quotes.quote: Cowardofthecounty looked like he could be a bit special at home but you're never really sure with a two-year-old until they go to the races. He's a particularly laidback horse and couldn't have been more impressive. He's big, well over 500 kilos, which for a two-year-old at this stage is a lot. He could go straight for the Coventry now. He's such a big horse I don't know if he needs to run again, we'll see - Joseph O'Brien, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: A Group 3 winner at Deauville last year over seven furlongs, he's going to make his reappearance in the Committed Stakes at Navan on Saturday. We're hoping he's en route to the Jersey Stakes at Royal Ascot. We think six to seven furlongs is his trip and he's done very well over the winter and is training nicely. 24-04-25

runners.name: Ides Of March
runners.comment: Needs to reverse Breeders' Cup form with Whistlejacket on ground that may not be ideal
runners.spotlight: Won a 6f maiden at the Curragh on third start; backed that up with a front-running success in a weak 6f Group 3 at the same venue; missed the Middle Park on account of soft ground; ran on late when seventh in the Breeders' Cup Juvenile Sprint; stablemate Whistlejacket is preferred on this ground and can uphold the form.

quotes.race: Heider Family Stables Round Tower Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: Ides Of March is powerful, fast horse. He finds it very easy to go quick. He travelled very easy through the race and he ran straight today. He looks like a Middle Park horse - Aidan O'Brien, trainer.

quotes.race: Revamp Conservation And Restoration Irish EBF Maiden
quotes.quote: Ides Of March could be a group sprinter. He's big, powerful and he's fast. He could go for the Middle Park and maybe have a run before that - Aidan O'Brien, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He was a Group 3 winner over six furlongs at the Curragh last season and he's on the Commonwealth Cup programme. He could have a run in one or two races beforehand and we'll take it from there. 07-04-25

runners.name: Bodhi Bear
runners.comment: Useful sort, C&D maiden winner, takes a huge rise in class after 5f Cork rated victory
runners.spotlight: C&D maiden winner last October on third and final juvenile start, making all; first two starts at two were over 7f, but he started the new campaign with a win in a 5f rated race at Cork; takes a massive rise in class now.

quotes.race: Buy Your Tickets Now For The Easter Festival Rated Race
quotes.quote: We'll see what the handicapper does with Bodhi Bear, there's a 3yo premier sprint handicap at Naas and another at the Curragh in June so maybe one of those. If he gets up too high in the handicap we may run him in one of those 3yo Listed races - Fozzy Stack, trainer, speaking to Racing TV.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Median Auction Maiden
quotes.quote: Bodhi Bear had two very good runs coming in here and he had his chance today. He stepped forward nicely in what felt like a strong maiden - Seamie Heffernan, rider.

runners.name: Midnight Strike
runners.comment: Ended the season on a low note at Redcar, has been gelded, stable's second string
runners.spotlight: Good effort when winning on debut over 5f at the Curragh (soft/heavy); close third in a 6f Group 3 on his second start; no impact in the Coventry or in a 7f Group 3 at Deauville, and ended the season on a low note at Redcar; has been gelded; stable's second string.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Race
quotes.quote: I thought Midnight Strike was a nice colt but didn't expect him to win like that. He looks an Ascot-type horse and he's another nice Starspangledbanner for the owners [Teme Valley]. We thought he'd stay six but was certainly quick enough to start at five. He looks very smart - Joseph O'Brien, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: The plan is to run him in the Coventry with Cowardofthecounty. He had a good run when third in the Marble Hill and has trained well since. He'll go there with an each-way chance. 12-06-24

runners.name: Pedro Nunes
runners.owner: Amo Racing Limited & Giselle De Aguiar
runners.comment: Debut winner over 7f at Dundalk, very tough task against those with top-level experience
runners.spotlight: Made a bright start to his career with a 7f maiden win at Dundalk early this month; should be fine with this trip but ground might not be ideal; very tough task against those with top-level experience.

runners.name: Sparkling Sea
runners.comment: Good early-season juvenile last year, low-key reappearance in a 7f Group 3 at Leopardstown
runners.spotlight: Made a winning debut in a 6f maiden at Naas last April; failed to confirm form with the runner-up Fairy Godmother (subsequent Albany Stakes winner) in a Group 3 over the same course and trip in May; did not appear again and made a low-key reappearance in a 7f Group 3 at Leopardstown.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Fillies Maiden (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: In her last couple of pieces of work Sparkling Sea is coming to hand. I'd say she's only going to get quicker with racing and I'd say you'll see a better filly on a nicer surface. She looks like a proper two-year-old, she's a good ball of a filly, and mentally she's very straightforward. Hopefully she can build on today and keep going forward - Colin Keane, jockey, speaking to Racing TV

3:25.race_name: Bar One Racing Vintage Crop Stakes (Listed Race)

runners.name: Kyprios

prev_owners.owner: Moyglare Stud Farm & Mrs John Magnier & Michael Tabor
Moyglare Stud Farm & Mrs John Magnier & Michael Tabor

runners.comment: Champion stayer bids for third win in this race in the last four years; the one to beat
runners.spotlight: Champion stayer of recent years attempts to win this for the third time in the last four years; unblemished record last season after winning reappearance here, six further wins including at the highest level in Ascot and Goodwood Cups, Irish St Leger and Prix Du Cadran; acts on any going; reportedly in good as form as ever and clearly the one to beat.

quotes.race: Qipco British Champions Long Distance Cup (Group 2) (British Champions Series)
quotes.quote: Kyprios didn't really have much of a race today, he only cantered around but it was the same after his last run in France. He lost no weight and ever since France he's been putting on weight again. He's just an unbelievably classy horse. He loves coming racing and is so laid back. We'll give him the winter off now and then he'll have his two trials [next year] before coming back here for the Gold Cup. That's what we're working towards - Aidan O'Brien, trainer.

quotes.race: Qatar Prix du Cadran (Group 1) (4yo+) (New & Grande Course) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Kyprios is incredible. Hopefully, if everything is well with him we'll head back to Ascot before giving him the winter off, and come back for the Gold Cup next year with the two preps before it again - Aidan O'Brien, trainer.

quotes.race: Comer Group International Irish St. Leger (Group 1)
quotes.quote: Kyprios is so special, he's a very, very special horse and every year he seems to be improving. That even looks to be his best again and Ryan said he won so easy. He doesn't have to run again this year; the way we approach every race is that we see how he is and have a chat and then see if we go again and he could run in an Arc. It's important to mind him, do the right thing for him, and let him tell us how he is - Aidan O'Brien, trainer.

quotes.race: Al Shaqab Goodwood Cup Stakes (Group 1) (British Champions Series)
quotes.quote: I thought there would be pace with Al Qareem, he's usually a free-going horse. It took him a while to get Gregory but I thought we would go along today. Kyprios stays well, so I was going to be forward anyway and it was all very smooth. The only thing that happened was we slipped on the top turn, and I was on the back foot then and dropped away from the horse I wanted to take me into the race. But he still got there with two to run, he was going very easily and was a little idle in front, but it's obviously a tremendous performance. He's been a great horse for a long time now and his record is incredible since we stepped him up in trip. When you ask him and when he picks up the bridle he's got pace. He saves a bit for himself really but when you get it out of him he's got proper speed. - Ryan Moore, jockey.

quotes.race: Gold Cup (Group 1) (British Champions Series)
quotes.quote: Ryan gave Kyprios an unbelievable ride. Incredible. It wasn't easy. The second horse passed him here last year, and the second horse came back at him. I could see Ryan biding his time, and he went there and went there. It's incredible, it's masterful stuff, really. It's not simple, it's incredible. An incredible horse and I'm so delighted for everybody. There's an unbelievable team around him that make it happen - Aidan O'Brien, trainer.

quotes.race: Saval Beg Levmoss Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: Kyprios is a lovely horse. When he gets there he just pulls up. He has plenty of speed left but he is just lazy. The plan was to have the two races and then go to Ascot, it's great to get him back - Aidan O'Brien, trainer.

quotes.race: SBK Vintage Crop Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Kyprios had been pleasing us. Wayne set a nice even pace on Queenstown, a lovely horse himself who just kept taking him there, so we couldn't be happier. When he gets there he doesn't do much but he travelled easily the whole way - Aidan O'Brien, trainer.

quotes.race: Qipco British Champions Long Distance Cup (Group 2) (British Champions Series)
quotes.quote: I'm delighted on how Kyprios has come back this season [from injury]. Obviously he made great progress from the Curragh and ran a great race today - Aidan O'Brien, trainer.

quotes.race: Qatar Prix du Cadran (Group 1) (4yo+) (New & Grande Course) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Kyprios is a great horse and it's a privilege to have him. He has an unbelievable capacity for covering any amount of distance. He obviously has an incredible heart and lungs. Ryan rode him handy all the way and his opponents just fell away as they turned into the straight and he got left there. That's what happened when he came up the straight. He lost a shoe halfway up the straight as well (off fore shoe), probably when he turned the way he did. Maybe that was a little bit of the reason, maybe it wasn't, but I think he was just left in front too long - Aidan O'Brien, trainer.

quotes.race: Comer Group International Irish St. Leger (Group 1)
quotes.quote: Kyprios is such a talented racehorse and such a pleasure to ride. He is a little bit lazy but there is so much there every time you ask him he will find a little bit more for you. He is a very special stayer. He broke well and then just wanted to follow for a bit. I didn't want the race being slowly run. The pace was nice and even and I was happy where I was. He started to take me coming down the hill and he was always going to keep finding then - Ryan Moore, rider

quotes.race: Al Shaqab Goodwood Cup Stakes (Group 1) (British Champions Series)
quotes.quote: Ryan gave him a beautiful ride. Kyprios is a horse who keeps plenty and is very lazy, but it's brilliant and I'm delighted. It was great they all came into the straight and Ryan had him in a beautiful position, while he's a horse who loves a fight. He's lazy and if you want him to stay in first gear, he'll stay in first gear. That's the way he is and always has been; he saves everything but is very professional. I'd say there's a lot more to come from him. He loves racing and is easy on himself. These races - the Gold Cup and Goodwood Cup - were planned out for him and the plan from here was the Irish St Leger. He's got a lot of class and quality and even though he ran two miles there and two and a half at Ascot, we would have had no problem starting him over a mile and a quarter next year. He has that pace, but you don't see it because he doesn't show it - unless you really want it - Aidan O'Brien, trainer.

quotes.race: Gold Cup (Group 1) (British Champions Series)
quotes.quote: It wasn't a nice race to ride. Kyprios stepped slow, which is unusual for him and I didn't like the spot we were in as we were going slow. They were getting an easy time up front and I had to move him to the outside - I don't like doing that. We got going and he's got there and Mojo Star has come to us and that's when he's clicked in, it was comfortable at the line. It wasn't a true test today but I'm glad he's come over here and won. There will be lots of good days with him. He was much the best - Ryan Moore, jockey.

quotes.race: Vintage Crop Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: We always thought Kyprios was going to be very nice but he went to Ascot last year and jumped out under the stalls before the start. He hasn't run since then. He looks a stayer with a bit of class. He relaxes and quickens and has done well since last year. If he was going for the Ascot Gold Cup, he could run in the Saval Beg at Leopardstown, but we'll see - Aidan O'Brien, trainer.

quotes.race: Blackwater Race
quotes.quote: Kyprios probably did well to win at two but it was great to get him a win and get some experience into him then. He's not too slow and I was happy with him today. He's right up there or just behind the best of them - Seamie Heffernan, rider.

stable_tour.quote: He's back and in great shape and the plan is to go back to Royal Ascot to try for a third Gold Cup with two runs beforehand. Then everything else can fall into line after that. Everything is very good with him at the moment. He's incredible, he just goes forward, plants himself in second gear and goes asleep. He's always been like that, even when he was a two-year-old. I remember when we took him to Newmarket for the Zetland Stakes, he went asleep and didn't wake up at all in the race. His personality is the same still and Ryan [Moore] rides him great. 07-04-25

runners.name: Dawn Rising

prev_owners.owner: Michael Tabor & Derrick Smith & Mrs John Magnier
Michael Tabor & Derrick Smith & Mrs John Magnier
Derrick Smith & Mrs John Magnier & Michael Tabor

runners.comment: Group 3 winner last autumn; poor comeback run and McMonagle now prefers Leinster
runners.spotlight: Versatile dual-purpose sort whose best flat performances came when winning Queen Alexandra in 2023 and Group 3 Loughbrown Stakes (Curragh) last November; never sighted on last month's seasonal return over inadequate trip in Naas Listed and McMonagle prefers Leinster.

quotes.race: Comer Group International Loughbrown Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: Dawn Rising came on the bridle with me from about halfway and he was loving it. I was able to mooch away down the centre in the straight. It took him a while to get to Gavin but he was finding plenty for me and I knew I was always going to get there - Dylan Browne McMonagle, rider

quotes.race: Queen Alexandra Stakes (Conditions Race)
quotes.quote: Joseph had Dawn Rising beautifully prepared for today. He has been jumping and won a graded race over jumps during the winter, and today he just got himself into a nice spot and I just gradually built along. I hadn't really asked him for everything and he was always finding plenty. Joseph's horses can do that - Ryan Moore, rider, speaking to ITV Racing.

quotes.race: John J. Galvin Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Dawn Rising learned a bit from Galway and came on plenty for the run. It was a good performance. He bumped into a good horse in Galway but came forward plenty. He's taken to hurdling well. We'll go down the novice route I'd imagine and see how we go - Frank Berry, racing manager to owner JP McManus.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Maiden
quotes.quote: He's a lovely, big, staying horse who had a very good run at the Curragh the last day. He was very idle in front and I know we won by 12 lengths, but you never know when there's something coming from behind you and the way he was rolling around, I just wanted to keep the revs up. He won with plenty in hand at the end. He looked at the stalls in the straight, they were pulled in and he copped them and ran out in the middle - Wayne Lordan, rider of Dawn Rising

stable_tour.quote: He won the Queen Alexandra two years ago and ran another good race in it when third last year. It makes sense to aim for the race again and he'll probably go to the Vintage Crop and the Saval Beg on the road like he did last year. 24-04-25
He had a nice run at Leopardstown in the Saval Beg and wasn't beaten far, so hopefully he'll run a nice race in the Queen Alexandra Stakes. 16-06-23

runners.name: Barnso
runners.comment: Progressive last year but faces stiffest task yet here
runners.spotlight: Progressive 3yo last year, winning Fairyhouse handicap and acquitted himself well when raised in class, notably close third in Leopardstown Listed over 1m6f; ran well over an inadequate trip at Dundalk in February and more expected back up in trip but big task on here.

runners.name: Leinster
runners.breeder: Al Shira'Aa Farms S A R L
runners.comment: Recent Curragh handicap winner with likely more to come; big ask though
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced 4yo won Down Royal maiden on seasonal return last May but not seen after being placed in Roscommon handicap until returning much improved last month when making all in 1m4f Curragh handicap on soft; quite likely more to come as he steps up further in trip but this looks a tough ask.

quotes.race: Tote.ie Handicap
quotes.quote: Leinster had a real nice run at Roscommon and had a setback so it was unfortunate he missed the rest of the season. Hopefully he can be a progressive stayer. He looked at Roscommon as if the trip was a bit short for him so we were looking forward to stepping him up and I don't think stamina will be any issue to him going forward. The form of the Roscommon race was strong and he handles soft ground well - Joseph O'Brien, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He improved for stepping up to a mile and a half at the Curragh last month, when winning a handicap in good style, and he could go for the Chester Cup or the Vintage Crop. He's hopefully going to be a progressive stayer this season. 24-04-25

runners.name: Poetic Sound
runners.comment: Narrowly beaten in C&D handicap early this month; can continue to improve
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced 4yo won last two starts last year over 1m4f in Roscommon maiden and Bellewstown handicap, reappearing with better effort again over C&D early this month, finding plenty for pressure from some way out when beaten a neck; upped in grade but looks the type to keep improving and could run well.

quotes.race: Kilsaran Race
quotes.quote: Poetic Sound is a gorgeous horse. He was lost halfway through at Roscommon last time but he travelled better today, so he's learning on the job. Hopefully we'll have one more run before we put him away and we'll look forward to next year with him. I'd say even a mile and six is his minimum trip. We could go to the November Handicap but we'll see if he's street smart enough for that - Ger Lyons, trainer, speaking on Racing TV.

quotes.race: District Speciality Coffee Apprentice Maiden
quotes.quote: Poetic Sound is a nice horse. He has plenty of ability but he is still very raw and green. Once I got rolling up the straight though I thought I would get there. Once the penny dropped he ran on well - James Ryan, rider.

runners.name: Sonnyboyliston
runners.comment: Former Irish St Leger winner; very lightly raced in recent years, hard to evaluate
runners.spotlight: Irish St Leger and Ebor winner in 2021 for Johnny Murtagh but absent since finishing second in Group 3 Riyadh contest in Saudi Arabia in February 2022 until never competitive sixth in Curragh amateur race last October, first start for current yard; hard what to make of him at this stage.

quotes.race: Comer Group International Irish St. Leger (Group 1)
quotes.quote: Sonnyboyliston never disappoints and I thought he did very well to win today. It looked like a proper race and he had a good position all the way. He comes off the bridle but I thought from two furlongs out Ben looked confident on him. He got in a battle but he never lacks in a battle - Johnny Murtagh, trainer.

quotes.race: Sky Bet Ebor Handicap (Heritage Handicap)
quotes.quote: The last time Sonnyboyliston ran here he ran very well. They went slow and he got outpaced but I loved the way he came home. Ronan Whelan said he would come on for the run, which gave us great confidence. The Melbourne Cup had been the next plan but I have him in the Irish St Leger and we'll have to seriously think about that first - Johnny Murtagh, trainer.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF "Northfields" Handicap (Premier Handicap)
quotes.quote: Sonnyboyliston was the horse I was most excited about this weekend. The cheekpieces helped him concentrate. He's a big baby and still learning, we might give him a run in a Listed race to see where he fits in - Johnny Murtagh, trainer.

quotes.race: Sentinel Ireland Equine Products Handicap
quotes.quote: He's progressing well. I thought he was a little bit unlucky at Navan the last time. Ben said he made his own bit of bad luck today as he wasn't travelling through the race. When he got him to the outside he stayed on well and got the trip well. I think it's a good trip for him at the minute but he might be a horse that gets a mile-and-a-half in time - Johnny Murtagh, trainer of Sonnyboyliston

quotes.race: It's Not Rocket Science With MansionBet Handicap
quotes.quote: He was good, jumped well and travelled well. He probably wants a bit further but did it well. He liked the ground and handled the track well. It was his first handicap and he was still a bit green, but he's a nice horse going forward. Johnny's [Murtagh] horses are flying so hopefully we can keep it going - Ben Coen, rider of Sonnyboyliston

runners.name: Bay Of Sanibel
runners.comment: Has come up short in stakes company before and again looks up against it here
runners.spotlight: Both wins have come over C&D, including off 77 last May; rating took a steep rise following two runs in France in the autumn and okay C&D comeback run early this month off revised mark; visor now replaces cheekpieces.

quotes.race: Cusack Hotel Group Family Fun Day July 13th Handicap
quotes.quote: Bay Of Sanibel was unlucky last time but she really ground it out here. The cheekpieces really helped her. We might try and find another handicap before we go into stakes company - Kate Harrington, assistant trainer.

quotes.race: Safer Gambling Navan Maiden
quotes.quote: Bay Of Sanibel was very green the first day at the Curragh, poor Nathan Crosse had to push her the whole way, but she was much better in the way she jumped and travelled this time. They picked her up at the Arqana Sales in December and she only came to us in June. She's only learning her job. You can see how big she is and she's going to be a gorgeous filly next year. We were going to wait for a 1m4f maiden at the Curragh next week but the ground is probably going to be heavy and the ground was going to be more suitable here. She is going to be a lovely staying filly next year and hopefully she can mix it in stakes company - Kate Harrington, assistant trainer.

stable_tour.quote: We ran her back at Navan and the ground was probably just a bit tight for her. She'll take her chance in the Vintage Crop Stakes at Navan on Saturday and it would be lovely to see her pick up black type. She has been covered by Mehmas and is in foal. 23-04-25

runners.name: Enfranchise

prev_owners.owner: Sheikh Hamdan bin Mohammed Al Maktoum

runners.comment: Naas comeback run augurs well; nice weight allowance, could sneak a place
runners.spotlight: Pick of eight flat wins came in Gowran Listed over this trip last May for Shark Hanlon; took his mark to a new high on seasonal return for current yard last month in finishing staying on second in Naas Listed over inadequate 1m2f; enjoys a nice weight allowance, could sneak a place.

quotes.race: BoyleSports Download Our App Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Enfranchise had a run here during the week and it made a big difference. I think she's very smart. I have her entered in the Ebor but she might not get in - Shark Hanlon, trainer.

quotes.race: Sky Bet Sunday Series Middle-Distance Handicap
quotes.quote: It's been in the back of our minds for a while to try Enfranchise over a mile and a half. She's often found herself a bit far back over a mile and a quarter. The extra couple of furlongs has suited her well and she's a likeable, consistent filly - Charlie Johnston, joint-trainer.

quotes.race: Play 4 To Win At Betway Handicap
quotes.quote: It's great she's come out six days after a career-best performance in the Winter Oaks last time, in which she was a little bit unlucky. I just had to be patient today and wait for the gaps but Enfranchise quickened up well. I won on her over a mile and she was doing her best work at the end. I thought this trip would suit and she could stay further - Andrew Breslin, jockey.

3:55.race_name: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Salsabil Stakes (Group 3) (Fillies)

runners.name: Barnavara
runners.comment: Comeback run last month disappointing; stamina concerns taking a big jump in distance here
runners.spotlight: Solid placed form at Pattern level last year, notably twice placed in Curragh Group contests at 7f; Leopardstown comeback run over the same trip last month was disappointing and now takes a marked step up in distance with stamina concerns on breeding.

quotes.race: Irish EBF Median Sires Series Maiden (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: Barnavara was good. We worked her on softish ground the other day and I was delighted with her. She will probably like better ground. We might go to Ascot for the Albany and she might have a run before then - Jessica Harrington, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: She was a very smart two-year-old. She won on her debut at the Curragh and held her form together very well in Group races. She was seventh in a Group 3 at Leopardstown at the end of March, but all of ours have been needing their first runs and she'll definitely improve for it. She's a great big, galloping filly and we're really looking forward to stepping her up to a mile and a quarter in the Salsabil Stakes at Navan on Saturday. 23-04-25

runners.name: Catalina Delcarpio
runners.comment: Impressive recent Leopardstown maiden winner; looks up to this step up in grade
runners.spotlight: Lope De Vega filly a 400,000gns yearling; third foal; half-sister to French 1m2f/1m3f Listed winner Grand Stars; dam unraced half-sister to winners High Heeled (1m4f Group 3) and Bella Estrella (1m Group 3) and to dam of Irish 1,000 Guineas winner Just The Judge; created good impression on recent Leopardstown fillies maiden debut over this trip, plenty green but travelling strongly and picking up nicely to go clear final furlong; looks up to this step up in grade.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Fillies Maiden
quotes.quote: Catalina Delcarpio is a nice filly. She was just ready to start and most of mine on debut can be green and she was, but I thought if we would have a first-time-out maiden winner this year it could be her. She trains very well and finds everything very easy, and I just thought she might have enough class to carry her through. I told the owner last week I was going to put her in the Epsom Oaks and then I said I wasn't going to as it was too soon in her development. I have the Irish Oaks in mind for her - Paddy Twomey, speaking on Racing TV.

runners.name: Ecstatic
runners.owner: Michael Tabor & Derrick Smith & Mrs John Magnier
runners.comment: Curragh second looks to be crying out for this trip and more improvement likely
runners.spotlight: Won Tipperary maiden on quick ground last summer but looked a bit exposed afterwards in Group company; nicely improved on recent seasonal return however in Park Express Stakes (Group 3) at the Curragh, coming home strongly into second over 1m; looks to be crying out for this trip and more improvement likely.

runners.name: Island Hopping
runners.owner: Michael Tabor & Derrick Smith & Mrs John Magnier
runners.comment: Plenty green at two; bred for this sort of trip and more; likely improver
runners.spotlight: Out of a sister to high-class fillies Magical and Rhododendron; still looked green when winning Gowran fillies' maiden in September and again when under 2l off stablemate Whirl in Group 3 at the Curragh following month; should appreciate this longer trip and likely improver.

quotes.race: Staffordstown Stud Stakes (Group 3) (Fillies)
quotes.quote: Ronan said he thought Island Hopping came home very well. She will get a mile and a quarter easily and she should be a Group filly for next year - Aidan O'Brien, trainer.

runners.name: J Ms Joy
runners.comment: Good attitude for Curragh maiden win over this trip; big jump in class now
runners.spotlight: Placed three times for Pat Martin and took a nice step forward on second start for the Cromwell yard when upped to today's trip in Curragh maiden last month, keen and making much of running (soft); big step up in class here though.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF 3yo Spring Series Median Auction Fillies Maiden
quotes.quote: J M's Joy surprised me as it wasn't the plan to make the running, she kind of ended up there. I thought she went a good gallop and I wasn't sure whether she'd see it out over the trip but she was gutsy. She was fit and had a couple of runs, while she handled the ground well. It's a nice pot to win - Gavin Cromwell, trainer.

runners.name: Medici Venus
runners.owner: Michael Tabor & Derrick Smith & Mrs John Magnier
runners.comment: Disappointing in handicap final 2yo start on soft; seemingly plenty to find
runners.spotlight: Showed a good attitude to get off the mark in a 1m Listowel maiden in September but disappointed following month under top-weight in nursery at Leopardstown on softer ground; seemingly plenty to find here.

runners.name: Spicy Margarita
runners.owner: Amo Racing Limited & Giselle De Aguiar
runners.comment: Much improved in Group 3 last time; tries 1m2f again but stamina concerns
runners.spotlight: Useful AW form and seemingly much improved when strong-finishing fourth (0.5l off Ecstatic) in Park Express Stakes (Group 3) at the Curragh earlier this month; tries 1m2f again but this is a stiff 1m2f so stamina concerns.

runners.name: Tarima
runners.breeder: His Highness The Aga Khan's Studs S C
runners.owner: Exors Of The Late H H Aga Khan
runners.comment: Leopardstown maiden winner should relish this longer trip; likely major player
runners.spotlight: Lope De Vega filly is three-parts sister to top-class mid-distance filly Tarnawa (Prix Vermeille, Prix de l'Opera, Breeders' Cup Turf), and half-sister to four-time Group 1 winner Tahiyra; dam 12f Listed winner; landed odds on debut last month under patient ride in 1m Leopardstown fillies maiden, never stronger than at the finish; expected to come on considerably for that, especially over this longer trip and likely major player.

quotes.race: "Look De Vega" At Ballylinch Stud Fillies Maiden
quotes.quote: That was a nice performance by Tarima and she'll learn a lot from it. Chris [Hayes, jockey] hadn't planned to sit quite so far back on her, but she just gets turned sideways when they came out of the stalls and he had to sit and do the right thing and ride her with confidence. She was a backward filly as a two-year-old and I didn't get to teach her that much - she was growing and developing. She's going to learn an awful lot from that race. I expect a lot of progress and hopefully she develops to be a stakes filly. I trained her two half-sisters to win seven Group Ones - Dermot Weld, trainer.

runners.name: Wemightakedlongway
runners.comment: Didn't entirely convince over this trip in Ballysax last month but claims on best form
runners.spotlight: Made most to win Cork fillies maiden last October before contesting Group 3 Leopardstown contests, solid level of form each time, although didn't entirely convince over this trip in Ballysax last month.

stable_tour.quote: We thought it was a real good run when fifth in the Ballysax on her return, and she'll go to either Chester or to Navan for the Salsabil on Saturday. Hopefully she can be a real smart filly for the year. 24-04-25

4:30.race_name: Irish Stallion Farms EBF 3yo Spring Series Median Auction Maiden

runners.name: Blackjack Hills
runners.comment: Out of half-sister to Fillies' Mile winner Lyric Of Light; newcomer best watched
runners.spotlight: Ribchester gelding a 3,000Euros yearling, resold for 6,000Euros; fourth foal; dam unplaced 8.5f/1m1f in France, sister to Fillies' Mile winner Lyric Of Light; newcomer best watched.

runners.name: Broadchurch
runners.comment: Down the field in maidens at the Curragh and Gowran; handicaps more likely his forte
runners.spotlight: Down the field in maidens at the Curragh and early this month at Gowran; handicaps more likely his forte.

runners.name: Cooleys Mist
runners.comment: Promising debut run earlier this month when slowly away and green; more likely now
runners.spotlight: Churchill colt was slowly away and ran green so wasn't at all disgraced in the circumstances when beaten little over 6l on debut earlier this month in good-class Leopardstown maiden over this trip; something to build on.

runners.name: Diamond Cross
runners.comment: Hooded for debut and best watched
runners.spotlight: Estidhkaar gelding is first foal of a placed half-sister to winners Harriet's Force (1m 2yo), Rahya Cass (6f 2yo) and It's Not It (1m3f), family of 1m2f Group 1/Grade 1 winner Storming Home; hooded for debut and best watched.

runners.name: Edelak
runners.breeder: His Highness The Aga Khan's Studs S C
runners.owner: Exors Of The Late H H Aga Khan
runners.comment: Mild recent C&D debut promise behind a better-fancied stablemate; may need a bit more time
runners.spotlight: Half-brother to winners Emiyn, Edessan and Edzel; dam 1m4f Group 3 winner, from the family of Gold Cup winners Enzeli and Estimate; slow to break, some late headway on debut early this month in C&D maiden won by better-fancied stablemate Dakota Blue; more expected of now with benefit of that experience but owner/yard has a more obvious one here in Reyenzi.

runners.name: Elusive Peace
runners.comment: Keane prefers Joe Cool so cheaply bought debutant probably best watched
runners.spotlight: Elusive Pimpernel gelding fetched only 1,000gns as a yearling; brother to winners Elusive Heights (1m; RPR 104) and Erratic Path (9.4f; 90), half-brother to winners Unterberg (10.6f/1m4f AW; 74) and Marmolata (7f; 69); dam 7f winner (inc 2yo/Group 3; 104); Keane prefers Joe Cool so debutant probably best watched.

runners.name: Jet Warrior
runners.comment: Saxon Warrior colt; cost 27,000gns as a foal; market best guide on debut
runners.spotlight: Saxon Warrior colt; cost 27,000gns as a foal; half-brother to four winners including Connemara Coast (7f-1m1f including 2yo/AW/HK; RPR 94) and Poppy's Boys (US 5f-8.5f turf including 2yo); unraced dam out of French Oaks/Moulin winner; market likely best guide on debut.

runners.name: Kevin The Great
runners.comment: Debutant looks the lesser likely of the Harrington pair
runners.spotlight: Saxon Warrior half-brother to winners Arqoob (1m-1m4f Flat inc AW, RPR 98; 2m hurdle), Chimney Rock (German 1m1f/1m3f; 96) and Dromantine (7f AW 2yo; 79); dam 6f/7f winner (inc AW; 96), half-sister to two Group 3 winners; debutant looks the lesser likely of the Harrington quartet.

runners.name: Minella Boss
runners.comment: Promise both 2yo starts and will be well suited by this step up in trip
runners.spotlight: Golden Horn gelding showed promise with staying on second behind a runaway winner at Galway (8.5f, yielding) in September and following month keen enough when third in Haydock novice on testing ground; will be well suited by middle-distances this year and one to consider.

runners.name: Nobler
runners.comment: Comeback C&D third puts him right in the mix but needs to settle better
runners.spotlight: Decent level of form at two when second in maidens at Listowel and Curragh and better form on seasonal return early this month over C&D, not quite getting home after racing keenly when caught for second late on by today's rival Vorfreude; will need to settle better but big player.

runners.name: Reyenzi
runners.breeder: H H The Aga Khan's Studs
runners.owner: Exors Of The Late H H Aga Khan
runners.comment: Eyecatching 2yo run; should stay 1m2f, major contender on return
runners.spotlight: Saxon Warrior colt; dam modest maiden half-sister to winners Raydara (7f 2yo Group 2), Rondonia (1m/1m2f) and Rayna (1m3f/1m4f); eyecatching 2yo debut in 7f Naas maiden in September, blowing the start and then making up considerable late ground to finish second; should stay 1m2f, major contender on return.

runners.name: Vorfreude
runners.comment: Rallied to deny Nobler of second in recent C&D maiden, pair major contenders again here
runners.spotlight: Couple of promising 2yo runs and took a step forward on seasonal return over C&D last month, rallying to deny Nobler of second after racing prominently; shouldn't be much between the pair again here.

runners.name: Wackestone
runners.comment: Okay form at two, needs to improve to feature here though
runners.spotlight: Won a barrier trial in July at Dundalk but two maiden runs leave him with a fair bit to find here.

runners.name: Winston Junior
runners.owner: Omega Racing & Monmouth Bay Racing Llc
runners.comment: Comeback Curragh run suggests he'll appreciate this step up in trip
runners.spotlight: Creditable form in Galway 2yo maiden and on last month's Curragh return when staying on over 1m; longer trip should suit and appears the pick of the Harrington runners.

runners.name: Bella Sheila
runners.comment: Australia filly likely the Harrington second-choice on debut
runners.spotlight: Australia filly is first foal of a 1m winner (RPR 77), herself a half-sister to US winners Breadman (1m/1m1f) and Princess Akris (1m/8.5f); likely the Harrington second-choice on debut.

runners.name: I Do Believe
runners.comment: Curragh debut fourth entitled to improve but still best watched
runners.spotlight: Make Believe kept on to finish a remote fourth on Curragh debut last month over this trip; entitled to improve but still best watched.

runners.name: Invigorated
runners.comment: Two recent maiden runs modest, will be more one for handicaps in due course
runners.spotlight: Two recent maiden runs modest, will be more one for handicaps in due course; yard have stronger contenders.

runners.name: Mystic Rose
runners.comment: Couple of poor efforts early last summer, can only be watched on return
runners.spotlight: Couple of poor efforts early last summer, can only be watched on return.

runners.name: North Winterfell
runners.comment: Placed on AW, ran poorly at Newbury on only turf start, perhaps worth market check
runners.spotlight: Placed over 1m4f on AW in Kempton maiden and Wolverhampton novice; ran poorly at Newbury on only turf start; has been gelded; worth a precautionary look in the market.

runners.name: Zipster
runners.comment: Leopardstown run encouraging, could go well if handling ground; reserve
runners.spotlight: Reserve; won at Yarmouth and Southwell last year for the Crisfords; nicely improved on second start for this yard when staying on well after slow start and having to be switched when only beaten 2l at Leopardstown last month; likes a sound surface, could go well if handling this ground.

runners.name: Abbey Actress
runners.owner: J P M Oconnor & Paul J Nolan & Nora Odonoghue

prev_owners.owner: J P M O'Connor & Paul J Nolan & Nora O'Donoghue

runners.name: Barrogstown Girl
runners.comment: Won three times for this rider last season, handled an ease on her final start, respected
runners.spotlight: Won three times for this rider last season; handled an ease when scoring over this trip on her final start, beating today's rival Gotta Catech'em All, respected.

quotes.race: Al Basti Equiworld Dubai Handicap (Div II)
quotes.quote: Barrogstown Girl battled very well in fairness to her. I was a little bit worried about her bouncing two days after her last run, and about the draw, but Neve said she was game out. She's a very honest little filly - Jarlath Fahey, trainer.

quotes.race: Panoramic Restaurant At Limerick Racecourse Apprentice Handicap
quotes.quote: Barrogstown Girl was racing lazy early and got a bit detached. I said to Neve to try and get her home over the trip and don't go after her until you get over the top of the hill. In fairness, she got her going in time and she came home nicely - Jarlath Fahey, trainer.

runners.name: Bringsty
runners.comment: Showed the benefit of a Dundalk win when scoring at Gowran, has to deal with 8lb rise
runners.spotlight: Showed the benefit of a Dundalk win when scoring at Gowran, his first success since May 2023 and fifth in all; has to deal with 8lb rise, same 7lb claimer rides.

quotes.race: Save 33% Buying Tickets Online Handicap
quotes.quote: Bringsty always jumps very well and he travelled very strongly into it. He took me everywhere and I did think I got there too soon but he kicked on again when I got stuck into him. He stayed well and I had a job pulling him up so a bit further or hurdles would be no harm to him either - Sam Coen, jockey.

quotes.race: Live Music After Racing Handicap
quotes.quote: Bringsty was only a five grand claim and he cost other people a lot more. Colin said it takes him a while to warm up to it and he surprised me with the way he knuckled down - James McAuley, trainer.

quotes.race: Tote Proudly Sponsoring Laytown Claiming Race
quotes.quote: Bringsty enjoyed it. He doesn't like being crowded and he warmed into it. He has had issues and he still has ability. He was genuine there - John McConnell, trainer.

runners.name: Thatwilldoso
runners.comment: Ended last term on a promising note, maintained progress with Gowran win, 11lb higher now
runners.spotlight: Left her handicap debut behind at Killarney when signing off last season with a narrow defeat at the Curragh; maintained progress with Gowran win on return; 11lb higher now, same 5lb claimer aboard.

runners.name: The Real Screamer
runners.comment: Back-to-back winner over Dundalk's extended 1m2f, may improve on previous turf form
runners.spotlight: Arrives bidding for a hat-trick after back-to-back wins over Dundalk's extended 1m2f late last year; may improve on previous turf form, and definitely needs to, since his best placing was when seventh of 16 over C&D.

runners.name: Victors Choice
runners.comment: Soft-ground winner at the Galway festival, below that form on final four 2024 starts
runners.spotlight: Soft-ground winner at the Galway festival; below that form on final four 2024 starts; return to form is not of the question on this going.

quotes.race: Arthur Guinness Handicap
quotes.quote: Victor's Choice had a great run here last October when she was second, she was unlucky not to win. That was on soft to heavy so we knew she handled the track and all we needed was a bit of ease in the ground - Adrian Murray, trainer.

runners.name: Yes Oui Si
runners.comment: One good run last season, lost form, ran well off her reduced mark over C&D recently
runners.spotlight: Best run last season when third of 10 in a 1m4f Curragh maiden; failed to build on that; ran well off her reduced mark over C&D recently.

runners.name: Duke Of Leggagh
runners.comment: Two handicap hurdle wins at Naas in February, below since his best since reverting to Flat
runners.spotlight: Won back-to-back 2m handicap hurdles at Naas in February; below his best (over longer trips) in two runs since reverting to the Flat.

quotes.race: William Hill Keep Your Raceday Positive Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: It was ideal conditions for Duke Of Leggagh. He jumped a lot better today. I knew he had improved from the last day, but I didn't think he had improved that much. We'll probably go back to the Flat with him now and he really does like that ground - Mick Mulvany, trainer.

quotes.race: Adare Manor Opportunity Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Duke Of Leggagh ran well last day and on his Flat form he was entitled to win that. Guts won it for him. We'll mix it between this and the Flat but he wants ground like that - Mick Mulvany, trainer

quotes.race: Bective Restaurant Handicap
quotes.quote: Duke Of Leggagh had to win today, trying to win going up 12lb was going to be hard, but he's a lovely horse in the making. It took a while for the penny to drop last year, but it did on his last run at Galway and he is improving all the time. Gary said he had a bit left - Mick Mulvany, trainer

runners.name: Dont Do Dramas
runners.breeder: Al Shira'Aa Farms S A R L
runners.comment: Three-time winner is suited by soft ground, should be better for Leopardstown run
runners.spotlight: Three-time winner is suited by soft ground; should be better for Leopardstown run and was not beaten far; has to reverse form with fifth-placed Zipster.

quotes.race: Guarantee Available On Course & Tote.ie Handicap
quotes.quote: Making the running seems to work for Don't Do Dramas. We would try him over a mile and a half again. It's a good stiff uphill finish here and he wasn't stopping. He handles soft ground well but I think he'll go on most ground, he mightn't want it firm - Mick Mulvany, trainer.

quotes.race: Golf At Gowran Park Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: That was probably Dont Do Dramas ideal conditions out there. He would probably get a little bit further in time. He is learning on the job and seems to be improving. Billy said he was a willing partner and really put his shoulder to the wheel. There is a nursery coming up in Galway for him that we won last year with Duke Of Leggagh - Mick Mulvany, trainer.

runners.name: Gotta Catchem All
runners.owner: Mrs S Bury & Ralph Kelly & Odhran Oneill & Thomas Cox
runners.comment: Maiden put in a bright display over 1m at the Curragh, trainer has his team in good shape
runners.spotlight: Maiden put in a bright display over 1m at the Curragh; trainer has his team in good shape and this longer trip and the addition of a tongue-tie; good each-claims.

runners.name: Goldsmith
runners.comment: All five wins in Britain came on the AW at up to 1m2f, not at his best yet for this stable
runners.spotlight: All five wins in Britain came on the AW at up to 1m2f; not at his best yet for this stable; 50-1 when last of 14 at Dundalk in February.

stable_tour.quote: He was bought relatively cheaply out of David Menuisier's yard and we got him to win his first two races for us, both at Lingfield over 1m2f. He has since run third twice and then eighth at Chelmsford. He may go back there on Thursday because that run wasn't him at his best. He's progressive and his work at home has been good. He'll go well on turf this summer, on good or even quicker ground. 10-05-23

runners.name: Cordouan
runners.breeder: S N C Ecurie De Castillon Et Al
runners.comment: Wins have come on AW, Laytown and on quick ground on turf, going here may be too slow
runners.spotlight: Wins have come on AW, Laytown and on quick ground on turf, going here may be too slow; disappointing at Laytown on final start before joining this yard.

quotes.race: Gilna's Cottage Inn (Q.R.) Race
quotes.quote: Cordouan is a good horse. We bought him from Gosden's, he had not run for over 500 days. He's had a few bits of problems but hopefully we have ironed them out and you could see him in premier handicaps next year - Ado McGuinness, trainer.

runners.name: Seti
runners.comment: AW winner, never in serious contention over C&D last time, turf form is ordinary
runners.spotlight: AW winner; never in serious contention over C&D last time; turf form is ordinary, though opportunities have beenm limited.

runners.name: Doctor Grace
runners.breeder: Dundalk Racing Club& Mrs Barbara McCourt
runners.comment: Unplaced favourite at Dundalk recently, better judged on her previous Bellewstown second
runners.spotlight: Unplaced favourite at Dundalk recently; better judged on her previous Bellewstown second and the fact that her sole turf win was gained over C&D last summer.

quotes.race: Navan Racing Festival November 16th & 17th Handicap
quotes.quote: Doctor Grace wasn't winning out of turn. She is rock-solid in that grade and always runs her race for you when she gets conditions right - Michael Halford, joint-trainer.

runners.name: Barretstown
runners.comment: 3-27 on AW, modest strike rate on turf (1-27) makes it hard to be confident
runners.spotlight: 3-27 on AW; modest strike rate on turf (1-27) makes it hard to be confident; sole turf win came at the main expense of Doctor Grace at Cork last May.

quotes.race: Racing Again June 14th Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: He jumped out well, travelled well and never got hassled for the lead. Barretstown was doing an even enough gallop, took breathers when he could and kept responding. It's good when you have a willing partner like that - Billy Lee, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.name: Fleetfootsoldier
runners.comment: Won three times over 1m in 2023 for his previous trainer, unplaced in light 2024 campaign
runners.spotlight: Won three times over 1m in 2023 for his previous trainer; unplaced in light 2024 campaign; plenty to prove as a result, though one of his two C&D runs was respectable.

runners.name: Flier
runners.owner: Richard Wilmot-Smith & Exors Of The Late Paul Darling
runners.comment: Dundalk winner last time on her 23rd outing, could go well again having made breakthrough
runners.spotlight: Dundalk winner last time on her 23rd outing (including five over hurdles); could go well again having made the breakthrough.

runners.name: Miss Australie
runners.comment: Nothing in her maiden form suggests a strong chance in her first handicap
runners.spotlight: Nothing in her maiden form suggests a strong chance in her first handicap.

runners.name: Picpoul

prev_owners.owner: Exors of the Late Mrs S M Rice

runners.comment: All three wins have been on AW and not at her best when last seen on turf.
runners.spotlight: All three wins have been on AW and not at her best when last seen on turf.

quotes.race: Happy Christmas From All At Dundalk Stadium Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: It's great to get Picpoul back on track, hopefully she'll now go on from this, next week there is another one for her. During the summer she had physio for a back problem but we have her back and I'm delighted with that. We wanted to try hurdling but she won't jump a pole! - Michael Rice, trainer, talking to Racing TV

quotes.race: DundalkStadium.com Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: Picpoul is the first Flat horse that I've trained so I might be looking at getting a few more in! She's a decent filly. We might step her up in trip. There is a two mile race here on Friday week so we'll have a look at that - Michael Rice, trainer.

runners.name: Harseva
runners.comment: Ran well over C&D last season, another fair C&D effort when sixth of 13 on stable debut
runners.spotlight: Ran well when third of 17 over C&D last September; another fair C&D effort when sixth of 13 on stable debut, not far off fourth-placed Oui Si Oui.

runners.name: Matt Connor
runners.comment: Rated 85 in his prime for Henry de Bromhead; handicapper relenting and drops in grade here
runners.spotlight: Won a pair of 1m2f handicaps in the summer of 2023 for Henry de Bromhead; returned from long absence last October and three below-par runs for current yard; handicapper relenting and drops in grade but stamina remains an issue.

runners.name: Black Gem
runners.comment: Placed form in France at up to 2m for N Clement; market best guide on yard debut
runners.spotlight: Placed form in France at up to 2m for N Clement, including on AW; market best guide on yard debut.

runners.name: Miss Gitana
runners.comment: British wins on better ground and doesn't appear especially well handicapped
runners.spotlight: Dual 1m6f winner for Sir Mark Prescott on a sound surface; hurdles form ordinary, placed in Down Royal handicap when last seen in January; ideally wants better ground and doesn't appear especially well handicapped.

runners.name: The Truant
runners.comment: Recent 1m6f winner here not guaranteed to back that up off 4lb higher but respected
runners.spotlight: Was ending a three-year hiatus on the flat when scoring over 1m6f here earlier in the month, hanging left but keeping on well; not guaranteed to back that up off 4lb higher but respected.

runners.name: Scott Lang
runners.comment: C&D winner in 2022, bit to find with stablemate The Truant on recent run here
runners.spotlight: Sole turf win came over C&D two years ago, most recently 4l adrift of stablemate The Truant here earlier this month; balance of form is on better ground.

quotes.race: Tote Guarantee On All Win Bets Handicap
quotes.quote: Scott Lang only travelled okay and got a nice lead. In behind horses, he wasn't really travelling but I just kicked him into the gap just to see what would happen and he picked up nicely. He put it to bed well - Luke McAteer, rider.

quotes.race: Bluegrass Horse Feeds Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Rockview Consort  jumped well. John (McConnell) does a good job schooling his horses at home, he doesn't like to miss with these nice ones first-time out. I kept it simple, it was a nice even gallop and you can do that around here on good ground. It was a pretty good performance and she's one we'll look forward to - Ben Harvey, jockey, talking to Racing TV

quotes.race: Irishinjuredjockeys.com Maiden
quotes.quote: Rockview Consort probably wants further but we said we would have another crack at this trip. It is great to get the win and she will go on turf as well - John McConnell, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: She took a while to win her maiden but did so nicely at Dundalk last time over 1m2½f. She has a 3lb higher rating on the turf and, having given her a break after that success, she'll be brought back for 1m4f handicaps on the grass. She also jumps well and is a possible for some hurdling this summer. 06-04-23

runners.name: Disco Boy
runners.comment: Upped in trip and opening mark looks on the high side
runners.spotlight: Shown promise in bumpers and similar story since he's been switched to the Flat; upped in trip and opening mark looks on the high side.

runners.name: Lady Kai
runners.comment: 5yo mare may not have stopped improving and runs well fresh
runners.spotlight: Progressive filly last year, returning in July to win at Killarney and later won at Dundalk (1m4f); ended season with fair effort here over 1m6f when meeting trouble in running; may not have stopped improving and runs well fresh.

runners.name: No Big Deal
runners.comment: Also-ran in this race last year, of limited appeal back from hurdling
runners.spotlight: Dual-purpose maiden struggled in opening flat handicaps including this race last year; back from hurdling off 4lb lower mark but others preferred.

runners.name: Plains Indian
runners.comment: Much better hurdler, potentially well handicapped back on flat; rider's first mount
runners.spotlight: Decent hurdler was gaining fourth success in that discipline when scoring at Clonmel in November, faded badly in conditions hurdle at same venue following month though; 0-9 on the flat but ran well off 3lb higher at Listowel last year so on a competitive mark; rider's first mount.

quotes.race: Clonmel Oil Service Station Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: I suppose Plains Indian was the class horse in the race being a Listed winner and I know he has been disappointing but the ground was too soft for him all year - Willie Slattery, stable representative.

quotes.race: Dunraven Arms Hotel Novice Hurdle (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Even though his dam is a half-sister to Death Duty I was worried about his stamina because he had been free. I left riding instructions up to Danny and he said there was a good enough pace and Plains Indian settled well. He was off for two years but is back now. I was planning to go for a big handicap at Leopardstown but that's probably gone - Andy Slattery, trainer.

quotes.race: McHale Pro Glide Hurdle
quotes.quote: Plains Indian is an impressive horse and hopefully there is a bit of improvement to come yet. I knew going down to the last I was cantering everywhere so once we got over it he hit the ground running - Cian Quirke, jockey.

quotes.race: Fourmilewater Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Plains Indian had a good confidence booster there and he's a fair horse. As long as the ground isn't too quick he'll probably stay going - Andy Slattery, trainer.

runners.name: Pons Aelius
runners.comment: Never sighted on yard debut at Dundalk; wants better ground
runners.spotlight: Three of six wins in Britain for the Johnston's were on the AW; bought for 5,000gns in October and never sighted on yard debut at Dundalk; wants better ground.

runners.name: Club Manager
runners.comment: Joined yard after poor Limerick effort at Christmas; trip/ground okay, don't rule out
runners.spotlight: Dual-purpose 5yo with wins on flat in Britain and over hurdles this time last year for Gavin Cromwell; joined this yard after poor Limerick effort at Christmas; trip/ground okay, don't rule out.

quotes.race: BoyleSports Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Club Manager jumped better and Sean gave him a lovely ride. He took his time and they went very fast, it sort of fell into his lap really - Gavin Cromwell, trainer

runners.name: Desert Friend
runners.comment: Okay run back on the level at the Curragh last month but needs to step forward from that
runners.spotlight: Seven-time winner in all codes, last Flat win coming at Ballinrobe (1m5f, good) last summer; okay run back on the level at the Curragh last month but needs to step forward from that to feature.

quotes.race: John B. Keane (C & G) Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Desert Friend likes it around here. There wasn't much pace on, I was happy enough. He travelled and he jumped well, and he done it really well in the end. We didn't go much of a gallop which suited him down to the ground and he galloped all the way up the straight - Donagh Meyler, jockey.

runners.name: Sub Rosa
runners.comment: Not much of note so far for this yard, inadequate trip on latest
runners.spotlight: Showed ability in a couple of maidens in 2023 for Roger Varian; not much of note so far for this yard though, inadequate trip on latest.

runners.name: Forlio
runners.breeder: A C Coombs & Mr J William Rowley
runners.comment: Comeback run at Curragh encouraging; unproven at this trip but can't be ruled out
runners.spotlight: Limerick win this time last year came over 1m3f on testing ground; encouraging comeback run at the Curragh last month, missed a Gowran engagement since; only previous try at this trip inconclusive but can't be ruled out.

quotes.race: AOS Security Handicap
quotes.quote: Forlio has done some amount of work but I did think he would need the run. Colin said he didn't really love the ground as it was sticky for him so normal soft would be better for him - Paul Flynn, trainer.

runners.name: Make Good
runners.comment: Long losing run and may just need this although on a nice enough mark for yard debut
runners.spotlight: Better hurdler although hasn't won in well over four years; last Flat win came here over 1m6f in 2020 (soft); absent since October and may just need this although on a nice enough mark for yard debut.

quotes.race: Albert Bartlett Novices' Hurdle (Registered As The Bristol Novices' Hurdle) (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: The trip was a bit of an unknown. John (McConnell) was pretty sure Make Good wanted at least two and a half miles but because of the ground we didn't actually go too quick, so it wasn't a slog. He has had 35 runs before today and a tough, strong horse was always going to be suited by these conditions - Richard Johnson, jockey.

quotes.race: Holden Plant Rentals Novice Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: There didn't seem to be much pace so I didn't want it to turn into a sprint like the last day in Fairyhouse. He missed the last there and got beaten.I wanted to go a good gallop as he seems to have plenty of stamina. He jumped great and did the job nicely - Simon Torrens, rider

runners.name: Glyde Ranger
runners.owner: David Daly & Gerard Shevlin & Ms Denise Mccourt
runners.comment: Trip/ground to suit but recent Gowran run leaves him with a fair bit to find
runners.spotlight: Dundalk winner last October, having won over this trip at Sligo (soft) previous year; recent Gowran run leaves him with a fair bit to find.

quotes.race: Rockshore Cider Handicap
quotes.quote: We schooled Glyde Ranger over hurdles a couple of months back and that's always been in our mind. He's not overly big but is a horse who is starting to find his bit of confidence. We might go for another race on the Flat first but he'll go hurdling before the better ones come out - Tom McCourt, trainer, talking to Racing TV

runners.name: Secret Rock
runners.comment: Best form at 1m4f, barely gets this trip; market best guide on seasonal return
runners.spotlight: Winner on soft at Roscommon in 2023 and scored early last year on AW (both 1m4f); absent since October so market likely best guide on return.

quotes.race: Visit Wexford Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Secret Rock is still putting all the pieces of the puzzle together but hopefully there will be improvement off that. I think that will sharpen him up a lot - Peter Carberry, jockey, speaking to RacingTV.

runners.name: Out For A Stroll
runners.comment: Ran okay on h'cap debut on Flat; hurdle winner since; new trip in this sphere will help
runners.spotlight: Ran okay on handicap debut when last seen on the Flat a year ago and winner over timber since; new trip in this sphere likely to help and she handles testing ground; leading player.

quotes.race: Aqua Process Solutions 3-Y-O Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Out For A Stroll had the experience and I made use of it. She missed one or two but she did everything well for me. The two jumps at the last two really helped me - Peter Smithers, rider.

runners.name: Elle Dorado Rock
runners.comment: Strong-finishing Gowran second on Wednesday; obvious claims with Keane taking over
runners.spotlight: Sole win in either code came on the AW over 2m in January but career-best when strong-finishing close second in Gowran handicap over this trip on Wednesday, having allowed winner first run; Keane now takes over and obvious claims off same mark.

quotes.race: William Hill Top Price Guarantee Handicap
quotes.quote: Elle Dorado Rock was suited when they started to race halfway down the back and he was able to pick them off. He really needs a couple of furlongs extra - Robbie Colgan, jockey.

runners.name: Tara Power
runners.comment: AW winner in February but stamina concerns over this stiff 1m5f on easy ground; reserve
runners.spotlight: Reserve; gained first win since 2021 with a 1m4f AW success in February; safely held twice since at same track; stamina concerns over this stiff 1m5f on easy ground.

runners.name: Too Darn Lizzie
runners.owner: Lord Lloyd Webber & Ms L Spender

runners.name: Benagil
runners.breeder: Blue Gum Farm Aust Pty Ltd
runners.owner: P E & Mrs P A Campbell, R L Byrnes Et Al

prev_owners.owner: G D Thurlow & Mrs P A Thurlow

runners.name: Cinch
runners.owner: Fairview Park Stud Synd, Kianben Bloodstock & Sen Giddy Up

runners.name: Femminile
runners.owner: O T I Racing, Aralet Syndicate Et Al

runners.name: Polymnia
runners.owner: Werrett Bloodstock Pty Ltd, Mystery Downs Et Al

runners.name: Wolfess
runners.owner: M A Sultana, W Sultana Et Al

runners.name: Pelevecchio
runners.owner: B C Dixon, R I Chapman & Ms N Rantanen Reynolds

runners.name: Horizons
runners.owner: Arrowfield Pastoral Pty Ltd, W Freedman Et Al

7:42.race_name: Sportsbet Robert Sangster Stakes (Group 1) (2yo+ Fillies & Mares) (Turf)

quotes.race: Coolmore Wootton Bassett Nunthorpe Stakes (Group 1) (British Champions Series)
quotes.quote: Asfoora has run well but she was 6-4 favourite so you like to see those ones win. She didn't so we're probably a little bit disappointed but it's not as though she's run tenth. She's run well but probably not as well as her last couple. I didn't like her last 50 metres, she was there to run second or at least third and she was a little bit plain in that last little bit. Whether she's reached her peak or she's on the way down, or whether she didn't like the track, I'm not sure. We might go to Ireland for the Flying Five but if anything comes out of the run and we're not happy with her she'll be going home - Henry Dwyer, trainer.

quotes.race: King George Qatar Stakes (Group 2)
quotes.quote: Asfoora has gone as well as we could have hoped and we're very proud of her. You could just tell about 400 metres after the start she just came off the bridle. She's quick but they were a bit quick for her early. Big Evs controlled his own destiny whereas we were stuck behind a couple and got a bit of a bump which probably cost us the win but she's run well and we're more than happy just to be competing - Henry Dwyer, trainer.

quotes.race: King Charles III Stakes (Group 1) (British Champions Series)
quotes.quote: We needed a lead-up run at Haydock, so we were always going to come early, but just with the changing of seasons we wanted to be here before it was too cold in Australia and too warm. We came over in the nice interchange period and Asfoora settled in brilliantly. The proof of that was in the pudding today. I've got to have a look at the race conditions again but we'd love to showcase her a bit. Everyone has just been so good to us over here and I'd love to send her down to Goodwood and up to York, but we'll put the horse first - Henry Dwyer, trainer.

runners.name: Stretan Angel
runners.owner: J M Maclean, Going Again Syndicate Et Al

prev_owners.owner: J M Maclean, Going Again Syndicate Et Al

runners.name: Climbing Star
runners.owner: P Stokes, J Robinson Et Al

prev_owners.owner: Qatar Bloodstock Ltd, P J Stokes Et Al

runners.owner: K J Payne & Mrs V M Payne

runners.name: See You In Heaven
runners.owner: R R Jolly, J Solomon Et Al

runners.owner: P Katelanis, L Le Metayer Et Al

runners.owner: Sheamus Mills Bloodstock Ladies, Newton Ladies Et Al

runners.name: Roll On High
runners.owner: R J Slade, Mhumhain Racing Et Al

prev_owners.owner: Kratzie No 29, P R Lewis Et Al
G D Guest, Ms J V Kewish Et Al

runners.name: Dakota Lee
runners.owner: Mrs L D Gillett, A D Mcclure & J J Huyben

runners.owner: Sheamus Mills Bloodstock P/L & Newton Thoroughbreds Racing

runners.name: Overpass
runners.owner: S G Darby, J Georgatsoulis Et Al

runners.owner: P Duryea, M G Duryea Et Al

runners.owner: Mrs A D Williams, A Latassa & Ms S J Leury

runners.name: Headwall
runners.owner: R A Young, J H Marsden Et Al

runners.name: Rope Them In
runners.owner: S J Wolfe, R P Webb Et Al

runners.owner: M S Jones, Mrs L J Jones Et Al

runners.owner: Canal Enterprises Syndicate, Ms R D Gilchrist & K J Matthews

runners.name: Generosity
runners.owner: S A Millier, X D Franklin Et Al

runners.name: West Star
runners.owner: D F Harris, Ms H Y Chan Et Al

runners.name: Comfort Me
runners.owner: Dr F J Edwards & Mrs M E Edwards

runners.owner: N D Parnham, Mrs C A Parnham Et Al

runners.owner: Oakland Park Stud & Mrs C L Morton
